title: Life-changing app!
review: I downloaded this app not expecting too much from it. The name was cheesy and I figured that any help it could provide would be limited to premium paid users, like so many other health and wellness apps out there. I was so very wrong! Even as a free member, you have access to numerous guided meditations and exercises in a wide variety of styles, goal-based journeys which start simple and can be adapted to your individual needs, and so much more. I found this app to be so incredibly empowering. I felt heard about things that many doctors and professionals had left me feeling uninspired and alone about. I saw that my struggles were not unique to me but also finally gathered the strength to make positive changes in my life. I never use paid apps but hope to soon expand to a premium membership because I can‚Äôt imagine my life without this app and want to see how much more I can grow. If you‚Äôre in doubt about downloading, do it and see for yourself!

title: Too many things going on
review: I wanted to like this app there are some areas where the UI is great, but there were too many things going on at once. My first three days had an easy goal to drink water every morning. I already do that so I thought, ‚Äúok, easy start, great.‚Äù But I opened the app and I gave me an immersive experience to relive my dream then when I closed that another immersive experience to drink water, but the transition wasn‚Äôt informative. Then a woman started talking and music began playing. I‚Äôm at home, but if I had been at work that would have been super awkward. Then I finally got back to the main screen and it had ticked off that I drank water on day 1. I wish I could have ticked the box because that is satisfaction we all enjoy. Instead I just felt confused and frustrated. The app idea is nice and the browse area has awesome info graphics for goals, but the experience to accomplish those is cumbersome. I only used this for a day so I did not give it very long, but I also didn‚Äôt want to after the first experience. I am a big fan of good UI and this was a lot.

title: Excellent for encouragement & accountability
review: I‚Äôve been looking for ways to create more accountability as I work toward creating better habits & routines (in my overall goal of living a life of intention & purpose), and the Fabulous app is THE best one I‚Äôve found so far. I love how it guides me step by step, day by day, to ‚Äúcheck off‚Äù habits as I complete them, even giving recommendations on new habits that I should start, based on my goals. The ambience within the app‚Äîthe soothing & uplifting colors & music, even the voice of the ‚Äúcoach‚Äù in the mini-coaching sessions (2-3 mins)‚Äîis especially appealing to me, as I am a very visual person/learner. There are a few other features within the app that I‚Äôve not yet fully explored; but overall, this app has helped me more in one week than any other accountability & encouragement avenues I‚Äôve tried so far. I look forward to continuing my ‚ÄúFabulous Journey‚Äù and highly recommend & encourage you to check it out to.

title: Life changing! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review:
I am a 38 year old married working mom mother of   2 teen girls ages 17 senior and 11 6th grader who have been distance learning since April while both my husband and I were furloughed for several months but now work from home most of the time when we don‚Äôt randomly have to go in and then have to pray plan b or c for coverage at home when we both have to go in..so basically my stress levels are those of  an average person today.  üòä With all the ‚Äúnew normals‚Äù, habits went out the window for all in this house so I was determined to turn it around by starting with me. 
This app has changed so many aspects of my everyday to a positive state by simply helping me create the simple habit of drinking water daily. That‚Äôs it. The motivational tools used in the app work. I am usually skeptical and horrible at change. I am a create of habit but those habits were not the good kind until now. Now to get my tribe in line! Thank you Fabulous!

title: From a pro about a pro
review: I have been using the fabulous app for over a week. I am a certified athletic mental strength coach, a member and student of the flow genome project, and a professional athlete. At first I found it fundamental but, that is the point. Building the castle one brick at a time. The scientifically researched methods used in the app are pure genius for the ‚Äúbeginner‚Äù. It uses methodology that took me years to discover. It employees neuroaccustics, habit forming simplified (to encourage long lasting positive change) enjoyable graphics and soothing voices, and most importantly it includes an accountability journal for each habit; Ensuring you detail your experience and not just ‚Äúcheck it off.‚Äù I started this app to test as a training supplement for my students and I have enjoyed its approach so much I bought a year membership for myself. Because no matter the education you hold in this field they call ‚Äúhappiness,‚Äù you can always use a new perspective and a a great tool like ‚ÄúFabuloUs!‚Äù

title: Honestly
review: I downloaded this app back in April, and bought the premium version hoping to help keep myself accountable but I fell into a really bad place with my depression and I deleted the app out of guilt. Now 5 months later I am starting school again next week and had a sudden burst in energy to download this app and get a good use of my membership and even though its only been about a week I feel so much better about myself and my productivity because the pacing of the app and how it truly embraced that a little bit of progress goes a long way! My personal favorite part is the little infographics in the discover tab, and for the premium version the ability to join live challenges to mix up your routine if you want/need. Everything is truly catered to your personal experience and growth as long as you are honest with yourself! The app is not judging you, trust me  it is so worth it if you need accountability and organization.

title: Fabulous is fabulous
review:
I‚Äôm a week into using this app and so far I really like it. I love their approach of making big changes using little baby steps and not rushing into too much at once. I wish there was a little more clarity in certain aspects. Like, how soon after waking up do I have to eat for it to still count as breakfast? There were also a couple times I was trying to explore a new goal and in doing so accidentally checked it off when that‚Äôs not what I was trying to do, so navigation isn‚Äôt 100% intuitive, but I wouldn‚Äôt go so far as to call it confusing. 

It seems like as I progress further along I‚Äôll have more say in the habits I focus on too, but the initial ones are good foundations, so I didn‚Äôt mind the lack of choice right off the bat. Plus, when just getting started in forming new healthy habits, it can feel overwhelming where to start since they all seem so important. Overall, I‚Äôm finding this helpful and am looking forward to seeing where it takes me.

title: Love it!
review: Living by myself has been difficult. I get bored and spend so much time on my phone. I can never think of anything else to do. I don‚Äôt know how to break up my day. I don‚Äôt drive so I‚Äôm very isolated, not just because of quarantine, but especially right now because of quarantine. Then I saw this app come up on Instagram and it was advertised with some Myers Briggs types of I remember correctly. Basically saying we could build a routine where my personality type would thrive and I love that. It‚Äôs really helped me find things to do and break up my day and stay motivated to do them by feeling accomplished when I check things off the list, even when it‚Äôs something simple like drinking water or eating breakfast. I feel so much better already and it‚Äôs only day 3. I love this app and I highly recommend it. I would love to subscribe but I prefer to pay month by month and that option doesn‚Äôt exist yet, as far as I know.

title: The most focused on myself I‚Äôve ever been!
review: I‚Äôve tried multiple schedule & routine building apps, including just using google calendar to set goals for myself, but I‚Äôve never been as dedicated to my routines as I am thanks to Fabulous. Not only does the interface make things easy to use, but I love the little positive reminders and motivators. I actually feel excited about my routines because I have something to keep me focused now! I have ADHD and it‚Äôs easy for me to get off topic, but now I just start my fabulous app, put in my headphones, and work my way through each of my goals. I love that there is a feature to set a duration for each task too, it‚Äôs totally customizable! It makes it easy for me to let my timers run, even if I am off the app for a workout or meditation. Thank you, Fabulous team, for making an app that not only helps you with your goals but motivates you to complete them in such a self-love oriented way!

title: It‚Äôs a lot
review:
I was really looking forward to purchasing the premium yearly subscription. I tried the app about a year & half ago when I was at my worst in life but I didn‚Äôt have the energy and motivation to follow through. I decided to give it another try this year, especially with a fresh start of the year and I‚Äôm doing better in life thank God, but there‚Äôs areas of improvement for me, specifically strengthening habits.

The app has so many elements & moving parts to it, it gets too confusing & overwhelming. From the design, to the videos, to the notes, to suggestions. They are all over the place, I tend to miss certain pieces & am jumping throughout the app to make sure i don‚Äôt miss anything. 

I‚Äôm never sure if I indeed checked off drinking water for that particular day or if i should add a afternoon habit & when. Sometimes, a video pops up when i accomplish a goal, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm unable to save the post to share tips on my phone. Maybe I can but like I said, so many moving parts, not simplistic enough especially for those who want to build a habit & ease anxiety like myself.

title: Great, but disingenuous.
review: The app itself is great, the graphics, the ability to achieve your aspirations and track your progress is sound. And the app truly makes you believe that ‚Äúyou can become your future self that‚Äôs better in every way!‚Äù Then like the fine print and sped up voice at the end of the commercial, the app wants you to pay a ridiculous price to ‚Äúfully unlock your potential‚Äù. I realized that no app can truly help you attain greatness, you must examine the situation yourself. Why? Because behind the app is a developer, and what does the developer need? Money, payment, dinero, dough, the big bucks. It seems ironic and comical that they are charging you an unreasonable price for something that should be available to every person on the face of this earth regardless of his/her paycheck; improving their lives and finding self induced-happiness. To keep it short I‚Äôm disappointed, but not surprised. I just ask that this app doesn‚Äôt FORCE the user to upgrade by taunting them with his/her future self. It‚Äôs low, and it defeats the whole purpose in believing that a person can truly improve.

title: Not like other habit apps
review: This is much better designed (and beautiful!!). It‚Äôs really intended for people who need help with a ‚Äúreset‚Äù, especially in my opinion for people struggling with self-care due to mental health. It really encourages you to just do one or two things at first and take it slow, versus automatically giving you access to absolutely everything (and therefore setting you up to fail). Plus it‚Äôs got these cute stories, poems that are sort of like super quick mediation, and REALLY good animation. Plus it‚Äôs got a huge number of tips, gentle reminders, and inspirational messages to go along with the habits. So when it started telling me to eat breakfast every day (which you are technically allowed to delete if you‚Äôre super against breakfast I guess), it also started adding a daily tiny article about food, or breakfast ideas, or (my favorite) reminders to actually buy breakfast foods... Really loving this so far!

title: Love the App; Getting Very Frustrated
review: I love this app. It has helped me do so much to improve my health, both physically and mentally. I have a premium membership, which I was so excited to have gotten on sale. However, with each day I get more and more frustrated with how my money is being spent. The app hardly works at all. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling and reinstalling. Fore example, I check off all of my habits for the day before I go to bed. The app takes forever to boot up. It now only allows me to check off the habits in my morning routine before crashing. Sometimes I‚Äôm lucky to even get that far. Even if I do get to check off my habits, I often have to do it again, as it did not save my progress. This leads to another crash. Note that if the app had had such poor performance, I wouldn‚Äôt have bought my subscription. However, I know how helpful this app can be and I truly hope these issues can be resolved, as I would love to continue using it with success.

title: App has way to many glitches
review: I was so excited when I opened the app and saw all the different options and tools to use, first day went great I was navigating and reading different motivation letters and saw all the activities like yoga and stretch. Second day, I opened the app and saw that I didn‚Äôt have any of the options I had the day before they disappeared. I reloaded the app nothing worked, I messaged the company and was told that somethings disappear to avoid overwhelming....counterproductive because I added stretch as a habit and could not go into ‚ÄúMake Me fabulous‚Äù to show me the stench routine. Didn‚Äôt make sense but I continued. Third day opened the app all the option are a available again....but now my ‚Äúletters‚Äù or ‚Äúreads‚Äù that give you advice on your journey have nothing to read once I open them, they are blank. I‚Äôm disappointed because if it worked correctly it would be amazing to use. But so far it‚Äôs has way to many issues with working properly. Will give it the week trial and if continues will not subscribe.

title: Beautiful, inspiring app
review: I‚Äôve struggled with keeping habits consistent for most of my life. The hardest one‚Äîdrinking enough water (okay really, drinking ANY water....what do you mean tea doesn‚Äôt count?!). Just in five days, I‚Äôm finding myself refilling my reusable water bottle a couple times a day. It used to take me more than a day, sometimes more, to finish a single bottle. This app is has inspiring, supportive, gentle influence to really put the habit controls in your hands while giving you the reasons it‚Äôll help in the long run. And it‚Äôs an app that celebrates you WITH you in beautiful storytelling, meditations, numerous choices of habits you‚Äôd like to improve/create, and it truly understand the human side of habit creation. I am so, so happy I downloaded this app. And I‚Äôm so, so happy I purchased the year subscription for more support. I was not a creature accepting of change.... but ask me again in a month when my current results are amplified.

title: Wonderful but a little complicated
review:
A lot of moving parts/themes/ multi-part metaphors and features makes this feel slightly less cohesive and user friendly than I‚Äôd like. After all my problem is that I complicate my routines  and objectives and that‚Äôs why I sought an app to help me. But it IS very good at tracking habits and offering motivation as well as sound principles and reasons for each step. I‚Äôm a fan! 

 I‚Äôve at least been drinking water and usually eating breakfast as well as calming my self before bed‚Äîthe three default habits the app starts you with. Aaaand I attached some other habits to the ones mentioned without actually logging them, just as part of completing the other steps like making my bed as I drink water in the morning and doing my skin care routine as part of my nightly coaching and wind down. It‚Äôs only been (almost) three weeks but this is the most consistent I‚Äôve been with anything, so I‚Äôm excited to streamline more parts of my life!

title: Great app so far!!
review:
First off, to all the people complaining about the trials,

You don‚Äôt have to buy the subscription to use the app, there is an exit button at the top of the screen. Then after that the app explains that you need to start small. Then it has you drink water for three days. If you already do that just wait three days, but if your angry that it‚Äôs such a simple thing, read the app. You don‚Äôt need to rush into everything so fast! Taking it slow is nice sometimes.

Ok, now to the review! I downloaded this app about a half hour ago and love it! I like how it uses your name to make it seem more personalized. Apps that do that are really awesome because they grab your attention. I also like how easy it is to set up. I set it up in under a minute. I just had to answer a few questions and I was off! It gives you tips on how to achieve goals.

I also love how it takes it slow while still moving fast. Some apps have no introduction to self care at all and just tell you to set a goal. This app isn‚Äôt like that. It tells you a bit about the app and asks you a few questions, gives you a task and tells you why you should do it. It also doesn‚Äôt say, right you have the app now your on your own! It has a pre-made routine for you to follow! 

I‚Äôm going to use this app a lot, I‚Äôll edit once I‚Äôve seen how it is! ‚ù§Ô∏è great app!!

title: Didn‚Äôt know it needed this but I‚Äôm glad I found it
review: I thought I was disciplined at first but this app has really helped me. I didn‚Äôt read everything or set alarms to keep myself in check the first time I downloaded this app bc I didn‚Äôt think I needed an app to help keep me in check. This time I took it seriously, read everything it had to offer and actually did what it said even when I didn‚Äôt want to. Now I actually look forward to my me time morning routine bc I notice I‚Äôm not as stressed during the day! Another plus is... this had made me realize if you don‚Äôt take care of yourself mentally and physically then you start to care less about helping others. This app was a breath of fresh air. Keep it up even when you don‚Äôt feel like it, set alarms to keep you on track and it‚Äôs an amazing feeling when your body starts getting in sync with your habits. ‚ù§Ô∏è You can do it!

title: I really like this app so far.
review: I‚Äôve only been using it for a few days, but it‚Äôs colorful, has lovely artwork and music, and really helps guide you to build better habits. My favorite thing I‚Äôve noticed, is that the app did not recommend adding more goals within the first few days. An app that encourages you to take small baby steps, and feel good about those steps, without demanding too much of the user to start out, shows that the app creators really understand LASTING habits and how to build them. I also really like the cute poems you get every day that continue ‚Äúyour story,‚Äù I find them cute and uplifting and look forward to them every day. I usually don‚Äôt take the time to review apps, but I feel really good about this one. It easy fits into my morning routine and encourages me to have a good morning, rather than sitting and scrolling through Twitter, as I usually do.

title: Great app, can be a little confusing to navigate
review: I tried this app last year (free version) but found it kind of slow and confusing to navigate. Huge fan of Ariely‚Äôs behavioral science strategies for change. I truly believe this is the way to truly experience change. That said, the app works great, unless I use it in a different way. One day I got distracted and stopped logging my morning routine between habits. Came back an hour later and could only get it to confirm the habit as completed for tomorrow, not today. This tends to frustrate the perfectionistic part of me that wants to see her streak grow. That said, when I can be more relaxed and go with the flow, it‚Äôs really helpful. I restarted a week ago (paid version) and am really enjoying it. If you‚Äôre looking for an evidenced based way to improve your life, Fabulous is worth a try for the 7 day free trial (can get a free month for though their desktop site, but then have higher yearly fee).

title: Worth. Every. Cent.
review: I am someone who thrives when in a structured environment and when being told what to do and how to do it, so this app is perfect for someone like me. It allows me to grow slowly and at a sustainable pace. Because I‚Äôm someone who forgets that you have to take care of your physical body because I‚Äôm constantly working, it‚Äôs wonderful that it reminds me when to do small things that I forget to do like floss or eat breakfast or even drink water or make the bed. It has a TON of tools to help you with mindfulness, like built in meditations with instructions, guided yoga, and it prompts you to do a bunch of other stuff you‚Äôd never think to do for yourself like express gratitude for small things. Overall, as the simpleton that I am, this is exactly what I needed to get my 2020 self back in order while I‚Äôm stuck home and it‚Äôs very likely I‚Äôll use this app for the foreseeable future.

title: An App That Makes a Real Difference
review: Last weekend I deleted two social media apps on my phone that I was spending 3-6 hours engaging with daily. I replaced them with a set of apps & tools to train myself to engage with new habits that promote productivity, achievement, and a sense of well-being. This app is one of those four! In fact, this app is my primary driver throughout the day. My days now have a beginning, middle, end. I am engaged in ways that make guide me to being present, inspired, and motivated to keep going. After first, we started small - 3 days in a row of drinking water. Then I added afternoon and evening routines. The app sends a morning, afternoon, and evening coaching clip - SUPER GOOD. I was very pleased by the variety of options of new habits to form. I love the storytelling rpg style of progress, as well as the Focus Zen Mode that walks me through each step in my routine with prompting questions.

title: Solidly based in CBT & will change your life
review:
Pay for the premium.  If you follow the program, I *guarantee* you will change your life for the better.  After nearly a decade of being bedridden by disability, all my former structure & good habits were gone.  I‚Äôm doing better now & am trying to re-enter the world, so to speak. Fabulous is helping me rebuild not just my daily habits, but all aspects of my life.  I get far more value from this program than it costs.

The site is very deep, with many options so you build a journey that works for and with YOU, not some standardized hypothetical being that never walked the face of the earth.

I don‚Äôt have time to give an in-depth review because I‚Äôm too busy being Fabulous ‚Äî and your journey will be different than mine, anyhow.  But if you‚Äôre ready to commit to changing your life in any way, Fabulous will help you achieve your goals and feel fulfilled.

(Though dear developer guys, bad verse is just bad verse.  The writer of the daily story segments isn‚Äôt good enough to pull it off.  Editors should have warned you that these forced rhymes actually detract from the comprehension process, not enhance them.  Also, you need a proofreader ‚Äî each day I find typos, grammar errors, etc. ‚Äî not tons, but always at least one.  I know that‚Äôs the new normal, but I don‚Äôt care.  Proofread your site.  Thanks.)

title: Love this app perfect for building habits even with ADHD
review: I feel like I often get distracted when trying to form new habits or get discouraged when I lack the motivation to follow through on a new task I was so excited for (involving self care, a new craft project etc) and this app is such a nice gentle way to ease into practicing healthier habits, I love the ‚Äúfabulous moments‚Äù and the slow stream of suggested habits. I feel like with other planning apps it leaves it all up to the user as to what you need to do and when and all those choices can seem overwhelming. I really appreciate the gentle introduction and slow adding of new habits which I‚Äôve found has made them more lasting. The only reason I deducted a star is because the reminders don‚Äôt always  show up for me in terms of notifications or noises when I need them which can be a little frustrating and it is 60 dollars a year which is a lot for me and I‚Äôm sure some of you

title: Had to Start Everything Over
review: I can start by saying that I really think this is an incredible app. I‚Äôve been using Premium for months to create stable, lasting lifestyle changes, and I‚Äôve made it through four of the journeys. Recently I got a new phone and noticed that, after transferring the app from my old phone to the new one, there was an issue with the text in my letters not showing up. I thought I would delete the app and redownload it and see if that help. But when I tried to log in again and load up all of my previous progress, it said that no data could be found. I lost four months of progress. Had I known that I was supposed to be syncing my app info manually all this time, I would have no issues and would easily have given this five stars. But periodic syncing is supposed to be a feature of the Premium subscription, so long as the app is connected to wifi. Feeling very frustrated and questioning what I‚Äôm actually paying for.

title: Highly recommend if you feel pulled towards change, but don‚Äôt know where to start.
review:
I could go on forever about why I‚Äôve been looking for an app like this. I discovered it from a YouTuber (gentlewhispering/sassy masha vlogs) and it has been wonderful. 

The app is simple and has a lot of features you typically see as in app purchases elsewhere. You can choose whichever habits you‚Äôd like to start including in your morning/afternoon/evening rituals, there‚Äôs ambient music, timers for tasks or goals, and encouraging little snippets scattered throughout. 

It‚Äôs not cheesy either. A lot of this stuff is backed by research and the positive affirmations actually help habits stick. I‚Äôve been using it for two weeks now. I haven‚Äôt been perfect at staying on top of my daily rituals and habits, but I‚Äôm becoming more mindful every single day and I can FEEL the improvement. I‚Äôm super impressed. Give it a try.

title: So glad I found this app. You will be too!
review:
New year, time to make some changes. Although this wouldn‚Äôt be the first time I‚Äôve said that before. I‚Äôve tried to get some helpful habits going times before, but just kept losing motivation so quickly.
I‚Äôve tried a few other apps, and honestly, some of those I tried may work for other people. But I can say Fabulous is the only one that works for me.
Part of the reason I would lose motivation before was I thought too big at a time, and I had trouble getting started small without coaching. This app helps with that, by starting very small, and it coaches you along the way. It really is a personal feeling app.
It helps you introduce more and more little goals, building habits in steps and bringing them all together. Before you know it, you‚Äôve already made big changes. The community feeling of it makes it feel quite down to earth, and to me that makes it easier to stay motivated. When you know tons of other people are doing the same thing as you, you all help each other out, and everyone gets to where they want.
It really is amazing what you can do without ever paying anything. I might upgrade some day, but for now I‚Äôm real happy with Fabulous.

If you‚Äôve got it figured out, then keep going! If not, then give this app a try.

title: Slow to respond ‚Äî lots of steps
review: The app allows you to pick daily routines but when the daily routine opens it goes into its own process for example the step to drink water every day when you open it it puts on this music and the screen is locked you cannot get out of it it doesn‚Äôt allow you to check off that you drink water until it goes through this 10 or 15 minute process and then if you don‚Äôt stay it reverts back and you have to try and do it again it would not let me click on anything and then as far as other daily routine activities it would not allow you to pick too many which is good but it had it separated in the morning afternoon evening so for example if you wanted to tidy your room or make your bed it wouldn‚Äôt allow you to make that a morning routine the only morning routine would was drink water.  Way too complicated to use really not worth it it should be easier to pick two things you want to do every morning. Get a reminder make your bed allow you to check that you make your bed that‚Äôs it but it‚Äôs not that simple

title: So far great app!
review: I‚Äôve only been using the app for a few days now, but the pace and routine forming capabilities are clear.  I find the tips and journey videos quite soothing and thoughtful.  I would have given a 4.5 star but can‚Äôt do halves.  I have two things I‚Äôd love to see, one, when it suggests I share my progress it‚Äôs showing me an image I thought would go with my share, but in reality the only thing that shares is a link for the app...not a big deal, but probably won‚Äôt share that way anymore.  The second thing I‚Äôd like to see, being able to get back to videos or recordings that were available on previous days.  Like today, I was doing my breathe routine and there wasn‚Äôt any pop up guidance on different breathing techniques like there was the previous 3 days; or sometimes I missed part of the journey video because the kids interrupted.  It‚Äôd be nice to be able to see these somehow.

title: Shady sales practices
review:
If you ask me a life changing app will not need to shake you down for cash.  The impact will be so significant that the cost will be irrelevant.  I downloaded this app after it peaked my interest.  I tried it out a little but it did not relate super well with me.  I attempted to turn off the subscription after two days because I knew I had not yet fell in love with it.  

Low and behold 10 days in, I was still somehow charged the recurring subscription fee.  I attempted to immediately ask the app customer service for a refund as I was not interested.  The app makers literally have no process for completing refunds for any situation, period.  Apple did give me a refund when I submitted a request.  

Stand by your product, and only make a sale when you know your customer is getting good value.  I don‚Äôt believe for a second, that you are interested in changing peoples lives.  It appears you think you have to sales pitch everyone hard and then steal their money when they are not interested in your app.  Disgusting, how do you sleep at night?

title: NO trial week! So be sure you want it!
review:
I tried this app one day, it was not what I wanted.  I deleted the app and went to cancel my subscription.  It WILL give you a free week, but it WILL NOT allow you to cancel the subscription during your free week!   Day 1: I tried it and deleted the app within 2 hours.  I could not delete the subscription!  Apparently they charge you immediately!  Day 2: I received a ‚Äúpaid subscription‚Äù receipt from Apple.  So, apparently their ‚Äúfree week ‚Äú is a week you don‚Äôt pay for, but you have already paid for your subscription!
I still have 5 days in the ‚Äúfree‚Äù week, and supposedly can cancel the subscription up to a day ahead of the subscription date.  Not only will it not allow me to delete the subscription, but they had the nerve to Bill me in day 2 of my ‚Äúfree‚Äù week.  FALSE ADVERTISING - they give you the impression you get a free week, and then decide if you want to subscribe. ‚ÄúDelete the subscription anytime up to a day ahead of the renewal.‚Äù  They don‚Äôt tell you the ‚Äúrenewal‚Äù date is as soon as you use the app.  TOTAL RIP-OFF.
developerResponse: {'id': 21377252, 'body': "We're sorry to hear this. Immediate charges can be the result of having authorized a trial under the same Apple ID account in the past. If we're able to assist you, then we can be reached by completing the form via hello@thefabulous.co ", 'modified': '2021-03-01T18:39:38Z'}

title: Small oversights, but it WORKS
review:
Honestly, I find the app a little annoying. I kept the notifications on for the first two months while habits were being established, then turned them off once I was confident I‚Äôd check in to check off my habits. I don‚Äôt want to be notified of the daily coaching. I would love to move deep thinking from my evening routine to my morning routine, when I tend to do it anyway. There are some typos and other proofing oversights that are a little irksome. It‚Äôs not the most intuitive app to navigate at first. 
But despite all of my criticisms and reasons to dislike it - IT JUST WORKS. I tried on my own to establish a morning routine for six months. I made charts, I simplified it, I assessed what was working and what wasn‚Äôt - and I was unsuccessful for six months. So this app gets four stars because it really helps establish meaningful routines - it works. It drives me a little crazy, but I love it and am grateful for it.

title: Trial could be longer & app could be better....
review: When I joined they automatically started me on a 7 day free trial which is over tomorrow. Honestly I can‚Äôt learn and do enough in such a short time even stuck at home because I‚Äôm still busy and have so many other things I have to do like taking care of my terminally ill mom. They let you send a free gift of a 30 day trial to anyone when you only get 7 days yourself to decide if you can afford & will pay hundreds or so for continued premium membership! Btw I sent my friend who‚Äôs been depressed and could really use this the 30 day free trial that I couldn‚Äôt get & he said link did NOT work anyways and that it makes no sense to only give 7 days but let‚Äôs you offer gift of 30 days trial to others! I really need and use things like this in my life but simply don‚Äôt have enough time & cant afford the prices they ask either. Is there any real self help things that work that offer enough help for free or cheaper anymore?

title: Amazing!
review: This app is great for people who have trouble with motivation.  I have ADHD and this has helped me focus and stay motivated without overwhelming me.  It helps the whole dopamine deficiency issue that comes with the disorder by setting small goals that are easy to achieve so I can stay motivated.  I‚Äôve started meditating and praying consistently as well as doing yoga.  I‚Äôve done better remembering to take my pills.  I might suggest having an option where we can have different goals on different days, because I am in school right now, and while it‚Äôs great to have someone remind me to go to class, I can‚Äôt very well do that on a Sunday.  But overall, this app has seriously helped me keep a positive and health mindset, and I feel much better than I did before.  This is like antidepressants without the fear that I‚Äôm somehow messing up my body.  Amazing job!

title: Exactly what I needed
review: This past year I‚Äôve been getting into the habit of having a daily checklist. Doing it on paper was less effective because I would forgot most of the things on my list later in the day. This app does an amazing job at motivating and reminding me to stay on top of my goals! Ive only been using it for a little over a week, but Fabulous was exactly what I was looking for! I finally feel like I have all the resources to get serious about my routine. Thank you for the work this team has done to create such an amazing program. The $40 for the year is totally worth it considering how much extra classes and awesome manifestation techniques they provide. If you‚Äôre looking to connect with your mind, body, and spirit and finally gain balance and self discipline in life, this is the app for you! 10/10 would recommend!!!

title: Wow awesome coaching so far....
review:
I love that it starts off simple with, just drink water when you wake up. Then you add habits at your pace. And it‚Äôs with you every day, all day, for if you need those reminders or pick me ups. And You can snooze that 2:00 walk but 30 minutes later, hey it‚Äôs time for that walk. And tidbits or real ideas of why these things work, why fish or flax is good for you, why celebrating putting those shoes on with a happy dance is actually important! I‚Äôve been at this a month already and I‚Äôm still building? Not looking for excuses? This is shocking peoples!
 I want to give it a 4, because I want to share some of this stuff with my friends/fam but they have to sign up to see anything. So it‚Äôs hard to get people excited for me, or for Fabulous when they don‚Äôt want to add it, without seeing what it‚Äôs about first. That‚Äôs a bummer.

title: Content is great, app could use some tweaking
review:
Love the content. Self-care has never been so easy, and it‚Äôs the kind of self-care that actually fills my cup with minimal effort. Love the music, love the ability to reconnect with myself throughout the day when I need a grounding moment. The app makes it easy to have a moment to recharge with hardly any effort on my part, but it‚Äôs still effective. 

The app sometimes is hard to navigate, maybe it‚Äôs just me. I feel like I need to sit down and look through stuff and figure out where things are, and sometimes it will make noise and it won‚Äôt be quiet even if I leave the app. Sometimes I‚Äôm not in a place to listen to the really calm and refreshing music and I can‚Äôt get it to turn off so I‚Äôm frantically pushing buttons to get it off. 

That‚Äôs the only reason for the 4/5, otherwise definitely a worthwhile app, definitely continuing past the free trial.

title: Productivity Partner
review: I‚Äôve recently come out of a very challenging season in life and have found it extra difficult to follow through with healthy habits that had formerly been rituals for me. I was worn out and tired of failing at reinstating them - I realized I really needed help. The first time I tried this app I came at it with an attitude of ‚ÄúHow could this really help me?‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just drinking water? That‚Äôs dumb. I need something more intense than that.‚Äù The truth is, I needed to start as small as waking up and drinking water first thing. It gave me something to look forward to the next day and it kicked some of my former healthy habits back into gear. This app has been very helpful for me to get back on track in my life, manage my time well, and prioritize what matters most to me. This app is an answered prayer. I am grateful for the wonderful minds and hearts that God inspired to design this app.

title: Motivating to succeed in little things
review: Helps to realize you can finally succeed at the little things if other things in your life keep dragging you down, you learn to celebrate the little things and carry them over to bigger. :) As a Christian and a nurse working with heavy-care/COVID patients, I've been changing the affirmations to remind myself that I may not have the energy to start these changes on my own but Jesus can give that to me. He knows all the pain and loneliness and defeat that my patients and I feel. He felt all of those same emotions and desperation and suggest when he died on the cross for everything we've done wrong, he's there 24/7 when I beg him for energy, patience, love, ask for forgiveness. This app is a step in helping me not get into unhealthy depressed patterns when I leave work. So I'm really grateful for it.

title: Pretty dumb
review: Its a bit convoluted. Seems like its for people who want to completely take away any autonomy and responsibility for themselves by having an app tell them every little thing they should do. Sometimes that works but‚Ä¶ it works for mindless drones. I wanted something to create for myself, not have it created for me. Im pretty sure I can figure out when and how I drink water thanks‚Ä¶ In short, its a gimmick to get your money and to data-mine you. Thats about it. No daily planner should need to have my email. And theres something laughably ironic on an app‚Ä¶ for your phone‚Ä¶ that is trying to help you get away from your phone and social media‚Ä¶ with an app that encourages you to socialize on it. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è talk about missing the point‚Ä¶ thats how you know they're just making yet one more junk self-help aid to add to the heap of all the other failed self help books and apps and videos and money schemes out there‚Ä¶ since theres no shortage of sufferers of life out there theres no shortage of predators like this‚Ä¶

title: Best App for Creating a Schedule!
review:
I bought the full version of the app due to the appeal and simplicity of use. I‚Äôm a firm believer that if you use small habits over time you are more apt to stick with them. I‚Äôm also bipolar and a schedule is an absolute need in my life. 

So, in the afternoon and evening (the morning is already set up within the app) I made a list of three to four things I could easily accomplish, and they wouldn‚Äôt take up a lot of time to do. The only thing I can‚Äôt figure out is how to add to the afternoon and evening lists if I want to.

The app also keeps you accountable as well. You HAVE to check off what you‚Äôve done in order to get credit for the day. I love that feature. It has a push feature to send you notifications throughout the day. 

The menu is easy to navigate. It‚Äôs a simple scroll feature which doesn‚Äôt leave you searching all over the place for ticking off boxes as your day goes on. For the first week it gives you a little story that you travel through which is a nice little touch.

I love the discovery tab it has. It gives you tips and tricks to use everyday (and they are different everyday) to change your habits to make your life a little more healthier. 

I have yet to find something I hate about this app.

title: Love it but I‚Äôm worried
review:
I love this app, it‚Äôs the first one that I‚Äôve actually stuck with for more than a few days. It‚Äôs not overwhelming because it doesn‚Äôt give you a long list of things to do right out the gate. Instead, you get one habit added at a time so you get used to it and comfortable with it.

My only issue is that the morning routine is very clearly made for people who wake up around 6-7am and are working from home or work 9-5 jobs. As someone who works at 4am in an actual shop, it‚Äôs really starting to worry me that I might not be able to keep up with the morning routine because I don‚Äôt want to wake up any earlier than I have to.

I wish there was a function when signing up where you could input your regular work hours so it would be adjusted accordingly and then people like me wouldn‚Äôt feel so bad about completing the morning routine in the afternoon.

title: It works
review:
This app should absolutely be tried by anyone who has personal goals they need help achieving.  This app introduces simple things which immediately work.  For example, drinking water when you FIRST wake up does actually make a huge difference for the entire day (or at least it does for my day).  The other suggested small methods also boost your day. 

Why 4 stars?  This app is designed and targets females which isn‚Äôt a bad bias, but doesn‚Äôt completely help the male audience.  If for example i could choose which gender (male/female) was using the app, the examples might make more sense. The whole point is that this app is self help, of course the examples are understandable, but if i have to try and view it from a different gender, the content is less effective. When you use the app, you‚Äôll see what I‚Äôm referring to. 

Other than that, this app is great and has many valuable uses.

title: Fabulous!
review: This is a great habit app. They tell you which habits to start based on what your goal is. What I love is that it‚Äôs split up to where you start with the foundational habits. You start so small, but are still so encouraged to where it‚Äôs not over whelming so that you can build that confidence. The encouragement helps because then you don‚Äôt feel stupid for starting so small. I love this app and have recommended it to others. This app is so different than any other habit trackers and it is definitely the most effective. It‚Äôs also nice how customizable it is. You can change the time for your routine so that it fits your schedule, you can delete, add or reorganize each habit. You can also set reminders to help you stay on track. This is such an essential app. I recommend it to anyone looking to be a better you.

title: Don‚Äôt Buy if your serious about being productive
review: I desperately want you to cancel and get a refund for the year that I paid.  This app is fun for procrastinators.  The moment that you become a productive person it is worse than instagram.  They force you to answer their surveys and other time consuming ‚Äúmotivational‚Äù things that get in the way of actually logging your progress.  After giving myself a detox for a few months i opened the app today to see how much of my checklist I completed and to log my progress of the day.  After the 8th screen that did not have an exit button a realized how foolish I was to buy this app (I couldn‚Äôt even get access to the daily log because of all of the questions) and I put just a pinch of my frustration in this review.  I wish that i could just get my money back because Im erasing this distracting app any way. They really really need an option for people to turn off all of the surveys and add, they are probably selling our information anyway even after we pay for the service. ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Fabulous
review: This is seriously one of the best self help apps I have ever used. And I have only been using it for 5 days now but it has already helped me change some of my habits. You start out slow. Just reach one goal, something small like drinking water when you wake up. And do this for 3 days in a row. And then you build on with other goals. It‚Äôs very encouraging and peaceful. I do not get overwhelmed with it. I feel like there are a lot of tools included in this app that can help you be successful. I struggle a lot with depression and anxiety, and it is just amazing for me to be able to notice a difference in just a short time.  So far, I‚Äôm in love. I wanna give a huge thanks to the whole Fabulous team. Thank you for creating such a beautiful, creative, mind blowingly helpful app. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

title: Lovin‚Äô it!!!
review: Hi I‚Äôm an eleven year old girl who was always desperate to be perfect and healthy. I looked at all these different apps, and they all need premium to do ANYTHING!!! It‚Äôs like those apps want people to pay a lot of money for premium and be like, that was such a ripoff! With fabulous, they too ask for premium, but you can actually do stuff at least! This app actually wants people to succeed. It is helping me a lot, motivating me, giving me advice, helping me exercise, helping me form healthy habits, helping me relax, and especially with the virus, I am very grateful for this app‚Äôs help! It‚Äôs a lifesaver. I ca NOT relax without this app, especially since my family is moving this Saturday. So if you‚Äôre reading this, just know that if you want to be healthy and happy without paying money, try fabulous! I really love it and I hope you will too! Peace out!

title: Almost too beginner
review: I enjoy this app thus far (2.5 days) because you can personalize it and it helps you grow gradually by giving you the option to slowly add more habits and work them into your existing schedule. However, this is a very optimistic approach that almost comes off as a recorded voice talking down to me. From someone who could write the book on introductory psychology, I felt that it was targeted to a complete newb to this type of thinking that relied more on a ‚Äúyou gotta trust me‚Äù than ‚Äúhere‚Äôs the science behind what we‚Äôre saying if you‚Äôre curious‚Äù. So far, that‚Äôs the only reason for subtracting 1 star. I back the content 100%, but I would love an explanation of why for people who need one. I prefer having why-options for when I‚Äôm learning because I feel it makes it easier to comprehend and move forward with a new concept. Maybe that‚Äôs just me?

title: Fantastic app, if you want to get your life together
review: I‚Äôve only had this app for a couple of weeks, but after my free trial I immediately signed up for the super cheap price of $40 a year because it genuinely helped me build new and different habits which I never would‚Äôve thought could help my life. I‚Äôm better at staying focused, more energized throughout my the day, and even have even started sleeping better (literally that‚Äôs a fact because I have a sleep tracker)! I excercise more, eat less (and better) and you wouldn‚Äôt believe I barely even notice I‚Äôm doing any of it because I just get a little reminder here and there to stay positive and keep going. They have a fantastic assortment of habits to build and the best part you do it at your own pace. Thank you so much for making my life Fabulous, fabulous. :)

title: Honestly incredible
review:
I get lazy most times to do anything. It doesn‚Äôt matter if I‚Äôm hungry or I‚Äôm thirsty, the less work the better. Though after I stumbled upon Fabulous, I tried to motivate myself to be better (because life is a jerk). I thought from start that they would go on telling me to eat better and exercise, funny enough they didn‚Äôt. They started small and allowed me to climb on up to the top. First it was water, then breakfast (which I will say was hard to keep up with but I pushed myself), and after a long while then did they ask me to start exercising. 

It was weird in the sense that they started small. But I get it, they were trying to train my mind first before my actions, which is really helpful. So if you‚Äôre having trouble just go through this app‚Äôs instructions and u should be golden.

title: Amazing. Definitely recommend.
review: As a person that struggles with a lot of mental illnesses, I have a hard time taking care of myself a lot of the time. Im 20 and I have a hard time remember to even eat. With this app, even without the premium add-on, it has helped motivate me. I went on a break and didn‚Äôt check in and I dreaded coming back but then I came back to a huge party for myself on the app saying how proud of me they were for taking a break. It makes me look forward to every step of the way. Proud of myself and even with the challenges, I started to love and appreciate myself more. It‚Äôs changed my life genuinely and if you struggle with basic things and want a healthier routine to improve yourself then this is the app for you ‚ù§Ô∏è I personally am going to continue using it for a long time.

title: Love It! Only one criticism.
review:
Love this app!! This is the first app that I have actually felt was relevant and applied to my life and my personality and wasn‚Äôt a pain actually completing the goals I set. I am sincerely grateful to the creators of this app. I am turning 40 yrs old soon and I needed serious change and I wanted it done by my 40th birthday. I honestly feel that I will accomplish my goal now and I know it‚Äôs due to Fabulous! 

My only complaint is that I think that this app should allow full access for 14 days before committing to any subscription or asking for payment info. Once I started my new routines and saw that I was actually working on myself due to this app, all I wanted to do was share it with my children, my family, and friends. I know tho that none of my family would see the benefit because of it asking for subscription and payment at the very beginning even with the 30 day pass I sent out. 

Otherwise I recommend this to everyone and anyone that honestly and wholeheartedly wants to change their daily routines, their self esteem, or anything about themselves or lives for the better. 

Thank you Fabulous Team for helping me reach my life, love, and health goals before my birthday, I will be forever grateful! 

Sincerely,
Sarah

title: Helpful with Bipolar ‚Äî Needs a Couple Updates
review:
I have never written an app review before but this warrants it. 

They say one of the best things to help with bipolar disorder is to set a firm routine and this app has helped me tremendously with that. I feel like I have accomplished something just by completing little daily tasks and keeping on schedule. It tells you to celebrate your little victories and this is a huge plus for me. Gratification has always been an issue of mine. I love it for that. 

The only things that I would amend would be something like a ‚Äúvacation mode‚Äù because when I am away or I have company I‚Äôm not always able to achieve each of my daily goals. This makes me feel like I haven‚Äôt done enough with my day. The inability to do that task sets me back. 

For instance: when it is pouring outside and my goal is to take a short walk with my dog, I am unable to do so and it sets me back for the day. My boyfriend stays over and feels that he needs television to sleep so I stay up later than I want to to ‚Äúunplug and darken the room.‚Äù

I also work nights, and I don‚Äôt feel like the app properly accounts for that.

Overall, though, I love it. I have recommended it to my therapist and will continue to use it for the sense of responsibility and accomplishment I feel at the end of the day.

title: A very helpful app
review: This is a very helpful app so far. My mind is not very organized at the beginning of projects so this app really helps me to focus on getting myself prepared before each task or project I take on which has been helpful because I've been a procrastinator since I was kid due to anxiety issues. This is definitely helping me find simple and easy ways to cope with procrastinating and dealing it in small steps every single day. The best part, if you don't compete a task, the app won't judge you which wag key because my habit since childhood was always to judge myself and then I'd feel bad or guilty for not completing the task. The app, however, will simply give an encouraging, safe place to retry or start all over again. Great app so far. Safe space to be yourself and make mistakes is,to me, the key.

title: Second time user
review: I used this app about a year ago (2019) and stopped using it because as I added habits it got confusing. I was unsure how to toggle from one screen to the next and if I clicked that I had finished a task in one screen it wouldn't always tally it on another. I am finding the same thing is happening this time around. I have learned how to better use it the second time, but it is still disheartening when you know you have completed a part of a journey but it wasn't counted. and even what screen meant what and whaThis is my second time using it and I realized that the home screen is split between ‚Äúyour journey‚Äù and ‚Äúyour routines‚Äù and not just random information on the page, it could still be defined more. I really like the journey stories, they are motivating and make your journey epic. And really, these habit changes are epic.

title: Mindset is everything
review: So I downloaded this app for the free trial to help me get my mind right. I had no intentions on keeping it butttt my card was charged after forgetting to cancel ü§£ anywho, I figured if I have this app now, I might as well use it. This is purely for your benefit and I‚Äôd like to think anyone who‚Äôs downloading this app has reached there end point and want to make a change in their life. I‚Äôve been keeping up with the gratitude challenge for a few days and it‚Äôs really been changing my perception in life and I notice a difference in how I am. I participate in the other challenges and I know it‚Äôs for my best interest and the best thing is, you chose the challenges you want to take. This is all at your own pace. If you have the right mindset, this will work through in your daily life like a breeze.

title: Confusing App, terrible layout/UI
review:
I really wanted to love this app - I was looking for something to help form habits and make small improvements. This seemed perfect and I pushed forward, purchasing an annual subscription. I regret this. 

The user experience is terrible. It‚Äôs INCREDIBLY confusing when you first start using the app and it‚Äôs difficult to want to use because it‚Äôs just so cluttered. 

You can only do one journey or goal at a time - which is totally fine - but it doesn‚Äôt really *show* you what it wants you to do at any given point in the journey. The app is also super intrusive ‚Äî if you go to check off an item or complete a task, it‚Äôll suddenly blast out sound with some cheesy letter (the voice acting/graphics are atrocious and make the whole thing feel cheap). At first, I was constantly silencing my phone or quickly closing out the app whenever I checked something off. It‚Äôs definitely not something you can effectively use without headphones in non-private spaces. 

But again, it‚Äôs just sooo confusing. You can see everything you can‚Äôt actually do yet (or shouldn‚Äôt - as it recommends), which clutters up the entire home screen and makes the things you‚Äôre actually using less accessible.

I was hoping for something a little more guided, a lot simpler, and a whole lot more focused. Each letter is like 3/4 of uninspired writing mixed with heaps of filler.  I‚Äôm really disappointed.

title: Just okay, not worth the subscription
review: I think this app definitely has the potential to help people who are starting from zero in terms of exercise/keeping themselves accountable for healthy habits. I used to bullet journal and used a paper habit tracker for a long time, and I didn‚Äôt find that the habit tracker on this app was better than my previous system. During the few days of the free trial, I did the water drinking challenge and great breakfast challenge, and I used the launch feature for running and ‚Äúdeep work.‚Äù While I did find that they were motivating, I didn‚Äôt think it was anything I couldn‚Äôt accomplish on my own with a regular timer. I found the letters/messages from your future self to be kind of aggressive and more weird/creepy than motivating, but I did like the visual aspects of this app. I‚Äôd continue using it if the launch features were free, but I don‚Äôt think the subscription is worth it for me.

title: Making a comeback
review: In the past year my life has turned completely upside down, I separated from the military and had been immensely depressed, all the while stuck in my thoughts as I watched my life deteriorate around me due to my neglect of myself and my needs. With the help of trained professionals I have begun to get a grip on my depression, but outside of the medical realm, this app has been exponentially helpful. I feel hope for the future that I didn‚Äôt before. When I do my ‚Äúchores‚Äù each day, I feel that I am actually caring for myself in a meaningful way. I highly recommend this app to people who need a little extra help to keep them accountable while developing healthy habits. I downloaded the app on a whim, but it has seriously changed me in a positive way and I cannot recommend it enough.

title: This is the best app I have ever tried
review: In the world of he said she said and I don‚Äôt like you because of the way you think or believe, it is a breath of fresh air to journey to ‚ÄúThe Land of Fabulous‚Äù. Here you ‚Äúmatter‚Äù, which is all any of us want. I am only on day three of my ‚Äúfabulous journey‚Äù. This journey might take a long time, but being fabulous takes practice. So, stop beating yourself up and start your own journey. Give yourself a present. Tell yourself that you are worthy. Find out how fabulous you can be!! It is so nice to be  where the idea of loving and respecting yourself are not just words, but tangible actions. Over time these actions become habits that will strengthen your core beliefs. The next time someone says you‚Äôre NOT, you will not only say they‚Äôre they‚Äôre wrong, know without a doubt you are FABULOUS.

title: Was skeptical at first but definitely worthy the investment
review: This is my first review, like ever. I never leave reviews, but I felt I had to help others who may have been unsure whether to spend the $50. The app only gets better after the trial. Actually, I think the trial could be better if they really wanted to reel people in but it‚Äôs being realistic. You can‚Äôt change your habits and completely transform in seven days. It takes steps. If you enjoy the readings (I do because they‚Äôre intelligent and inspiring), they only get better. There are also quite a few guided meditations and exercises. Really good ones. One made me cry but then I released a ton of negativity I‚Äôd been dwelling on. It‚Äôs basically a life coach in your pocket. Worthy investment, but I think you really have to be willing to put in the work.

title: Beautiful interface and successful rituals
review:
The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it five stars is that I find it confusing. There is so much going on and I‚Äôm just starting to understand the flow. But ten days in and I‚Äôm still doing my morning ritual. I feel like a need a guide. The app prompts me to do new things but then it said I had to quit the challenge I was in to take on a new one. So I‚Äôm doing the ‚Äúdeep work‚Äù challenge but I can‚Äôt figure out what exactly I‚Äôm supposed to do for 25 minutes...just focus on a task? No distractions? And then I accidentally checked the thing saying I‚Äôd done it but I was just trying to figure out what to do?

Part of what is confusing is that on some screens, the thing you have to do is below the check Mark saying you‚Äôve done it. 

Overall, it‚Äôs a super cool idea and I‚Äôm enjoying it. The exploration is sort of part of the fun.

title: Surprised how much I‚Äôm enjoying this at my age
review: I say that because It seems clearly geared for people in their 20s and 30s. I‚Äôm almost 50. I already have entrenched habits of drinking water every morning, having a healthy breakfast, etc. I already know the thoughts, principles and life laws they are teaching me. Yet.... it‚Äôs been a week and I‚Äôm still looking forward to opening it every day. I‚Äôm even feeling a bit more organized and focused. And it‚Äôs only been a week. Someone gave me a free month, so there‚Äôs a ways to go to see if I continue feeling this way. At first, I thought it was too messy and cluttered. Too juvenile, sophomoric. But I find myself being charmed by it. It‚Äôs a departure from all of the Ultra visual simplicity that everything has defaulted to these days. There are charming illustrations, melodies and animations to keep you engaged. For now, I‚Äôm sticking with it!

title: Amazing concept but not much you can do without premium
review: I‚Äôm a student and part time worker and I absolutely love the concept of the app. It helped me establish a schedule and routine for myself. That said, I could only do so after I purchased the subscription. I cancelled it before the free trail ended because again I am a student and who can‚Äôt be spending money like that on apps. I would use it daily if the premium features were free but without premium you can barely do anything. I really enjoyed the experience during the trail but would never pay for that experience If the app wasn‚Äôt so restrictive I would definitely use it everyday. I think more people would use this app if the premium restrictions were a little less. of course still keep a premium option that i‚Äôm sure many will purchase but in my opinion i would have really enjoyed this app if it didn‚Äôt restrict me so much

title: Poor Support / Cancellation & Reimbursement
review:
I will start by admitting that I was under the misleading impression of how canceling my service worked. However, along with that I was not satisfied w/ my experience w/ the app and I am experiencing distress through having my finances altered in a way I wasn‚Äôt expecting. I made all of this clear through the form that they offer for assistance and it‚Äôs evident to me that they feel no responsibility or empathy for those in my situation. 

Yes, they make the renewal dates and charges clear, I wasn‚Äôt confused about when and how much. I accept that I should have canceled yesterday, but to be so obvious w/ the lack of care of my mistake when you‚Äôre charging someone annually, not even just monthly, is absurd to me and telling of the value of the company. 

This is a self care app, it promotes a healthy well-being and one of the ways is through reducing stress. This charge is causing me so and it seems their support team doesn‚Äôt care and have no intentions to help. It seems very hypocritical given the purpose of the app they run.

My experience w/ the app itself wasn‚Äôt even satisfying enough for me to consider keeping the subscription so I‚Äôm basically out of money and stuck w/ a service I don‚Äôt want and again, they do not care.

I can‚Äôt support a service that claims to want to better people‚Äôs lives but doesnt care enough to help do so if it causes distress to the consumer when it hinders their income.

title: Don't use!!!
review: HORRIBLE APP AND EVEN WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! I have never written a review but will today. I did the free trial and was not impressed by the app. I made sure I was to cancel it so I followed the steps that I was instructed too and to my surprise I was billed for the month ahead. I immediately contacted the company within hours of receiving the email and they would not back down. They don't care if you are unemployed and can't afford it. They don't care if you thought you unsubscribed. They don't care if you contacted the company within hours of receiving the email. They don't care if you didn't use the app or services. It's very hard to reach them and I understand why. There is no number just email and you can submit a refund ticket but don't think they will refund you. This app has gotten my blood to boil and if you know me then you know I'm the sweetest person out there. I believed I deserved a refund because I believed I followed the steps but again they don't care. So much for an uplifting app!

title: Be careful of the charges!!!!!
review: The app itself is fine, it is well developed and fun to work with. However, it had said that it would charge a monthly fee when the free trial was over and I was willing to pay the smaller monthly fee for the service to see if I still enjoyed using it. When my trial ran out though I was charged $44 for the entire year! I‚Äôve asked apple for a refund bc there is no way to contact the actual app about one, or any way for me to contact them about switching to the monthly fee instead of the annual amount. I‚Äôm really disappointed that this wasn‚Äôt made VERY clear at the beginning of this is what they intended to do. I‚Äôll update my review as soon as apple gets back to me if this is easily resolved. It‚Äôs frustrating though because even apple doesn‚Äôt have a way for you to actually explain the situation. So now even if I do want to continue to use the app for the monthly fee I can‚Äôt because there is no real way to communicate!! Very frustrating.
developerResponse: {'id': 21377401, 'body': "We appreciate your feedback and we apologize for any misunderstandings. We use a monthly breakdown as a price comparison to the default monthly option. We make sure that the annual amount is stated at the time of authorization. We're sorry to hear this. We've been experiencing delays due to high volumes. If we weren't able to assist you, then please ensure to complete the form that's sent after emailing hello@thefabulous.co or sending feedback from in-app (Tap the Profile Icon, then Help and Feedback) \xa0", 'modified': '2021-03-01T18:51:30Z'}

title: Provides structure and motivation but much more
review:
I‚Äôve tried apps to support self improvement efforts in the past, and all eventually frustrated or disappointed me. 
Fabulous is different.
The developers have poured so much understanding of human nature into this app, that they‚Äôve anticipated those things we use to defeat ourselves and provided a path through and past them.
The app provides opportunities to reflect on your feelings at critical moments during the day, to really maximize your commitment to continuing on to your goals.
Not only that, they‚Äôve managed to personalize the experience in such a way that it feels tailored to YOUR own individual needs. 
I‚Äôm already eagerly integrating healthier choices into my routine that just a month ago felt like torture.
All of this is delivered with beautiful graphical elements.
I considered not giving Fabulous a fifth star due to its lack of intuitive navigation. 
For example, I‚Äôve made journal entries but haven‚Äôt figured out how to look back on them in order to track my ‚Äúevolution‚Äù.
Or I land on a screen with no path elsewhere and must close then reopen the app to continue, but I‚Äôm assured that they‚Äôre currently working on improving this, so I can easily overlook the minor inconvenience for now.

title: App is a scam if you ever stop using it
review: BEWARE OF THE FREE TRIAL FOR PREMIUM!!! This was a great app as a way of utilizing small habits to help snowball into larger and more beneficial habits. However, I canceled my subscription after getting a free trial a few months ago (before they could charge me and before I‚Äôd forget to remove it). However, they still tried to charge me multiple times for the yearly subscription after I had already cancelled and hadn‚Äôt used the app in months. After doing a quick google search, this seems to be a common thread. Regardless of cancelling, if you leave your card on file they will still charge you after the fact, even if you have already cancelled. If this is an app you plan on not using after a brief period of time, I highly recommend looking elsewhere as this app is very scummy when it comes to payment and charging you. Would not recommend, as you will probably have to call your bank for fraud after using this app like many of us already have.
