Please email us at web.sphere@thefabulous.co in order for us to confirm that you don't have any web trials/subscriptions", 'modified': '2020-09-28T17:19:04Z'}

title: Excellent Guide
review: There is definitely science behind this app. I‚Äôm still less than one week in, but something about it is working. I was in a productivity rut. And I appear to be making progress again. Time will tell but the combination of meditation (positivity) with  incorporating new self care routines is a lovely way to hold me accountable. It‚Äôs like I crave that glass of water in the morning. I‚Äôve known for a long time that I needed more water, and I‚Äôd go thru spurts and stops. It‚Äôs not just that I know I should anymore. This ‚Äòcraving‚Äô is different. I don‚Äôt think I will want to not drink water in the morning again. The app is a little hokey in places but I like that, it helps me trust its intent. Even if it ends up not sustainable for me, it feels good trying it.  The ME who showed up at work today was fabulous!!

title: My MOST Fabulous
review: I am actively pursuing my highest self thanks to The Fabulous. I love interacting with this app, from the art work to the data driven flow of habit building‚Äî it‚Äôs a one of a kind and seriously the best accountability buddy I‚Äôve ever had. I am inspired by the challenges and how the motivation and rewards unfold, and always excited when new educational info or bits of wisdom appear on my dashboard. I grow and learn everyday from using this app! I also love sharing the tips for building positive habits with people in my life! The fabulous creed is printed out on my wall for daily reference. THANK YOU Fabulous for creating this incredible virtual coach and guiding me towards my most radiant expression of myself. I would recommend this app to anyone who wants to feel happier, healthier, more productive, and more fabulous all around.

title: Best Productivity App Out There
review:
I've never made an in-app purchase before but this one is so well made that I just wanted to support the creators! This app is simply amazing! Probably the most underappreciated app on App Store. It's really fun to follow journeys, it's like a game you play in real life and you're improving yourself as you play. This is the most well-built app I've ever used. The creators clearly know their stuff and everything in it is useful and simple.

 Some suggestions for this app:
1. One time goals - Allow us to set one time goals too instead of habits that we do every day. Maybe let us tap on a day on the calendar to set our separate goals.
2. More exercises in Make Me Fabulous - There are only 3 exercises except 1-Min "Just Get Moving!" and Sphere Running exercises. We need more!
3. Let us set time for individual habits - Setting time for individual habits will help us do them before it's too late... Happened to me couple of times when I decided I'd do most of my habits together later in the day but was too tired to complete them.

The app is nearly perfect, thanks for making it! Interface is beautiful! Always excited to enter the app and improve myself every day. Keep improving!

-Gio

title: Not helpful for ADHD
review: I have ADHD and I thought this app might help me build some good habits. Unfortunately, this app didn‚Äôt help me very well. I turned on notifications but it didn‚Äôt send me very many and the ones it did send didn‚Äôt have anything to do with my goals that I was working on. So just like with everything else, I forgot about it. Made it the three days with the water goal before I gave up on the app. I was already starting to drink water before I downloaded the app, and the app didn‚Äôt help at all. I was drinking water because I already was doing it, and then I‚Äôd forget to put it into the app. Also you can‚Äôt choose which goals to do, it does it for you. Honestly, I would have much rather done something other than drinking water, because I was already doing it, but it made me do water. Also for someone with ADHD the immersive moment things are just annoying, not helpful. And you have to do them to mark your goal as done.

title: Exactly what I needed
review:
I have been struggling with forming good self-care habits/routines for so long, getting back on the horse and falling off again many times. Not only has this app helped me tremendously with mustering up the courage and strength to try again, but it has reminded me that I am not a failure for all the times I‚Äôve dropped the ball with previous habits. It really gets me in the right headspace and it leads you slowly enough that I don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed or pressured. 

I have found that the interface can be a tad bit confusing: when checking off tasks it seems like you have to go through your lists twice / in different places in order to see the full set of animations and messages. But even with that confusion Fabulous is still worth the 5 stars to me.

title: Amazing app!
review: This app is so well designed, so thoughtfully made, and beautiful / peaceful to use. I love it and am so excited to share it with others. Do it!! You‚Äôll be glad you did. :-) I have had it for about 2 years.  I  have chronic illness; this app has been so helpful In establishing routines that I‚Äôm not otherwise always motivated to do (physical therapy exercises, meds, etc). However once I got into the routine I started to feel intrinsically motivated to keep going, and proud that I was accomplishing my goals. As my life and priorities have changed, I‚Äôve used the fresh start mode to reorient and refocus.  My sister has been using this to establish a morning routine. She has ADHD, and issues getting up and out the door; this app has been a peaceful, gentle and supportive aid - she‚Äôs doing so much better!

title: Do it! This app is life changing.
review: I‚Äôve been drowning in my everyday routine and started realizing that I don‚Äôt really have hobbies anymore and feeling like I‚Äôm losing myself a bit. So I found this app and man am I grateful I made that decision! This app has honestly changed my life. By helping me isolate small new habits I‚Äôve been able to celebrate small accomplishments and changes that have effected my life in big ways. To stay, my mental health and second, my physical. This app is the must have for those who don‚Äôt put themselves first and need to reconnect with who they are and maybe even readjust. I have a few friends on it now too and we do challenges together! I love this app. Get it! You won‚Äôt be disappointed! It‚Äôll literally make you want to do better and be better!

title: My family tried the stretching exercise together
review:
At first, I was disappointed with this app, as features like adding more than three habits to my morning/evening routines or trying about half of the ‚Äúmake me fabulous‚Äù activities requires me to buy premium.

However, I realized this app has so much more. The long journey is well paced, new infographics and editorials are available every day, and the app constantly sends positive notes. I also realized that once I made a habit out of my morning routine, I could change the three habits out for three new ones. The ‚Äúmake me fabulous‚Äù activities that are available without premium are stuff like the 25 min deep work session and the 10 min stretching exercise.

After my siblings and I played video games for maybe an hour or two, I started to get a headache. My brothers wanted to keep playing, but we agreed we should stop and I opened Fabulous. I started the stretching exercise. My brothers, who have never agreed to a fitness routine unless it was school mandatory or to get something in return, stretched for ten minutes with me and my sister.

Overall, a beautiful aesthetic, many sweet features, and gently motivating. I would recommend that you try it.

title: Great app but.....
review: This app is absolutely what I need to gently encourage me to meet some goals and form some good habits. With that said I am not fond of apps that nag me to upgrade and rate on a daily basis. The nagging to upgrade fades after a couple days and I‚Äôm sure that the nagging to rate will end very soon now that I am writing this. If you can get past the annoyances of being bothered to rate and buy for a few days then the app is totally worth it. I understand that they need to recoup the cost of building this beautiful, well thought out app. No free app Worth it‚Äôs salt doesn‚Äôt pressure you to buy something at some point unless it has a lot of donor backing from some foundation. Meaning that it‚Äôs part of a nonprofit organization. Remember when we were spending big bucks to buy applications and programs for our computers? It‚Äôs kind of like that.

title: felt my time was wasted
review: Fabulous is both too much and too little. It promises to help me build new habits and build focus but requires me to take part in community stuff and only gives me one challenge to start with‚Äîdrinking water 1st thing in the morning for 3 days in a row. Then what? Have a good breakfast for 3 days in a row! Wow. So I am blowing my free week with two mindlessly simple challenges and the rest is all on me to take part in the community? I guess? It‚Äôs not actually clear to me. The whole idea is to make this self-betterment stuff easier but the first two challenges that take up the bulk of the free week are two of the easiest things to do. If this is what the first week is like I can imagine how underwhelming the second week will be. This app totally had me going for the first day! That ‚Äúfuture me‚Äù stuff was great! Then on the second day I was like ‚Äúwell, you‚Äôre awfully quiet.‚Äù Days 3 and 4 were even more quiet. I guess my future self lost interest? Well, now it‚Äôs my turn to lose interest.

title: Good ap, but a bit confusing at first
review: I got this ap to help keep me accountable with some goals I set for myself. It‚Äôs very personalized which I liked but there were some confusing aspects to how to navigate things at first. There is almost too many ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù on your front page. I think it could benefit from being simplified a bit. Now that I‚Äôve been using it for a few weeks, I get how it works better. There are still times when I‚Äôm not sure how to get back to something or whether or not I actually checked off a goal or accomplished my steps for the day. The things I really like are the morning and evening reflections and the reminders that help keep me accountable. I like ‚Äúthe journey‚Äù though, I admit, I haven‚Äôt been progressing and I‚Äôm not sure why? I‚Äôm accomplishing my tasks so, again, I‚Äôm confused.

title: Highly Disappointed
review: I downloaded this a year ago and enjoyed up until the last couple of months. I have gotten into the habit of checking off my morning, afternoon, and evening routines religiously. This includes my meditation routine as well, I got up to 255 days straight of my morning, afternoon, and meditation routines (I started my evening routine late) and came to check off my daily progress and all of it was wipe clean. You know how hard it was to do that. I bragged about it and now I have to start over!! Fine so I started over and then out of nowhere today I go to check my progress for my afternoon and evening routines from Wednesday and once again wiped clean!! My morning and meditation routines are there but not my afternoon and evening. I‚Äôm currently looking for a similar app because you could never imagine getting up to mark your progress and an app wipes it clean. No way I gave two stars because for a year it was working just fine.

title: I am grateful for this app
review: This app is a wonderful collection of old and new wisdom, made accessible through a well designed app experience. It is great companion and first step on the ‚Äújourney of a thousand miles.‚Äù And it includes a library of daily practices to support personal growth. It does however take a little time initially to set it up. And by that I mean you need to take a moment to reflect on what you want, then you can build your rituals and let Fabulous work it‚Äôs magic. Also, start slow. There is so much good content you may be tempted to do it all. But better to begin simply, establish some momentum, then extend your daily practices. Of course, sometimes, just beginning can be the hardest part. But if you take that first step, it‚Äôs well worth it.

title: Helps me feel more motivated
review: I enjoy using this app & paid for the premium service. It has helped me increase my water intake, got me back reading for pleasure (which I haven‚Äôt done in years), & just generally makes me feel positive. It can be a bit difficult to navigate the app & I missed out on inputting my first two days of success of my morning routine. But I got the hang of it fairly quickly. I‚Äôve only used it for a couple of weeks but I believe these small incremental changes will help me live a healthier life. As someone who is completely unmotivated, Fabulous gives me a much-needed push. It may seem a bit metaphysical & new agey & some of the coaching sessions are downright treacly. But sometimes that‚Äôs what‚Äôs needed‚Äîgentle words that help you extend yourself grace as you try to be better. I recommend this app.

title: Good for ADHD brain!
review: I‚Äôve been diagnosed with adult ADHD fairly recently, and have since been seeking out resources to help me stay on track. I need to learn how to schedule daily tasks more effectively so that I have more time and motivation to meet my larger goals. I‚Äôve only been using this app for 4 or 5 days, but so far it has been really helping with my morning routine! Within 30 minutes of waking up I have already had a glass of water, taken my pills and vitamins, washed up and brushed my teeth, checked my weight, and fed and watered my kitties! That feels like a big step because often times I wouldn‚Äôt have finished all of those tasks until late morning or noontime, if I would finish each task at all. I think this app will really help me out if I stick to it :)

title: The layout could use improvement
review:
The app in itself is amazing......like it actually is helping me change my habits so far, but some more features could make it near perfect:
‚Ä¢ Setting am alarm for each habit would be amazing. I know you can do it in your regular alarm app, but having it in fabulous stitched to their system which can also be customized will be amazing.
‚Ä¢ Keep on with the animated letters. So before this , a letter used to come and I would ignore it. But this time it has animations just in case you need pretty visuals. Keep on with that. It is working amazingly for me.
The only con I am seeing so far for this app is that the layout is very messy. Like you have the progress bar which tracks your progress but it doesn‚Äôt feel like it is part of that (like it doesn‚Äôt need to be there and is like an extra). And the pathway I am talking about is like the Day one day two thing with the fabulous spirit floating around each day as you finish a habit. It is not needed tbh. Remove that and keep the one which just tracks your one new helps for three days.

Other than that, this app is amazing and i can recommend it to anyone who is looking into self care...... just these changes can make me go for a 5 star

title: I‚Äôm liking it so far!
review: This was very appealing to me from the beginning. As someone in the field of behavioral psychology and education, once I heard this app concentrated on behavioral science, I knew I had to get it. I like that it starts off slow with one goal of drinking water and gradually adds more with praise and nice incentives for those who like stories. I greatly enjoy the theme. It reminds me of the game ‚ÄúJourney‚Äù by Thatgamecompany. It‚Äôs one of my favorite games and I‚Äôm unsure if the similarities were on purpose, but I love that it works with my association with the game nonetheless! I‚Äôm confident this app will be added to my conditioning tools considering it‚Äôs already getting me to drink water in a relaxing manner, which is one thing I struggle with lol. Looking forward to seeing more :)

title: Works for you, with you
review: This app is so great for those who want to start with slow goals and work their way up. If you want to start with something simple such as just setting a reminder to drink water when you wake up or take your medicine, it works for that! Or, you can set it up for a whole morning, afternoon and evening routine that will make you feel super motivated, responsible and successful. I‚Äôve got my whole family working on this app together with me. With five kids, I need moments of peace and mindfulness. It gives me the opportunity to set time aside for a break to meditate or set a reasonable workout regimen. It works for you, with you! However you feel it is necessary to work for YOU, that is how you set it up. It really is great.

title: Where did the daily story go?
review: I really do like this app! As other reviews have stated, for the first time in long time I am actually following through with healthy habits for myself. But what happened to the story? After I hit my 5 day streak, I stopped receiving the poem with the little figure, even though it said come back tomorrow for more of the story. After looking through some posts in the in-app networking feature, many other people also have this glitch. I know it‚Äôs not the most important thing ever, but if your team created the content, I‚Äôm kinda bummed to think that a glitch is keeping people from enjoying it. (I even purposely blew my streak to see if that would fix it. It didn‚Äôt.) hope y‚Äôall can get this resolved, but either way‚ÄîI‚Äôll keep supporting this app!

title: changed my life
review:
One thing i‚Äôm going to say, this app will not work if you are not truly dedicated to changing your life for the better. If you genuinely want to live a healthier lifestyle, feel better about yourself and be productive, this app is one the best (if not THE best) to use for that. Another thing I want to point out, is that the app is super non judgmental. if you missed a habit for a day or two, it reminds you that it is okay. It‚Äôs okay to slip up sometimes! and there‚Äôs no need in feeing bad about yourself over it. 
Also, it allows you to build your habits one at a time, which increases the chances of it sticking with you for the rest of your life. 
Thank you to the developers for this app. The best purchase I have made in an app.

title: Thank you for creating this app!
review: I am genuinely grateful that I tried this app for the last year, even though I have ultimately decided not to keep it after my subscription runs out. The illustrations and story are AMAZING!! And very inspiring. However, I found that since this app doesn‚Äôt use Siri Shortcuts, doesn‚Äôt talk with Apple Health, because it seems so technically isolated on my phone, it was hard to not to think of my Fabulous habits as isolated and separate from my everyday ‚Äúnormal life‚Äù. This app does a wonderful job of utilizing the psychology of positive habits; I think this app could be taken to the next level by applying some of the psychological principles of how we relate to our phones, why we prioritize our relationships with our phones so highly. Still, thank you for the Fabulous year!

title: Love the app - dislike the subscription
review:
The app is really beautifully designed. I love the habit tracking features, how you can customize your morning, afternoon and evening routines to be whatever you want. And it‚Äôs effective: it‚Äôs more motivating to do the things you need to do when you get to check them off and see your progress each day. 

TL/DR: Be careful if you do the free trial, or skip it altogether if you can. 

The subscription was confusing. I tried to cancel it before I got charged, but there wasn‚Äôt an option in my settings. I even Googled how to cancel a subscription and tried following the instructions and there was never an option to cancel. I ended up getting charged $43 for an annual subscription, but I contacted Apple and disputed the charge and they issued a refund. Just be careful!

If we\'re able to assist you with anything, then we can be reached at hello@thefabulous.co or by sending feedback from in-app (Tap the Person Icon, Help and Feedback)', 'modified': '2020-04-06T16:16:31Z'}

title: The Power of Little by Little
review: I‚Äôve only been using this app for about a month, but I LOVE IT! I really enjoy getting on each day, checking off my daily tasks, and celebrating the progress I am making. This app does such a good job of educating you, encouraging your and teaching you the true power of little by little. The makers of this app understand and express that real success and change doesn‚Äôt happen overnight... or over a week... but rather, it‚Äôs taking one step at a time, celebrating the small things, and keep moving forward- even when you experience setback. I recommend this app to anyone and everyone who wants to see their goals become a reality and their lives change for the better!

title: Love! Yes! 100%
review:
Don‚Äôt let the cost of a cup of coffee a month, cost you a fabulous journey to a better you!  

I‚Äôll start by saying I‚Äôve never written a review in the App Store before ... EVER! So this is kind of a big deal lol. 
I‚Äôve been using this app for a couple days now and I honestly love it! I‚Äôm very skeptical about a lot of apps that promote wellbeing and health but I just felt something different about this app and I decided to take a risk! 
Best decision I made! It makes me feel more motived in the morning and it‚Äôs really enjoyable to watch the videos. They have a ton of motivational things on there and tips, which they back up with reason and fact and it‚Äôs just great. If you are like me and struggle with getting up in the morning and being organized and having a routine ... this app is worth a try! 
Yes, you will have to pay to get the full experience, which comes out to be like $3 a month (a cup of coffee) if you break it down from the annual cost, so I think it is totally worth it. 
You have to stay true to yourself and the app, don‚Äôt lie, don‚Äôt be lazy, and put your best foot forward and you‚Äôll be on the start of a new journey to a better you!

title: It Started Out Great, but....
review:
Current review: When I first downloaded this app I truly enjoyed it. It kept me on track and I was hitting my daily goals. But then an update occurred, and this app had been pretty useless since then. First, it messed up my streak of days, which was frustrating, but I could just continue to be productive. However, most of what I like about the app disappeared with the update. It wasn‚Äôt as inspirational or encouraging as before. The cool info graphics stopped showing up and a lot of the ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù didn‚Äôt work. For an app that I paid for, it stopped being worth the money. Now it‚Äôs a glorified checklist that you have to pay for. I have cancelled my subscription and will be deleting this from my phone. I have left my old review below, so you can see that it was once a useful app.

Previous review:
I am truly enjoying this app. It has helped my to start a morning routine and made me start thinking about the value of me and my time.

title: This app is EVERYTHING
review: I am so in love with Fabulous. I have never been more confident in myself or had so much trust and faith in my abilities to follow through with my desires. This app has made it easy to not only set goals and form habits but has managed to transform my thoughts and actions into ones of true belief in my abilities. I have never felt so full of potential and so confident that I will fulfill it. The graphics are refreshing, inspiring, and relaxing and the audio further amplifies those qualities. It is clear how much thought, passion, patience, time, and faith the developers put into making this app a complete masterpiece. I‚Äôm full of respect and proud to support you by being a member of Fabulous Premium. You are Fabulous, I am Fabulous, and this app is Fabulous.

title: Simple Steps to a Healthier Lifestyle
review:
I have been in desperate need to build a healthy routine that would help me live a more sustainable lifestyle. I‚Äôve been using this app for 3-4 weeks and have easily integrated 2 habits in my morning routine, that I would never try or think were achievable on my own. The coaching and gamification of this app make sculpting a routine FUN! I was happy to pay the yearly fee and am looking forward to continuing the journey.

EDIT: I have been using Fabulous for 18 months and it has truly been a constant in my life. Fabulous allows one to tailor their journey to their current state. I had too many habits logged in my day and I felt overwhelmed. I was happy to restart my journey so that I can now take it one step at a time.

title: a great push into the right direction
review: before this app i really had a hard time creating healthy habits, i‚Äôm only on day 4 but so far the biggest improvement in my life is i‚Äôm able to get up and start my day before 3 pm. i like to think of the app as like  a friend, someone who will hold your hand and walk with you every step of the way. This app is also different than many apps like it in the store for the fact of how many tools there are on it. interested in trying yoga? here‚Äôs some yoga poses. want to learn different breathing techniques? here‚Äôs some. maybe you‚Äôd like to stretch better? they‚Äôll walk you through. anything you could ever need in one place to start the journey of self improvement.

title: Helps me with adulting
review:
This app has helped so much with adulting though I‚Äôve had to restart my ‚Äújourney.‚Äù I‚Äôve been consistent for a week now! Which is HUGE for me! Drinking water, eating breakfast, and doing some kind of light exercise in the morning. I feel my depressive episode lifting and it‚Äôs easier to deal with stress and anxiety. 

*Note 1: there‚Äôs a Discord for #Fabulous. I‚Äôve found an accountability partner, which has been really helpful. Link is on their Facebook group page (somewhere in about - I think?)

*Note 2: you can‚Äôt do a journey and a challenge at the same time. The journey page will turn into your challenge chat page and vice versa. Slightly annoying, but it‚Äôs better to focus on building one habit at a time.

title: This actually works
review: I am SO BAD at keeping up with healthy habits, and I didn‚Äôt expect an app to help me all that much. But I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised with this one! I love that you can pick & choose your habits & do as many or as few as you like. As someone with depression, it‚Äôs really nice to be able to take baby steps instead of being completely overwhelmed & inevitably giving up. This app gently nudges you in the right direction, and I love that it‚Äôs so encouraging & celebratory when you do even a menial task like drinking a glass of water (which, for some of us, can be a difficult thing to do). It‚Äôs like having an extremely affordable, extremely kind & patient life coach. I‚Äôm excited to become an actual functioning human again :)

title: It‚Äôs a wonderful way to kickstart motivation
review:
I truly never had trouble staying on top of things. That is, until I got a puppy and was still responsible for everything previous to having this wonderful creature. I LOVE my dog and often prioritize things above him. I also have an awful habit of making unattainable to do lists. Fabulous helps me hit my weekly goals through small steps. Not that I didn‚Äôt think I could do this before, but when you have an app nudging you- it makes it a bit easier. I even send the little challenges to my friends and they love them as well. It was an amazing step in the right direction for me. I‚Äôm
Only a week in and most of my goals are already feeling like habits to me. Thank you!

title: Comforting and refreshing
review: This app reminds people to take care of themselves, to love themselves despite all the chaos surrounding us daily. It can be easy to get swept up in the rush of everyday life, and it can be hard to find time for self-care. However, this app is very structured and makes it incredibly simple to create helpful habits and routines. I‚Äôve enjoyed my journey so far, and am discovering that I had the potential to do what I want all along. I‚Äôve always doubted my ability to establish daily habits because I doubted I could keep them up for very long. With this app I didn‚Äôt even notice the minute a habit formed, it was so effortless. I highly recommend this app to anyone wanting a very detail oriented self-care app.

title: A lovely app for all users!!
review: This app is so great, and I definitely think it‚Äôs worth the payment to use it year round after your first free week. It‚Äôs changed the way I wake up and go to bed, and it‚Äôs gentle and encouraging reminders help me not to feel pressured to keep up with my goals. Rather, it makes me excited to accomplish them! I highly recommend this app to anyone struggling with mental illness. Since using it, I‚Äôve found my anxiety levels are less high throughout the day due to starting it with mindful meditation and gentle stretching. The reminders to drink water and eat a healthy breakfast are so helpful to me! And the graphics are so cute !! Not only that, but navigating the app is super easy and stress free. 10/10 recommend ! ‚ú®

title: Helps you A LOT
review: I got the app around 2 weeks ago when I was very unmotivated and my days were repeatedly the same. I got the app for fun just to see what actually would happen, and when I tell you my life changed without me realizing it, I mean it. It doesn‚Äôt rush you at all, instead it gives you all the time u want, it helped me mentally tbh more which is more important to me atm. I would definitely recommend this app especially if u wanna set yourself a routine for each day. I only have 1 comment, I just really wish we can add our own habits/tasks/goals! And if possible, I can make every day a new task or goal come up, so it wouldn‚Äôt be the same routine every single day :) everything else is prefect tbh and definitely helps u as any beginner! 95% recommended ;)

title: Sweet concept but the marketing ruins it!
review:
The design and concept of the app is creative and has a sweet atmosphere, but the ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù integration of marketing throughout is so off-putting! If part of my journey is to send a note of gratitude to someone, that‚Äôs wonderful. But that narrative  just sugar coats that its actually just an ad for the app we are prompted to share to draw in more customers. 
I thought the ‚Äúgift pass‚Äù was a really sweet idea too, until I sent it to a few people and it turns out it‚Äôs another marketing scheme. Please don't call it a gift to pass on to others if the gift receiver is obliged to enter credit card details.

I understand that as an app you want to grow your user base and ideally a growing community around the app, but if you're going to undermine people‚Äôs awareness and ruin the actual experience that is supposed to be a thoughtful personal exploration of growth and healthy habit building, by integrating your own marketing ‚Äústrategies‚Äù right into the process, that is not a journey I want to participate in, sorry. 

Having said that, I do like the overall creative concept of the app and the idea behind it, so I will continue to use it during the trial period but if I keep finding more of those integrated marketing tasks reframed as a part of my journey It might be too off-putting to dive in.

title: Great app so far
review:
I have only been using the free edition, I don‚Äôt know what else this app has to offer. But I have checked in every day and it is solid for building better habits. For context, I am a seventeen y/o girl who has recently been emancipated and gotten out of an abusive household. I started from square 1 and this has helped me so much. 

The little things in this app help you the most, it starts by telling you to put a glass of water by your bed every night or in the morning (whatever time you chose it to notify you) and if you go through with it...after a week you start to feel pretty good about yourself and are inspired to keep up the good work. 

Thanks for creating this app, I really enjoy it.

title: A different kind of app to ingrain new habits
review:
I have just started using this and like the feel of it. It‚Äôs guided but not naggy. I like the subtle nudges in combo with tracks (journeys) to help you make changes to your habits. It‚Äôs way better than just streak tracking. I guess it is really streak tracking with the option of having community support (in challenges maybe journeys too?) or just having little affirmations pop up. 

The interface needs some work but they are aware of this. They are currently in a redesign phase and are looking for feedback so if you like it and have some or even sorta like it but have reservations I would definitely reach out to them. 

I am looking forward to growing with his app.

title: Great way to Start and Maintain
review: I‚Äôve really enjoyed using this App and have used it in the past as well as when it first came out. But I‚Äôm committing this time and really like what they have done with it in regards to journeys etc. I also LOVE that they have an option to buy it for a lifetime versus a subscription. My only qualm is that it gets a little convoluted and sometimes a bit confusing with the multiple ways to check off my daily habit and the different areas in which to look at your journey. If it could be mainstreamed all in to just one area that would be great. For example, it said I could push on the rocket to find workouts but I couldn‚Äôt for the life of me find the rocket. Other than that I enjoy the stepping stones, journeys, and graphics.

title: Everyone should get this!! Just one thing...
review:
Is anyone looking for a great all over health app? Then get this! This reminds you to do so many things and gets you a lot farther in your health. I have been looking for a long time for something like this and this is the best. Usually when I look at reviews, I look for if the app has premium. Yes, it does, but you can still do a lot without the premium. Plus, there are no ads! (At least so far.) 

I only have one tiny complaint. It constantly tells you directions and makes you press on things you don‚Äôt want to. This is an easy fix and it doesn‚Äôt bother me much or come up a lot, I just wanted to give a heads up! 

Overall, I think everyone should get this app to make their life healthier!

title: Lots of helpful hints and prompts
review:
Suggestion #1: fix the MANY typos! They‚Äôre everywhere. I‚Äôve only been using the app a few days and I see some sort of typo each time I open it up. They look unprofessional.

Suggestion #2: put more detail into the yoga/stretching/workout activities. The voice sounds like a robot from a decade ago, the images I‚Äôm supposed to mimic don't match what the voice is describing, and the degree of instruction is practically nonexistent. I am a yoga teacher and if I didn‚Äôt already know how to have proper form in the suggested postures, I‚Äôd likely injure myself. Please teach your customers how to be safe with proper form, if you‚Äôre going to tell them to do an exercise.

**********
That aside, the free version is pretty handy! There are plenty of practical prompts to help build yourself a healthier routine and the design is pleasant to look at and navigate. I like how the challenges have little, attainable goals and give encouragement along the way. I also like that the process unfolds, starting off with one task and building on it consistently. Finally, it‚Äôs pretty cool how many options there are for customization of your routine and goals. Thank you for developing this app!

title: I‚Äôm new to fabulous
review: So far I am loving it however I forgot to unsubscribe and I was charged and I didn‚Äôt even get the chance to use the trial. Therefore, I gave the app a chance since they do not refund the yearly subscription. I started the journey and so far I am loving it. I read a few reviews in Reddit that really boosted my confidence to use this app 100%. Although I was a bit disappointed I couldn‚Äôt get my money but I thought about it this way it‚Äôs an investment in myself. I have been struggling with making habits I start and then if my days change my habits tend to be broken and I am loving the theme of the app how it tells you stories and the habits it has are habits I love to keep forever.

title: Baby Steps
review:
This app helps me be patient with myself when it comes to self improvement. At first, it was overwhelming with everything it has to offer, especially if you‚Äôre browsing the app. I let the app guide me after a while. You‚Äôll likely do some self reflection and point out problem areas in your daily routines. I never had a set routine throughout the day, but Fabulous helped me build one. 

Fabulous offers an extensive list of healthy habits to pick and choose from. It‚Äôs best to stick to just 2-3 habits in your Routines in the beginning. Having too many was my first pitfall and I ended up not using the app for a looong time. Picked it up again to slowly get the ball rolling so that I can succeed.

title: Representation Matters ‚Äî and this app doesn‚Äôt get it
review: I signed up for the trial with this app. While I think it may be a good app, I have cancelled before the end of my trial. Clearly, this app is meant for thin white women with flowing long hair because these were the only images served up to me over the past three days. Why would I - a Black woman - want to see images of people who looking nothing like me on my personal development journey? It‚Äôs 2020 and the most basic principle of representation is completely nonexistent in this app. Perhaps I‚Äôve been spoiled because I use the Shine app that regularly gives us a range of female images and voices from real life. ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è It‚Äôs sad that Apple can provide a range of skin color emojis but this app didn‚Äôt even consider it.  A huge miss for this app and its very disappointing.

title: So far I‚Äôm really enjoying this
review:
I suffered from mild depression this year and have had a lack of motivation as a result. I was pretty well disciplined for a while but then I hit a wall and struggled to see the reason/purpose. And while it was discouraging, this little app has helped. The app prompts you through journeys that act as small little victories in your day. There are a variety of journeys you can take too from the small changes such as drinking water first thing in the morning, to helping change you fitness habits/motivation.

One thing I really enjoy are the coachings. They are short, sweet and inspirational. ü§ç I did join for the year and hope to keep with it to truly give it a fair shot.

title: So far promising
review: So I‚Äôm just finishing the trial period and am looking forward to continuing. The way everything is laid out and scheduled, along with long term goals and habit building is very well done. It‚Äôs nice to finally see some of all the research we‚Äôve been doing on our habits going towards making us better individuals rather then trying to sell us something. The coaching, the circles, the routine, all have a place that really shows and it‚Äôs one of the best apps for it I‚Äôve seen. That being said it being a mental health app (hate that term), you will get out of it what you put in. I‚Äôm holding off on the five star review to see if the quality stays the same as I get deeper into it, but I must say I‚Äôm very happy with it and very very excited for my journey

title: A move in the right direction
review: I‚Äôve been wanting to take better care of myself for a while now but I would always fall back into old habits. I decided to clean up the the social environment on my phone. I got rid of apps that I felt made me waste time, I removed meme pages from my social media. The next step was to find new habits to replace my random scrolling across the internet. That‚Äôs why I got the fabulous app. I didn‚Äôt think that a reminder to drink water when I woke would make much difference at first, but as I followed the journeys it gives I realized how much of a difference the little things make. I‚Äôve bought premium after the trial and it feels like an investment in myself.

title: More than anything u would expect!
review: This is sooo good it‚Äôs not typical and it has facts psychological based help to make a difference. It‚Äôs well thought out. Words don‚Äôt don't justice u just have to try it. I‚Äôve been putting off premium now i have it; it goves me more and i have a access a community group it‚Äôs motivating and now has a streak record i like that. I‚Äôm taking it one day at a time. I helps with mindset and has many many topics to help u with over drinking stress anxiety and so much more they have practical yet intelligent ‚Äúexercises‚Äù to help make things better for u...please try it if u r serious about getting and sticking to a routine or helping u overall with mindset or goals or topics u struggle with..

title: Love the accountability
review: This app is great!! On the journeys it keeps you accountable and the ritual and habit reminders are great! When I first started the app I was just looking for something that will help remind and keep me committed to exercising. Instead what I got was an app that helped me find energy!!! It‚Äôs amazing, in such a short space of time I was consistent with working out, also through the app being more open minded that stretching workout is still moving and there are even workouts in the app. I love the 7 minute workout üíï. But like I said the best surprise was having more energy so early in the day for the entire day!! Just started my next journey of sleeping better!! So excited for the results.

title: Makes change so easy
review: I have been wanting to change my habits for a long time and on my own I was all over the place. Using Fabulous has taken all the hard work out of it and now I only have to show up and complete each task. It gets easier every single day. I feel healthier(drinking water, stretching and 7 minute exercise), wiser(the daily coaching) and more present in the moment (meditation). This app is what I needed to finally change my life and go after my goals and dreams. I am a healthier person physically and mentally. I finally have the energy, mental focus and self-love to be hopeful about my future. Thank You! I hope you know you are changing lives for the best.

title: A little overwhelming / intimidating
review:
Immediately after being shown a first task, you have a letter to read with scattered facts, multiple quotes, a video to watch, a map outlining goal stages, a kind of dream-sequence video (which does look inviting), reminders to set up... 

The problem I have with most of these apps (or self-help books like Tiny Habits), is they either overwhelm with too much information and visuals at once, or they're presented simply enough, but then come with a list of notes to take, ways to journal, things to do to track the thing you're doing... 

I love what the app is attempting though, and the mystery it presents and immerses you in. I just think it needs to be simplified. As a graphic designer, we constantly face this in UI and visual presentation in all forms, so I don't say this to sound testy!

title: Amazing Self Care App!!
review: I have been absolutely loving this app. I don‚Äôt normally take the time to write reviews but I wanted to write one for this because of how incredibly helpful it has been. The app starts you off with an incredibly simple routine and builds it up as you develop good habits. It‚Äôs so motivational and makes me feel so good about myself. This doesn‚Äôt feel like an app for profit....I believe whoever made this truly wants to help people become the best versions of themselves. There‚Äôs so much on the app too. I get excited every morning to listen to my daily coaching and start checking off my routines for the day! I truly found this app exactly when I needed it and I‚Äôm very thankful for it ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Small steps
review: I suffer with depression and anxiety, but I have decided to stop taking my medication (please note, I am not a doctor and do not recommend that for anyone and I am not insinuating that this application is an alternative). This app does help me follow a solid routine but also realistic with small steps at a time. Right now I have to achieve eating a healthy breakfast, drinking water, and working out for 8 minutes in the morning three days in a row to move forward. It is a challenge for me to follow basic routines but this app makes it possible to achieve. They also include letters to you for motivation and lots of meditation opportunities! I‚Äôm happy I prioritized myself into purchasing this app!

title: Bettering Myself
review:
I just began using this app and I tend to never stick with things such as this, however this seems to keep me motivated. The app is very colorful which keeps me engaged. It has already helped me recognize and prioritize important habits I wasn‚Äôt as aware of or brushed off. 

I have ADHD, but even with my medication I can still forget things. Fabulous is particularly helpful with the reminders and positive atmosphere. It‚Äôs a little cheesy, but I know that with the dedication and habits I will gain,  the motivational quotes won‚Äôt sound as ridiculous anymore. 

I truly love this app. It has so much more potential than any other self benefit apps I have tried. Can‚Äôt wait to continue using it!

title: Living your best life
review: This app has helped me start to learn new habits time and again. I fall off constantly but I don‚Äôt feel shamed or down on myself when it happens. Fabulous helps to support me and get me back on track. It is a bit expensive, but that in itself can be a good incentive to use the app regularly. I used to abhor the thought of too much routine in my life (I like to have room for spontaneity) but being consistent with some of my daily activities boosts my mood and helps me to feel productive throughout the day. I really recommend this app to anyone who struggles to create new habits or who just thinks they might want a bit of a life change and would like some support!

title: Definitely recommend this app!
review: This is a science-based and brilliantly designed innovative app meant to motivate and support you to be a better you through behavior change and healthy routines. I really enjoy how being off the mark is built into the system and how they incorporate feedback from the check-ins that they prompt routinely. The app does not make me feel bad about not being able to follow through sometimes and even inspires self-compassion in these cases while supporting positive growth through ‚Äúsuper-powers‚Äù that are empirically-supported. I‚Äôm a doctoral student in clinical psychology and from a behavioral science perspective, this is spot-on and so user-friendly! I absolutely love it!

title: Great App- just a little too much for me
review:
The whole app is really busy and has a lot of different avenues to choose from when looking for journaling or coaching. 
There‚Äôs a lot of ways you can plan out your life- and there will be ways you can track your progress. I stopped using it bc of the reminders and the way I felt guilty for not living up to the app (even though I set the expectations). 
Since this app seems to target individuals who are working on themselves and may be experiencing mental health challenges I think it‚Äôs important to add a little ‚Äúgrace‚Äù and ‚Äúgentleness‚Äù in this app- maybe in the form of a bot that‚Äôs understanding and not pushy about reaching your goals. I also don‚Äôt like how it doesn‚Äôt let you skip through the coaching and intro videos. 

Very rich app- just too much for me.

title: Great habit maker
review:
I was looking for a while for a habit teaks app . But this is much more . This is habit builder . I love the short stores . It boost my curiosity . It does not let me to choose too many things at the same time ( that is what I do in all other apps and I can not follow up ) 
I have not reach the productivity part yet or focused time . But I am so excited to get there . 
There is only one thing I wish I could see , the habit builder to wake up early . It has the sleep routine at night . 
Also another feature that makes it definitely 5 , is the stories that is narrated with a beautiful Graphic design and makes me follow it up every day . I hope it lasts for the whole year .

title: Habit Eater
review:
I have used fabulous for some time now and feel the application has made a huge difference in how I do little habits everyday. I can‚Äôt live without it. It‚Äôs important to me to realize my greatest potential. I use to not meditate which has seriously impacted my schedule. I see meditation as a gateway to see what‚Äôs on the other side. 

I‚Äôve been so conquered by fear and excuses for everything that gets in my way. I couldn‚Äôt see myself opening up to anything. Now, I‚Äôm still scared but meditating helps. Breathing helps. I used to be wound up tight. Two people i know have told me to ‚Äúrelax‚Äù, ‚Äúit‚Äôs all going to be okay‚Äù, and ‚Äúdon‚Äôt stress‚Äù. At first, I had no patience and as stubborn as I am I find excuses. Sometimes I hear, ‚Äúbreathe‚Äù. 

How can I? But then, I remember to try it on Fabulous and it does help.

title: Impactful! Great Value!
review:
My career is centered around coaching - which at it‚Äôs core is about helping people/individuals move from one place to another in their lives.  I share this to give context to my perspective. 

This tool taps into numerous science based aspects of human behavior and is a great example of how interactive app based communication can be broadly deployed and individualized for users specific interests. 

If you are interested in having support around a specific goal or want to sharpen the life-skills/habits  you have already developed - I suggest giving fabulous a try. If cost is an initial friction point for you...I suggest considering that the business model is, ostensibly,  designed for sustainability and longevity.

title: Amazing
review: This app is amazing! It really helps me reach my personal goals and motivates me the whole way. Not to mention all of the other amazing things about this app. You can do challenges, and you can even do their workouts they have available. At the beginning of the app they ask you a series of questions like what goals you want to achieve, what you are focusing on, etc. Which I love because after you answer all the questions they give you a personalized plan for things you can do to achieve your main goal. I just love the app and the layout of it. I use it everyday and it is a must have if you want to become more productive and overall more happy!

title: Would 100% recommend.
review: I have always had trouble with doing what I say I will do, so having a reminder helps me a lot. This app is so well put together, and I haven‚Äôt found any problems with it besides the fact that you can only have one journey at a time. I would want to be able to do more things at a time, because maybe I need to fix more than one thing. For example, I‚Äôm struggling with organisation, and motivation. I would only be able to do one journey, which means one of my problems could slowly subside, while the other could potentially grow. Besides that, I would totally recommend this app, you all should download it!!!!

title: This is Trash! üëéüèΩüìµüè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏èüöÆ‚õîÔ∏èüôÖüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
review: This app is trash. All these reviews must be paid for because the whole design and experience was lame from the start. First off, there‚Äôs nothing free about it. You sign up for a free trial and can‚Äôt do anything of value until you pay. Second, there‚Äôs no support. Third, it‚Äôs impossible to get to your account information/settings to cancel your account. Four, the description and introduction to the app was so misleading. It feels very phony and deceptive. I don‚Äôt believe any of the positive reviews here are real. Do not download. Don‚Äôt waste your time or your money. I did that for you already. Just walk away. If I can help just one other person with this review, please, SAVE YOURSELF! Don‚Äôt get this app. Don‚Äôt do it! It‚Äôs a fake, a phony, A SHAM!! It‚Äôs the Kevin Federline of apps (more problems than it‚Äôs worth)! Run, hide, dodge, ignore! You‚Äôre better than this!!!!

title: The accountability partner you didn‚Äôt expect
review: Something about the app makes you want to complete the set goals. I enjoy that the goals start small. Baby steps are encouraged. I most enjoy the daily coaching so far. I sometimes wish I could go back and listen to certain daily coaching when the day has passed but I feel that‚Äôs the point because maybe it‚Äôs a practice of mindfulness and moving forward. Launching your fabulous moment and being able to kind of journal your journey is also really cool. It‚Äôs been a way for me to recognize how I‚Äôm feeling on the journey or vent about the journey. Actively checking off my set goals makes me WANT to complete them.

title: Don‚Äôt do it
review: Look I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but this app is a scam. I‚Äôm convinced the good reviews are paid for. I downloaded this app almost a year ago I did the whole trial and realized for the price it‚Äôs not worth it. I unsubscribed and deleted it of my phone. ‚ÄúSomehow‚Äù it resubscribed itself and charged me 70$. I tried to get my money back but apple said there wasn‚Äôt anything they could do. This app has been off my phone for a year and the company sent me an email letting me know my subscription is up soon and I‚Äôll be charged next month. So I go to unsubscribe *again* and there is literally no button to press to cancel the subscription. Even if I successfully unsubscribe I‚Äôm not convinced it will stay that way and I won‚Äôt be charged. I have know idea how to keep this company from taking my money. Please don‚Äôt download this app. Read the other reviews I‚Äôm not alone.

title: I really enjoy this app
review: I love this app. I only just started using it, but my first challenge was to drink water in the morning for three days. I finished that challenge, and by the time I finished that challenge I was in that habit of putting water next to my bed, so now putting water next to my bed at night is part of my night routine. I also really like this app because it gives you notifications of when to do everything so it‚Äôs a reminder all of the time which is really nice. I also really like how it sometimes takes you through a calming story of how to have more self care and it gives you little messages that are motivational.

title: Tech glitches are frustrating
review: I really want to like this app, but it has a few features that are really frustrating. It‚Äôs constantly freezing or crashing. You‚Äôre supposed to check off a number of habits, but it often takes 5 or 6 tries to check off a set of habits. It loads slowly. Also, the app is constantly asking you to ‚ÄúSend stuff to your friends.‚Äù  I don‚Äôt want to bug my friends. Sometimes, the challenges don‚Äôt make sense. For one challenge ‚ÄúReduce your time on social media‚Äù you were supposed to Input your email so other users can contact you. That does not sound like a recipe for reducing social media. I‚Äôm also not about to give my email to random strangers.  Other than that, it‚Äôs a cute app, I like the alarms and reminders, it‚Äôs very personalized and it‚Äôs always encouraging without being saccharine.

title: Fun, Uplifting, Enjoyable, Helpful with Lasting Change
review: What I like most about this app are the guided adventure stories and journaling guides. I‚Äôm a visual person, so the colors, illustrations, sounds and storylines keep me engage and coming back. It sets me up as the heroine of my own journey. I love every time I complete a daily habit, I receive the loud gold star sound. It feels so good like winning a prize at the boardwalk. After using this app for some days now and going through the exercises, I feel more confident in completing what I set out to achieve. It also helped me clarify my thoughts by connecting dots in my storyline from past present future and set some new goals. I love this app!

title: Helpful!
review: I downloaded this app on a whim as something to supplement my mindfulness practices and it was really helpful. You build a routine for yourself slowly over time, adding habits one at a time to help build a stronger foundation. Its helpful if you need a little extra encouragement to help hold yourself accountable for all the things You ‚Äúwould really like to do, but just haven‚Äôt gotten around to starting yet‚Äù or if you have trouble starting something and not following through. If you have a solidified mindfulness routine and a wellness schedule of your own that‚Äôs working, this probably not for you. If you‚Äôre new to the mindfulness/wellness trend, or just need a little extra support as you form new habits, I would recommend.

title: I REALLY want to love this but ...
review:
I think in general this app is excellent. There are a few things that I hope you will take under serious consideration.
1) Requiring the members upload a photo and use their full name. Some of what members share is deeply personal. Requiring a full name and a photo is a violation of your member's privacy.
2) It should be possible to change your email address. I signed up to trial this to see if I can recommend it to my clients (I'm a therapist). I did not know I wouldn't be able to change back to my personal email.

Unfortunately these are significant enough that I can't use it or recommend it until there's a resolution. I also would caution others in what they are sharing in live challenges if their identity is not protected.

title: LOVED...just buggy and a little confusing
review: I LOVED my premium subscription to Fabulous. I think they do an incredible job, but there are some bugs and overall it‚Äôs a little confusing as to how to navigate and best utilize the app. In some ways it‚Äôs too guided and in others, not guided enough. Needs some clarifying. For example, there are multiple ways to access the same things and it doesn‚Äôt check off one way if you access it via another way. So I‚Äôd end up trying to check something off as read or done multiple times every day and not quite sure when I had done what I was supposed to. I experienced a couple other inconveniences as well. Really disappointed because I think this app has the potential to be life changing.

title: Highly recommend this app
review: I‚Äôve been down in the dumps lately and haven‚Äôt been feeling myself. This caused me to not get anything done throughout the day and I just wanted to sleep and not deal with the world. But once I downloaded this app it really changed my life. I love how my first goal was just to drink water every morning because even that was a difficult task for me. Now whenever I complete my daily goals it makes me feel accomplished and happy. This is my second week of using this app and I have a completely new attitude. I‚Äôm more energized and healthier than ever and I‚Äôm just getting started! I highly recommend downloading right now!

title: Play along, seriously! Encouraging achievements!
review: There is something about being slightly competitive and achievement oriented that is really driving me to stay engaged with the journey presented by this app. I‚Äôve tried other means of forming daily habits, but it became too easy to forget what day it was or skip a day. This uses the tech of your smartphone to handle the small things like reminders and tracking progress, so you can just focus on your habits. I love games and stories, and get addicted to phone games easily, so I find this format very satisfying. It may not work for everyone, but it is well worth seeing if it will work for you! Loving it so far!

title: Really Needed This
review: In the craziness of Covid I let my worst self out and had built terrible habits. It was a dark place and I desperately didn‚Äôt want to be the person I was becoming but was struggling on finding a way out; a guiding light to change. That‚Äôs when I found this app. It lets me choose habits that I want to build that will help me develop into the person I see myself as and it reminds and rewards me for it. With some commitment to the app I find myself easily breaking terrible habits by simply replacing them. I‚Äôm about a week in and have exercised every morning (even if it‚Äôs just a morning walk) and focusing my mind on the goals I want to achieve. Well done!

title: I CANT believe it!
review:
I was amazed on the first day. I‚Äôve never seen an app like this. I thought for sure I‚Äôd have to pay right off the bat. I really want to start doing premium. I was very happy because they don‚Äôt pop up a bunch of ads about premium to make u feel left outüòê. This is the only app I‚Äôve ever actually looked at the prices for premium and might want to do it. I‚Äôm at a young age and I‚Äôm trying to get my self care routine just correct. I can‚Äôt wait till I start making a little more Money and can pay for this no problem. I‚Äôve tried out soooo many apps but this is by far the best. HIGHLY RECOMMENDEDüòÜüòÜüòÜüòÜ

Share it with ur friends and family!!!

title: Crashes, Slow Load Time, Not Intuitive
review: Design and animation is beautiful... but that‚Äôs about it. It is very difficult to navigate throughout the app. Took a while to figure out the difference between challenges and journeys - also how many can I do at once? Will it override my progress if I accept? I‚Äôm constantly having to sign back into my premium membership. The load times are painfully slow, most of the time it just times out and crashes. I went to contact support via desktop and the UI for the form was entertaining but of course customer support is slow to respond. It‚Äôs too bad this app is modern design in the front being held together by toothpicks and duck tape from the back. I know developing apps is not easy, but I would prefer something that worked first before adding the bells and whistles.

title: Malfunctioning App
review:
Great app and helps to improve and organize your life. I was planning to become a life-long subscriber before my app started malfunctioning. It stop counting my streaks even after I complete everything and when you complete your daily goal but the app doesn‚Äôt count it as a streak then you eventually start skipping. Unfortunate. I asked for help many times and got a few simple suggestions like deleting and uploading the app again or restoring the purchase. None helped. Of course, I decided not to renew my subscription and I cancelled it. During the process I was asked to be interviewed with a representative via video call and I chose to have a meeting. No one called. Who knows, maybe when I put my email and hit the submit button it didn‚Äôt work. I wonder why......wait! Maybe the app was malfunctioning or not even functioning.
Thank you Fabulous for the support.
developerResponse: {'id': 14927579, 'body': "Hi\xa0there, we're very sorry to hear about this and what had happened with your streak and the representative you had spoken with. If not, then feel free to share further details with us by completing the form via hello@thefabulous.co or sending feedback from in-app (Tap the Person Icon, then Help & Feedback)", 'modified': '2020-04-27T04:39:29Z'}

title: Just started but liking it!
review: This is my second time trying the app (first was several years ago) and I‚Äôm noticing several improvements. It seems like they‚Äôre using psychology to help you build habits and to motivate you to stick with it. So far I‚Äôm really enjoying it and looking forward to seeing what comes next. This is definitely my favorite app for routine building! It has everything in one and helps you pace yourself. This is great for me bc I tend to overshoot my goals too early then get overwhelmed and end up giving up. Fabulous seems to offer a solution for that. I‚Äôm staying tuned and am open to what they have to offer üòä

title: Worth it
review: Before I downloaded, I read most of the negative reviews. It seemed like people only disliked the app because of customer service not answering their questions immediately and users not knowing how subscriptions work for Apple products. So, I decided the app content might actually be pretty good. I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. I struggle with mental illness and lack of motivation. This app makes it soooo easy to set up various forms of motivation for myself. I‚Äôve been using to for over a month and I‚Äôve completely changed my routines. I‚Äôm really looking forward to when the developers add personalization for the different journeys available.

title: So far, so good
review:
Update:
It‚Äôs been about two weeks now, and so far I‚Äôve started to make a few changes. I‚Äôm drinking more water, and exercising more. I‚Äôve missed a couple days, but nbd because it‚Äôs a major improvement ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüëåüèª

Original: 
I‚Äôve been using Fabulous for a few days. The name is a bit cheesy, but it‚Äôs not like I have suggestions. Anywho- been using this for about 5 days, enjoying it so far. The pace at which tasks are added feels good- though a bit quicker than I would‚Äôve imagined. I‚Äôve already noticed a positive difference in my daily routine; I‚Äôm staying hydrated, and have been pretty successful with the beginning of my evening routine! Will update in a few months after more use.

title: Habit building made easy
review: I am finding this app really helpful. It is helping me to implement the ideas in Atomic Habits by James Clear. Tiny actions performed consistently lead to big changes. The idea us to start small and slow and build on your successes. This is more that just a tracker, it is a teacher. It helps you know yourself and how to structure things so that you can finally make the changes you know you need to make to meet you different goals. After only 2 days of using the app I was perfectly happy to pay for a subscription. This is clearly a labor of love built by some very smart people. It is beautiful to look at and performs seamlessly.

title: Unlike anything else
review:
I‚Äôll be honest, I don‚Äôt usually write reviews. But I‚Äôve used a lot of different habit, mindfulness, focus, self discipline and general life improvement apps. Nothing ever really stuck; it might work for a short time but ultimately they were never engaging enough to really override all the mental fogs and internal struggles that lead to the need for them to begin with.
This ones different. With the carefully laid out paths and attached stories, I actually find myself coming back day after day. And the pacing has been just right to not overwhelm things. Highly recommend at least giving it a try to see if it‚Äôs for you.

title: A perfect, life changing companion
review:
I‚Äôve tried quite a few apps, and none of them really felt like they fit into my life. Most of them are just naggers. Often, I ended up feeling worse for having attempted it than if I had just skipped it.
This one is very different. I feel like I have a coach with me all along the way. I feel very accomplished every time I do something better for my life. All of the goals are in small increments but are very empowering. I have come to look forward to celebrating the good things I do each morning and evening, as well as the regular coaching.
I really feel like I am on a path toward permanent improvement.

title: It's fabulous to be fabulous!
review: So I have been using the app for about 2 weeks. I will say that without fail, I drink a glass of water first thing in the morning. It is what starts my day and I have seen immense changes in my life because of it. I have only one issue with the app so far. There seems to be a sync issue between my phone and my watch. Sort of a bummer, but it could be user error as well. In a nut shell, I really like the reminders and motivation. But this is just an instrument, not a redeemer from bad habits. It will help if you want to change. Good luck and blessing to anyone reading this. Thank you to the developers, this has help me a lot.

title: I love it but...
review:
This is a great app for so many things, I‚Äôve only had it for 4 days and my unhealthy habits are lowered a LOT, and I now do meditation every morning. It makes staying healthy a whole lot easier. 
My only problem is that I love it so much but I really don‚Äôt want to spend money right now and my one week is almost up. If they could make this a fully free app I would recommend this app to everybody I meet. Now I understand that the whole company need to make money but just think for a second and think about all of the praise fabulous would be getting, it‚Äôs a lot right!
Truly I just really don‚Äôt want to give it up but if I do then we‚Äôll that‚Äôs just really unfortunate but I understand.

title: Great but complicated
review: The intention of this app is on point. The mission, the graphics, the quality, the fact that there aren‚Äôt glitches are all fantastic. However I find the app and the sections hard to navigate. Confusing. The app signals 6 notifications but when I Open it nothing indicates notifications pending. Also the checking off of tasks or goals is weirdly arranged. Is it a check off or a fabulous moment? Or both? The coaching and other extras are also oddly placed. I‚Äôm hoping navigating the app becomes easier for me cause I‚Äôm really loving the results. For the record, I‚Äôm very tech savvy. I don‚Äôt know why I just can‚Äôt seem to flow through this app. Still highly recommend it

title: So sad that it's not working for iPhone right now
review:
I used to use this app a few months ago and I gotta tell you, the app is really nice and good and everything was really lovely and helpful.
But I re-installed it again right now to start using it again, And it just freezes and keeps crashing. Every time I try to go to the home page, it would just show a white page...I click on options and it doesn't work...I play something but it doesn't play the audio...
Anyways, I'm really sad that it's not working on my iPhone 7 right now. I really hope that it's a temporary thing and would be fixed soon.

title: Surprisingly meaningful
review:
This app, while very unusual, has probably been the most meaningful one I‚Äôve ever been downloaded/purchased, as it‚Äôs been a big source of foundational habits. 

I used to drink 5 Diet Cokes and a coffee a day. Now I mostly just drink ice water, and no caffeine. For the last few years, I‚Äôve make a to do list most days in a notebook, and I prioritize it quickly and identify the three things I really want to get done. When I‚Äôm stressed, I now do some sort of meditation and I find I can focus better. 

All these are things I learned to do seriously in this app. Lately, for really the first time, I‚Äôve started a regular exercise program. It really feels like it may be something I keep up with, unlike my many earlier attempts. 

There are plenty of goofy/questionable suggestions, some journeys (healthy eating?) that just don‚Äôt seem terribly effective, some other ones that just won‚Äôt end, and about a billion references to Teddy Roosevelt for some reason. But all in all, this is an amazing app I‚Äôd recommend to anybody.

title: Disappointed
review:
This app is difficult to navigate and messy, which if you‚Äôre trying to build good habits is bad. I would go as far as saying if you have anxiety this app might trigger it. While trying to use the app I‚Äôm just overwhelmed with constant random substance-less features and it becomes difficult to even do basic navigation and get back to where you just were in the app, there‚Äôs no clear direction,  constant pop up style interactions and animations clutter and confuse. 
It‚Äôs a shame that distracting, messy, unclear design was chosen over functionality (exactly what people who need this app need). 

It also asked me what I want to stop using in the questionnaire, social media was one of only 2 options so I picked that, anything I do on this app it asks me to share on social media. I downloaded this app to improve myself, Im not interested in giving you free advertising, and that shouldn‚Äôt be on the table anyway for a user that has flagged social media as a trouble area.

Perhaps worst of all is that It has faux science, for example, it based a bad habit section on astrology, apparently I drink too much coffee since I‚Äôm a Gemini. I‚Äôm serious this was in the app, very very very disappointing for a ‚Äòscience based‚Äô app
(the behavioral science is all solid)

title: Great app!
review: This app has definitely nailed my daily routine into me. I can accomplish my goals more clearly and purposefully, and it helps me get my day on track. It‚Äôs definitely one of the better daily planning and meditation apps out there. The aesthetic of the app is very simple, easy to look at and navigate. The only bad thing I have to say about it is that I wish there was another deep study session sound that lasts for longer. Every study session you have to have a subscription for except the 25 minute one. Other than that it‚Äôs a really great app if you want to get your daily routine planned and accomplish more goals. Good job Fabulous!

title: Beautiful, Helpful, & Amazing
review: I absolutely love the diversity of this app. The music and graphics give that spiritual and holistic feel. I love that it starts you with practicing small habits and that it tracks your journey into making positive self care a healthy habit. I am using my phone less because of it. I love that this app encourages overall less use of technology because it is just a tool to help encourage to do all the the things you can do to care for yourself OFF of the app. Of course the gratitude journaling and note taking is on the app itself, but at least it‚Äôs for a self care related purpose. Love this app so much. It‚Äôs brilliantly made.

title: Fabulous is fabulous ‚ú®üí™üíïü•∫
review: I love the way it helps me. It‚Äôs like a writing in a journal without even knowing what you‚Äôre doing. Like doing some thing that you like but you don‚Äôt know that you‚Äôll like it. It‚Äôs a good way to think about things in a different way and it helps me understand what I don‚Äôt get it. It also helps me get better sleep and do better because I used to be a lazy couch potato before this app helped me. It also has premium which is really cool I didn‚Äôt get it though because I don‚Äôt want to spend money on that but I don‚Äôt have to spend money to be on Fabulous because Fabulous is mostly free.

title: This is F-A-B-ULOUS
review: I‚Äôm a hard worker who has dedicated my life towards service and dedication to fulfilling my God given purpose. I noticed over the last year if not two years that I needed to work on myself and my own ambitions. During COV-19, life has changed for all and I finally feel like I have time to refocus and align my self-care with my goals. This app is the daily reminder I need to keep moving forward and focus on myself first. They have this analogy that you need to put on your oxygen mask first before you put someone else‚Äôs mask on...This app is the oxygen mask to remind me of my daily minimum standards to focus on becoming the best version of me.

title: Help & Support
review: I truly love this app! However I realize that I was never logged in and it will not allow me to for some reason. Every time I try to reset my password, it will not allow me to sign in with the new password. It‚Äôs also very frustrating because I deleted this app and my old information will not download. I reached out to help and support several times with no response. This is very frustrating as I love this app and I feel like I was accomplishing so much! If I do not hear back from help and support, I will be asking for a refund and deleting the app altogether. I do not want to go further in this journey just to bump into similar issues and unable to enjoy everything that I am paying for. I‚Äôm hoping that this review will get the attention of help and support so that I can then update my review accordingly.
