title: I love it!
review:
I‚Äôm someone who procrastines everything. About my work, my health, my mental health... Fabulous helpes me improve myself in many ways.
üíõ The app‚Äôs design is beautiful
üíõ It‚Äôs kind of color coded (which is the only way I can plan my stuff)
üíõ It has pretty illustrations, very motivational videos, letters, and quotes
üíõThe journey is so cute with its stories. 
üíõYou can create your own routines or follow fabulous routines (morning routine, evening routine etc). I recommend don‚Äôt overwhelm yourself with so many things to do. Start small. 
üíõIt has challenges like reading challenge, yoga challenge, self-love challenge, which are surprisingly fun. 
üíõIt really knows how to encourage me. I started with little steps (such as drinking water in the mornings) and I‚Äôm eager to continue! Right now I‚Äôm having my breakfasts, doing morning excersizes (or dancing to happy songs), journaling before bed, meditating between my study sessions... 

At this point I‚Äôm considering to buy premium. I believe it‚Äôs worth it and I definitely recommend fabulous~

title: Filled with activities and variety of healthy information
review: Like so many others during COVID, I have become isolated due to working from home and simply not going anywhere. As a professional mental health therapist, I have seen my mental health decrise  and my weight increase. I needed something that isn‚Äôt pushy but allows me to follow my own speed. Through this app, I set goals which I am able to follow. I actually wouldn‚Äôt mind working with the people who work behind the scenes because they are fortunate to share healthy and (easily accessable) mind, health and body information onward to others. Keep up the great work.

title: Difficult to navigate
review:
I enjoy the journeys and support this app offers. I typically am savvy with electronics, computer programming, etc. I have found this app challenging to navigate, things disappear and information seems to be missing often. There are also times when I begin a challenge and am confused why it is a challenge because the only support it offers is to check it out? Stuck paying for it so I continue to try to make it work and access the minimal benefit. 

Additionally, I cancelled subscription and it still renewed. When I emailed them, they responded a week later- telling me to turn to Apple to remedy it. Annoying and frustrating, I have taken the financial hit and tried to utilize but become more and more disappointed through each use.

title: Give it a try, you won‚Äôt regret it
review:
It‚Äôs only been 5 days, I often download all these apps and never actually go on them or use it, after the initial inspiration to start it. 

I felt myself on a bad loop of logging off work at the end of the day and immediately going on Netflix, but now I feel myself getting more control over my routine and excited to challenge myself with these. They start with easy attainable goals which I really appreciate so it‚Äôs been achievable and rewarding. Excited to keep on going with this path and see where it takes me. 

Thank you fabulous, it feels fabulous lol

title: Most frustrating App
review:
I was gifted a Golden Ticket and as soon as one week was coming close to ending it warned me my subscription was going to end soon and I had to sign up for premium. I wrote to ask for help, but no one ever wrote back. I am NOT on Instagram or FaceBook (which I explained when I asked for help). I checked my account on the internet and it said my account was good until 6/16. But I keep getting messages that it is ending. Very Frustrating!

The app is not very clear and has an extremely frustrating interface. It‚Äôs suppose to help someone feel successful ‚Äî instead it has made me feel like a failure. I never write reviews - let alone a bad one - but Fabulous makes it impossible to reach someone to get help ‚Äî AND when I followed the protocol to get help, no one even responded. And it‚Äôs been almost a week. Very disappointing!

title: Not all features function
review: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off again for 1.5 yrs. I thought after I bought the premium subscription the layout of the app would be easiest to understand since more features would be open but no, still confusing and most recently i was dropped from a challenge I was pretty far along and engaged in with the community- that was demotivating. Furthermore some of the additional widgets like workouts and meditations that came with the premium feature aren‚Äôt working - buggy, no sound or no image. Submitting feedback to try to find a fix took a very long time to find who knows what black hole that went too. If all features worked I could give a higher rating and get over the awkwardness but right now...nope nope nope

title: This App has helped me so much!
review:
I‚Äôm an adult that struggles to cope with my mental health issues - depression and anxiety, and severe ADHD - and having Fabulous to remind me of my habits and keep track of my routines has been an absolute life saver. 
The only complaint that I have is that it is a little difficult to reach the support team for technical issues- I‚Äôve been trying to contact someone about an issue with my premium subscription for a few days, but I have yet to actually receive a response. I‚Äôm hoping they get back to me soon!

ETA they did respond and helped me solve the problem! They were very nice and helpful! ^_^

title: Update: Ithink I‚Äôll like it once I figure it out
review:
Update: cannot get any answers to my ‚Äúhow to‚Äù questions.  Can‚Äôt set up an afternoon routine so can‚Äôt complete the golden triangle and some of the motivational stories pop up some days and not others so you miss part of the story and there‚Äôs no support to help me figure this app out! 
 I‚Äôm having trouble navigating the app. I love the idea of the app, the visuals are appealing as well as the audio.  One thing that has me baffled is that on the first day I hit something that told me a little story about walking through a forest on a path and coming across someone or something and it said to come back tomorrow to find out what and I can‚Äôt find that for the life of me! Anyone know what that was?  
Also? The fact that there is no support to submit such a question to is irritating.  

Otherwise, we‚Äôll see how it goes.

title: Love the service, really dislike the notification settings.
review: The service is stellar, but I‚Äôm beginning to feel very uncomfortable with the amount of notifications, the inability to control which notifications I would like to receive and a prompt when I finally turned notifications off that they were ‚Äúrequired.‚Äù I love using psychology to help improve myself. I do not love having behavior manipulation happening through constant notifications. It seems like these are at odds with each other. Are you providing a service that encourages me to improve my life beyond my phone, or are you actually encouraging me to be digitally engaging more, leaving space to disengage from my physical well being?

title: Awful music woke me from a deep sleep even on DND
review: When I am falling asleep...that‚Äôs a precious window of time. During that time I cannot be woken up unnaturally or I will be up for the rest of the night. This app, an app that claims to help you create a better routine get better sleep and wake up refreshed, literally sent me a notification when I had my phone on do not disturb and the sound somehow broke through the do not disturb this insidious disgusting happy music this app plays woke me up right as I was falling asleep and I could not get back to sleep for the rest of the night. I have no idea if this app is any good or not and I guess I will never know because I will never allow this app on my phone again the music is revolting and jarring and should in no way shape or form be able to play on your phone, loudly, when it is on do not disturb.

title: Too much flare
review: I love the idea of this app and have tried it twice, but both times I was pushed away by the overly abundant encouragements/motivational quotes/suggestions/etc. For example, the first routine they suggest is drinking water every morning, which is great, but every time I check the box, first I get 3 seconds of screens saying you did it/way to go/other stuff, then 3 seconds of showing you the calendar, and finally another 3 seconds of ‚Äúwould you like to share your journey?‚Äù with animations... this is just too much. It‚Äôs just drinking water. It‚Äôs a private journey. No, I would not like to share this with anyone, and I‚Äôd rather to be able to go on with my day after checking that box instead of spending another 10 seconds on this app looking at dumb animations.

title: Helping me live my best life!
review: Thank you! This app is absolutely wonderful! I used it a few years back when it first launched but had to step away due to a super hectic life. I have truly missed it though and as soon as I came back to it I realized how much I could have used it all along! It is so helpful and easy for me to build healthy habits now, once I committed to myself that I really wanted a big change in prioritizing my self care and was willing to put in the work. I plan on staying a while now!‚ú®ü•∞I hope I can stay committed and stick with my plan to have self care to the max! Thank you so much!

title: Wow I Needed This
review:
I have a really hard time with making a routine and staying in it. Fabulous gives you great small habits to build upon and gives you such positive support that you keep wanting to do it. For me it almost feels like a video game. But instead I‚Äôm leveling up in life ü§£ it‚Äôs helping me learn more about myself and take care of myself in ways I‚Äôve wanted to for years. 

My biggest issue is I always do too much change all at once and then don‚Äôt keep up. Fabulous has taught me how to take things one step at a time and celebrate my little accomplishments. Can‚Äôt recommend enough!

title: Fabulous Makes Life Easier
review: The hardest thing to do is to start. For me, I knew I wanted to be healthy and happy, I wanted to be more productive, and just ultimately wanted to feel better. But many of my attempts fail because I try to go too big too hard too fast, or I just simply do not know where to start again. Fabulous makes all of that so much easier. Not only does Fabulous give you easy to follow baby steps towards growing as a person, every task you finish, is celebrated! Positive affirmations are constant and it makes the journey always a positive one, even if you fall of the wagon a few times.

title: Only habit tracking app that I‚Äôve truly enjoyed!
review: Fabulous is more than just checking a box and keeping streaks. I‚Äôve only had it a week or so now but can tell it‚Äôll be something I‚Äôll stick to for a while. It‚Äôs has important lessons built in about building and retaining habits and goes above and beyond in helping ensure you can maintain them in the easiest way possible. Along with that it‚Äôs very visually appealing which makes opening up the app to report your progress a reward itself. Definitely would recommend giving it a go if you‚Äôre serious about improving your routines and habits

title: I Didn‚Äôt Get to Pick My Goals
review: This is a lovely and well-designed app, but just wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for. I was looking for something that would let me plan my day (how much to work, when to exercise, etc.) Instead, I was presented with a single goal: drink more water. I already make a point of drinking plenty of water, but I didn‚Äôt see any way around this. It also consumed five minutes of my time, with questions like ‚ÄúDo you think you will drink enough water tomorrow?‚Äù etc. I think this app would be perfect for someone who needs to ease into a routine. On the other hand, I already am fairly organized, and was just looking for a quick and fun way to track my work hours, exercise, eating habits, etc.

title: I love it!
review: I‚Äôve tried other goal setting/habit building apps and they don‚Äôt provide the context my brain needs to be useful. The beautiful animations, the colors they chose and the language used all make me want to use the app. The app provides the initial habits based on the goals you choose and holds your hand through each step, suggesting things that will help you stay on track. The only thing I think that is missing is that i I sometimes forget to indicate I‚Äôve done something until it‚Äôs too late. I would like a way to go back and add it later with a note that I forgot.

title: It got me to eat breakfast.
review: I am really trying to get my act together now that I‚Äôm in my 30s. I used the free trial of premium, but I was going to quit because the second task was eating breakfast. Nope. Not gonna happen. You‚Äôre never going to get my eating-disorder-recovery self to eat breakfast. Then one morning I got a letter in my journey. It was written for people who didn‚Äôt like breakfast. It was an absolute game-changer, especially in my appreciation for the app. They recognize the differences in people and teach you how to work with yourself and how you function. Also. I have the habit of eating a small handful of trail mix before coffee.

title: Love the support
review:
This app is kind of like an interactive self-help book where the author comes alive and acts as your personal coach, helping you build habits and giving you inspiration along the way. 

It‚Äôs a different kind of concept than other apps I have used, so it took a little time to learn how to use it, but now I love it. 

It works by giving you tiny habits to accomplish one at a time. At first, I felt like the process was a bit too slow, but after participating in the process for a few weeks, I‚Äôm finding that it really works. Small, simple changes eventually add up to big routine shifts.

title: This app is so helpful
review:
As a TBI survivor, routine is the key to a better day. This app keeps me on track. It has a lot of what I‚Äôm looking for. Prompts for routines, challenges to work toward achieving more positive feelings. It‚Äôs helped with my anxiety. I have the free version and it‚Äôs pretty robust. 

Maybe I haven‚Äôt found some features yet or they are available on the premium version, but I wish it had journaling and mood-tracking in addition to all it does have. This would be my one go-to app‚Äîthe app that had it all! But even without those things I do find this app to be useful, and it has helped me feel happier, less overwhelmed, proud of myself for completing challenges.

title: Fabulous rating
review: The programs are definitely helping me slowly create habits‚Äî hoping they will be long lasting but only time will tell on that as I‚Äôve been engaged in this app for just a week now. The directives could be a little clearer as to the steps/order/timing of the live challenges but I‚Äôm getting the hang of it I think. I tried to do the declutter and better sleep live challenges simultaneously but it looks like you can only be fully active in one at a time with the discussion groups etc which I did not know at the time or I would‚Äôve made the declutter challenge my priority. All around it‚Äôs been a wonderful tool to get me motivated and keep me mindful!

title: This app is changing my life!
review: I‚Äôve only had this app for a week and it is already changing my life! I‚Äôve been consistent for an entire week now because of this app. I love everything about it! From the small little added changes to my daily routine to the encouragement I receive from the app and the online community where others can uplift one another!! To the creator of this app, I want to sincerely thank you for this!!! I usually never take the time out to write a review but I had to because I feel AMAZING!! God bless you all and everyone who decides to try this app! üòäü•∞

title: Sensational!
review:
I have been working to develop new habits and reinvent myself for the better and came across this app. I have only been using this app for a week now but it has been so amazing!!! The helpful little points and stories and habits that are forming are so tiny and easy but making such a difference. And when I doubt that I‚Äôm doing enough or the rite thing it‚Äôs great for reminding me that I am. The mountains are built out of rocks and cities built out of individual stones. 
This has been such a help! Excited to see how great it will get and how great I will get! 
Enjoying the little things üòä

title: AMAZINGüòçüòç
review: I‚Äôm 11 and I‚Äôm middle school. With that it means I‚Äôm undergoing a lot of stress and bad habits. I first found Fabulous on Instagram at first u was skeptical and wondering if this was actually going to work and well I was right. I download the app 4 days ago and I already quit 2 bad habits Fabulous improves a lot of things like sleep schedules, better well-being, and fitness. I‚Äôm really proud of myself and glad I found this app the only bad thing is the subscription and this app should be free but then again success comes with ups and downs. Overall I say download it it‚Äôs a really good app and you won‚Äôt be sorry.

title: Learn to let go: Anxiety
review:
When I downloaded this app I have full of anxiety, brokenness, and unworthiness. So far it is day 3 from where I started using the app, I feel so much better. I incorporated it with prayer, candles, and yoga. Eating healthy is also very helpful. I am no longer sleeping during the day for almost 4hrs. I have more energy and little by little my smiles are coming back and little laughs here and there. I know you have doubts but you can do it. You will get through it. Learn to believe in yourself and follow through. <‚Äîsaying this to myself. Remember, 
‚ÄúI have to put my own oxygen mask first‚Äù.

title: Conscious Living!
review:
It‚Äôs been a week since I started using this App. Started with a small step of drinking water right after I wake up. Just that simple step produced a butterfly effect on the rest of my day!

I then added having breakfast every morning ( that I always used to skip because I was too busy üôÑ) now I‚Äôm enjoying a healthy breakfast everyday as I‚Äôve made it a priority. 

Next I added a bedtime routine, unplugging from all devices, making my room cool and quiet and that has helped me get better sleep, waking up recharged rather than groggy. 

It‚Äôs a little hard to navigate the first few days and I still haven‚Äôt figured it out completely. I still ‚Äú accidentally‚Äù mark things as done and that robs me of the joy of celebrating when I actually take the action, but I‚Äôm figuring it out slow n steady. 

Give it a go! It‚Äôs worth it, it‚Äôs helping me take care of this body, a tool that the divine has blessed us with so that we can show up and fulfill our purpose.

title: Best routine app yet
review: I‚Äôve tried sooo many apps to establish routines in my life and this is by far the best app I‚Äôve used for that. It encourages a step by step process that makes it easy and attainable to actually start and keep routines. I‚Äôm also absolutely in love with the graphics and stories on this app! They really do brighten my day and makes me feel like I have my own personal cheerleader :) If you‚Äôre struggling to establish routines, if you are tired of trying a failing with new routines, then this app is perfect! I am actually sticking to my routines and it‚Äôs all because this app has made it so smooth!

title: A fabulous app that can easily overwhelm you with too many options
review:
I‚Äôve been doing the one week trial and really like the idea of this app! The visuals and graphics are lovely, the background sounds and narrators‚Äô voices are peaceful and relaxing, and the material are amazing and very powerful!

However, my problem as a user is that there are too many screens and clickable items for you that you can easily lost in the app. 

One of the most confusing parts for me is that I have no idea that what will happen next after clicking on something. Sometimes you could end up getting 2 or 3 more new action items within that! Im honestly scared to click on anything...

Instead of having so many options (too much of customization for what user want to achieve with this app) I‚Äôd rather selecting from a few options on ‚Äúwhy I wanna use this app (my goal)‚Äù and then having a clear path that unlocks step by step and help me to focus on that goal.

I love using Fabulous in the future when it‚Äôs less confusing to use.

title: Daily coaching has disappeared for me.
review:
I started using this app about two months ago when I retired. I have really enjoyed it and found it useful in preventing me from living my life in front of the television. How do you specially enjoyed the daily coaching and passing along what I was learning from it. But at least in the mornings, daily coaching has disappeared. 
I am greatly disappointed in the product support. There is nothing in FAQ that tells me how to deal with this. Support staff has essentially responded "get in line."Literally, they said we will respond to your request in the order received. Nothing since, in over a week. So I am left to seek out my own daily coaching and relay that. Please help.

title: A game changer.
review:
Re-read the title, because it‚Äôs true. Fabulous has you start with something small and silly...but begins, ever so gently, bit by bit, explaining the reasons ***why ***; the theory behind the practice. THAT‚ÄôS a gem. That one idea (spoiler: reinforced small pushes; not big pushes) translates across behavioral decisions. And then you begin, again, one (or maybe two) small steps forward toward more gems. 

Perhaps you don‚Äôt know what ‚Äúforward‚Äù means or is. 

That‚Äôs ok. 

Fabulous has done work on that and can help you select your path / journey; but, get this, also help you re-direct your journey (even just temporarily) when need be.

I‚Äôm in the neighborhood of 45+ days of Fabulous.  And I‚Äôm doing fabulously. 

This is the only app I‚Äôve ever actually purchased after the free trial; this is the only review I‚Äôve left ever. Don‚Äôt download the app and then delete it right away because you think it‚Äôs silly. Go with it for at least five days. Then decide.

Fabulously yours,
Stephanie

title: Grateful for this app as someone with mental illness
review: Three cheers to Fabulous! I love how it breaks all these impossible-seeming tasks of ‚Äòbetter living‚Äô into bite-sized chunks.  I live with OCD and depression (both diagnosed) and self-care (the boring, required kind) seemed impossible for me.  It‚Äôs so weird how I actually look forward to completing tasks.  The way the app is designed makes me feel really supported (even if it may just be AI).  It‚Äôs like having someone cheer me on for the little things it makes me actually want to live better.  I was hesitant before signing up for a subscription, but in the end I‚Äôm so thankful.  ‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Such an inspiring app
review:
If you like organization, motivation and a clear mind this app is for you. I started using it just a week ago and couldn‚Äôt wait to write this review. 
The home screen is clean and easy to use and you get reminders of your habits throughout the day. So so helpful. 
It eases you into habits, there‚Äôs no ‚Äúdrink eight glasses of water‚Äù right away. You start with ‚Äúdrink a glass in the morning for three days.‚Äù It‚Äôs so helpful. 
You can join groups to help motivate you, get tips from other real users and make some connections. 
This app is a saving grace for me and you should get it too.

title: Amazing!
review: At first when I downloaded Fabulous, I didn‚Äôt think it would be this engaging. But after about 6 days on it, I felt different. I love the price of the Premium upgrade (Even though I haven‚Äôt done it yet) and even if you don‚Äôt have it, how much activities you can do without it. It has helped me to build healthy habits so far and the exercises have helped me feel better about myself. The mindfulness and stories are so helpful, and there is much more that I haven‚Äôt tried yet! I have felt much better ever since Fabulous, and the letters are inspiring. So I totally recommend it!

title: Great concept; App crashes frequently
review:
I love the app. I love the reminders, the various habits that I can select and work on, the reminder to try to not take on too many new habits at once, and the layout. I like that the Discover page has infographics about various wellness topics. I wish the infographics came with more in depth articles and, perhaps, a database full of wellness articles organized by topic. Or maybe just a few articles available based on what we liked the previous day. 

I don‚Äôt like that the app crashes every so often. And I don‚Äôt like how when you ‚Äúlike‚Äù an infographic, it automatically prompts you to ‚Äúshare‚Äù.

title: Amazing
review:
This is one of the best motivators. Challenges keep you entertained and motivated. A fantastic way to complete a personal goal. I already feel like I‚Äôm pulling myself together, especially during quarantine and online school!
Edit: this was probably my favorite part of the day. It felt amazing being able to feel productive while doing basic tasks that made me better. But the disappointing thing was that I could only get through two journeys till I have to pay. One I don‚Äôt have my own job as a busy teenager, and I can‚Äôt expect my parents to pay a subscription for an app they don‚Äôt need to use. This was my biggest motivator during quarantine and I can‚Äôt even use it anymore

title: Fantastic app for simple habit building
review:
I highly recommend this app!  It lines up well with all of the research I‚Äôve seen on forming habits, and the way you can organize the habits is unmatched by anything else I‚Äôve seen. It really helps my ADHD brain focus and build/stick to new behaviors.

Only think I‚Äôd wish they‚Äôd do different is not pop up as much stuff beyond the habit action items.  Maybe have a once a week inspirational message or whatever but mid week, I‚Äôm just trying to get through the routine quickly, not trying to have an immersive experience every time.

title: Not just another feel good app!
review: The name grabbed me first of all,I mean given the world circumstances who doesn‚Äôt want something fabulous in their lives. And from the very first tap I was engaged and spoken to in a way that was meaningful and soulful and felt like it was directed exactly at me and where I am in my life right now based on the selections I chose in my areas of interest/concern. It also draws you in with whimsy and fun and a dose of accountability but not of the rigid kind. I‚Äôve already gotten a clear message from this app which is, choose to LIVE. Download it. It‚Äôs not your ordinary feel good meditation app.

title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
review: I‚Äôve only been using this app for 2 days, and already I am so excited to see where this journey of creating new habits takes me. This app has never made this seemingly impossible feat more exciting and do-able. It‚Äôs backed by behavior research, and being an Occupational Therapist myself, it does such a good job of cultivating new habits by it‚Äôs simple, yet fun and interactive sensory experience through the stories, music, and movement prompts- which is really how we learn- through engaging in story telling, igniting our senses, and having fun! Plus, it‚Äôs only $35 a YEAR. I can‚Äôt believe it. It so so so worth it!

title: Too many options overwhelmed me
review: I started off loving this app to the point that I paid for a subscription. But, after a few weeks I felt overwhelmed. I signed on to a challenge, then there were other challenges. If I chose a new challenge I wasn‚Äôt sure how to follow and participate in the community chats for previous challenges. Also, if I set specific daily habits I felt I had to check them off even if I didn‚Äôt complete them. I mean on the weekends my days were different and having the same repetitious expectations wasn‚Äôt helpful. I stopped using it all together and will probably delete the app because it was just too much and didn‚Äôt help me feel I was achieving my goals.

title: Charged for subscription I haven‚Äôt used? Help!
review: This app was super helpful a little less than a year ago when I was depressed and needed to jumpstart my productivity. I utilized the seven-day free trial and deleted the app. Today I was looking in my purchase history and found I was billed for a year-long subscription that expires in December 2020! I enjoyed the app so I downloaded it again, hoping to get use of my last few months of subscription, but I was prompted to use a free trial again. Please help? I may be interested in renewing my membership come December but want to use what I‚Äôve already paid for before committing to another year! Thank you.

title: A positive addition to my life
review: I love how it introduces small habits and does not introduce too much until you have truly solidified a habit. In the first 20 days I've focused on drinking water, exercising, and having a healthy breakfast as my morning routine. I'm happy about the subscription, and really want to introduce sustainable, positive habits into my life with Fabulous. Note: If you switch phones during your subscription, you have to re-download information in order to be able to view the letters from your Journeys. It took me some time to figure this out, but it's in the settings.

title: Excellent
review: I recently reached my breaking point. I have every opportunity to get into shape, do better at work, enhance my relationships, and just conquer the small things that feel really, really hard. About two years ago I took responsibility for my mental health and started anxiety medication. This changed my life so amazingly, that I was ready for the next step. I wanted a routine, but I get overwhelmed so fast. Other apps became too much of a chore, or asked too much to start. I like this this app actually tells me to slow down, it‚Äôs working. So far so good! I do recommend.

title: Only use if you really want to better yourself
review: This app is beautifully designed. Whoever made it put lots of time, thought, and energy into making every detail perfect. It is filled with motivating messages that actually make sense. Small snippets of videos that give you encouragement and motivation. There are different ‚Äúpaths‚Äù to take and little goals to reach along the journeys. This app appeals to my need for goal accomplishment and ease of access. It makes creating healthy habits fun and exciting. I am one week in and excited to better myself through new actions

title: Amazing
review: I‚Äôm 8 days in and absolutely loving it! This is honestly unlike any app I‚Äôve ever tried before, which I think is why I love it. You can really tell how much time, science, and love went into creating this app. It‚Äôs not always the most intuitive to navigate, but it‚Äôs absolutely worth it and doesn‚Äôt take long to figure out. I‚Äôve been attempting and failing to do this on my own for years. It seems so simple, but building a new normal is never as simple as it seems. Definitely recommend to anyone wanting to find creative ways to build new, healthier habits.

title: Too Much Going On
review: The app is incredibly overwhelming in my opinion. As someone who has had morning routines established before but fell off due to the randomness of the pandemic, I really just wanted an app that would allow me to time out and list my goals for each morning/afternoon/night. With the trial tasks, music, and constant pop up ‚Äúlessons‚Äù going through your routine in this app takes up additional time and effort. I‚Äôve since found a better app that costs a fraction for premium features and does everything I need. The price alone was enough to make me delete it, but I tied multiple times to make it work just to be sure. I would go with awakee over this for sure.

title: A sense of calm
review:
I got the free trial during a tough time a few weeks ago and the letters you receive in the app were incredibly soothing. We tend to get so caught up in our lives and forget to love ourselves. Striving for perfection is fine, but you often get lost on the way.

This app has helped me take better care of myself. Keep climbing :)

The only reason I rated it a 4/5 is the UI can get a bit confusing, don‚Äôt click the check box unless you‚Äôve actually completed the task! My first go around I couldn‚Äôt go back and had to restart my progress. But now I can go back, so I‚Äôm thinking it also could have been a bug.

title: Turn Bad Habits to Good Habits
review:
I am a recovering drug addict. I have a lot of old bad habits that I‚Äôm trying to get rid of. With the help of Fabulous, I have learned that we have to replace old bad habits with new good habits! 

I am currently on a Fabulous Journey to Manage My Addiction.  This is a program you can do within the Fabulous app. It takes anywhere from a month to 3 month to complete the Journey, depending on how often you work towards it. 

I have really enjoyed my time on the Fabulous app. I recommend it to my friends all the time! Try it out for a little while, it could change your life!

title: I love this app!
review: Highly recommend this app! I love having a routine laid out in front of me where I can check things off as I go! I think my favorite part is the progress you get to see and the story line it takes you through. I love every little detail like the app itself, the motivational/inspiring quotes and tips it give you along the way, and the letter from your future self! I just love this app so much. I really do feel that I‚Äôm not alone during this process and believe that they are helping not only my body but my mind as I continue to progress! Thank you!!!

title: Wholesome app
review: A lot of habit/exercise apps I use come with a lot of pressure. Not sure if it‚Äôs me or not lol but I know I got stuff to work through. Fabulous feels like a safe space. Their cute drawings and cartoons and little notes of encouragement make me feel safe and like it‚Äôs ok to go off track for a day‚Äîthey put me back on track with the same notes, same motivation, same encouragement, so I feel like I‚Äôm still doing ok for starting over. It‚Äôs a great feeling. Try it out if you feel like other apps aren‚Äôt working. It may help, it may not, but I think it teaches you a lot

title: Routine
review:
I‚Äôm only 4 days into this app and it has become an essential part of my day‚ú® 
It starts you off fairly easy so you‚Äôre less likely to feel overwhelmed (which was really nice). Having this app has helped me feel focused and find a routine for myself throughout the day. While utilizing the app you are given small praise for your achievements which helped me feel good about the things I was doing and helped me want to do it again the next day. Highly recommend this app for anyone who needs a life re-alignment or just to get back on track!‚ú®‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Helping me get out of being depressed.
review:
How are you, really? I like this NY slogan because asking this way may help someone share their real feelings. These  techniques are helping me change my mood, and activity level. If you‚Äôre in a rut, I recommend trying the program for the trial period. It just might help you too. 

If this program doesn‚Äôt help you, do not let that get you down. Everyone is different. Just keep looking for the method that‚Äôs right for you. If you don‚Äôt have the energy to help yourself, please reach out to someone. Help lines are available.

title: Full of great features
review: This is exactly the kind of app I‚Äôve been looking for, complete with everything I need to be motivated to work on self-improvement. The annual price for full access is doable for me, and the alarms help keep me on track. I‚Äôve had the app for three days and am already noticing a big difference. Checklists, music, reminders, all excellent ways to help me focus and get my tasks done for the day. Additionally, there‚Äôs a few exercise, meditation, yoga, and stretching features that I find very helpful for a beginner like me. If you can afford it, this is also the app for you!

title: This is going to change my life
review: The creators have obviously put a LOT of thought, heart, and soul into this app. I‚Äôd been looking for a personal transformation tool beyond just a force-yourself-to-do list. It‚Äôs so far provided me the inspiration, data, and organizational structure to change my life ‚Äî mind, body, spirit. I love the art/graphics and sounds (keep this up! Sound is so inspirational.) We are holistic beings and I love that this app attempts to recognize this. It is not perfect and at times confusing, but I LOVE that they are eliciting feedback in order to make it better. Thank you so much, Fabulous! üôèüèº

title: Great design, needs some customization
review:
I‚Äôm currently using the free version but it‚Äôs quite limited. That‚Äôs fair and I appreciate all the work put into various parts of the app. The daily reminders, Journey Roadmaps and especially having guided meditation/exercise/yoga all rolled into the same app seems great.

My main issue is that there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to track things weekly or monthly. Daily routine is a good place to start, but this app clearly tries to take a holistic approach in changing your life. I think that naturally lends itself to building habits that may happen with a longer time frame.
Eg. Pay bills on time, go out with friends X times per month, go to the gym 3 times per week.

I would definitely pay for this app if it had that option. And it seems like a much easier thing to implement than some of the current features. 

(It would also be great if I could add some bullet points to habits like ‚ÄúTake my medicine‚Äù, I could list out what I need to take and check it off. Also, why can‚Äôt I do challenges and Journeys at the same time?)

title: Exciting
review: This app is awesome! I have nothing bad to say about it, other than I wish it would save images for you and wouldn‚Äôt go to the next page on its own. I have two young kids so sometimes I can‚Äôt read as fast as it takes it away. But overall I‚Äôm happy with my progress, I love the way it‚Äôs set up and the soothing sounds it comes with it! Tomorrow is my last day of the free trial, I‚Äôm hoping I can buy for the year but if not I‚Äôm not sure how this will go. Hopefully I still have a good amount of access to the things premium has for you.

title: I would use this if there wasn't a million popups
review:
Whenever this app is advertised it is a clean and simple UI where you simply check off your daily habits. SOUNDS FANTASTIC

Actually using the app entails closing out of or reading through tons of "motivational" popups and weird letters of encouragement. These might be nice if they didn't appear right when you were trying to fill your check list. Make them an optional little side notification to explore, not a requirement to use the app.

You can't add more than 4 habits to your list unless you pay for premium.

You cant go back to the morning/afternoon if you forget to check off the habit then (even though you did it) which then messes up your progress through the app (which allows you to unlock extra habits and features) 

There doesn't seem to be a cohesive place to look at progress in a meaningful way, instead there are "chapters" that are nature themed and reminiscent of candy crush levels. 

I was so disappointed by this app in the same way I am often disappointed by predatory game advertisements. 

I hope they do an overhaul and get rid of the excess baggage.

title: Cluttered
review:
I came to this app because I would like to launch my life into the next phases of growth. I was impressed that it modulated the 'when' and 'how often' of adding new habits, and it even comes with new routine sets pre-built.  
Unfortunately, the app is very cluttery and visually distracting. It creates false storylines and posts complicated moving graphics on every page of the app. For someone with ADD, it's visually overstimulating, and it distracts me from forming my own neurological links and memories surrounding my own life story.  Visually lovely, but not useful for quick and decisive action.

The app also notified me daily about tasks that I had already completed and checked off, which undermines the sense of accomplishment.  Disappointing and frustrating.  üòï

title: Great so far!
review:
Only a few days in and I‚Äôm really enjoying the app. It‚Äôs amazing how the small changes really do make a difference and add up to big feelings of improvement. 

The only thing that‚Äôs a bit frustrating is how often you‚Äôre prompted to ‚Äúshare via [instagram, text,... etc.]. I did this as more of a personal goal for me, not as a way to share with the world. I want to be able to save the fun daily images, not have them be shared in order to save. 

Besides the sharing aspect, the app is wonderful and the storyline is enjoyable. I‚Äôve already made progress with my husband following along as well!

title: Love this app. Everyone should use it!!!
review:
I enjoy the positive effects this has on my day.  
A few months ago I stumble across this app, downloaded it, but never set it up. I was cleaning off apps on my phone that I no longer use and decided to check this one out a bit more. I am very happy I did. This app is wonderful. I love everything about it. It is positive and makes you feel happy. It nice to have the encouragements and compliments as you complete items. I really like how it starts off slow so you are not overwhelmed. Great design and functionality. üòä

title: Incredible ‚Äî Even without the subscription
review: I haven‚Äôt done a subscription because I‚Äôm cheap, but this app still delivers without one. Their approach to creating habits and routines is spot-on. Instead of just the habit, they include allll the prep work a person needs for the habit! Not ‚Äúhave breakfast every morning‚Äù but ‚ÄúGo shopping for great and easy breakfast foods sometime in the next three days.‚Äù The difference in that approach means I actually succeed in setting routines instead of feeling frustrated and defeated and deleting the app so I don‚Äôt have to see what a terrible job I‚Äôm doing!

title: Confusing design and no focus
review: I was optimistic about this app - something to help a chronically busy person build steady habits and cut out the ‚Äúnoise‚Äù. Well, this app has a lot of noise built in! Every day I went in I struggled to find where I would log my progress. Any time you start a new habit there are 2-4 more clicks and then you can start, but when you go back in to find your log?! Hmmm...where did that go?! Not effective unless you have lots of time to figure it out and play around on the app every day. I don‚Äôt think THAT is a good habit! I quit right at the end of my trial subscription but it‚Äôs still not clear if I‚Äôm going to be charged or not, just adding to my frustration. I am really put off by this entire experience.

title: Surprisingly effective
review: Motivation really needs to come from you and no app or external push is going to make that happen for you - but if there was ever something that can genuinely help you achieve your goals it‚Äôs this app. It offers a genuinely thoughtful, incremental approach to developing healthy habits with constant reminders of the psychological reasons to bother doing it in the first place. I think they called the first building blocks of their suggested routine ‚Äúmicro triumphs‚Äù, which felt spot on. Not sure yet if the habits will stick so maybe I‚Äôll leave another review in a few months..!

title: Noble, But Female Oriented
review:
It‚Äôs weird, because in the beginning, it gives you the choice of ‚ÄúMale, Female, and Non-binary,‚Äù which I think is great... but as a guy, I think it‚Äôs a little weird that when the app shows you ‚Äúyou‚Äôre future self,‚Äù it‚Äôs a silhouette of a teenage girl with a short skirt and pigtails. 

I love the idea behind this app, and it‚Äôs beautifully designed, but as a guy, it‚Äôs distracting to see the graphics constantly showing me as a young girl. Why even bother asking our gender in the first place? 

I still think it‚Äôs a 5-star app, but unfortunately, lacks gender neutrality in the design.

title: So-so so far
review:
I‚Äôve used a lot of these types of apps. While this concept is very intriguing, there is still a lot to be desired and some bugs that need to be worked out. I‚Äôve reported two so far and have yet to hear back. 

Pros: 
- It starts you out with easy to attain goals
- There‚Äôs a social aspect (though the post I submitted was lost and there‚Äôs no where to view your own posts)
- let‚Äôs you customize your routines (can‚Äôt seem to delete the one you want though, at least for me. Submitted this to support and waiting for a response still)
- a lot of variety to choose from for adding to your routines
- comes with challenges (like cutting sugar, alcohol and even live challenges that let you participate with others)
- not toxic positivity 

Cons:
- There‚Äôs a social aspect 
- the reminders could be more ‚Äúpushy‚Äù 
- support is lackluster
- the price is pretty high and in my trial so far I‚Äôve yet to see the $50/year value (but I still have a few days left)
- the guest passes you give out are a 30 day trial when your own trial is only 7 days

title: unique app! I love it!
review: This app is just so creative and makes you want to keep going! The little stories in between days makes you what to keep going with the journey of having a more calming and healthy life style! I like how they don‚Äôt rush you into things and let things go little by little to make you for comfortable, and it makes me want to keep on going to unlock these fun helpful journeys! And while your having fun your also be helpful to yourself by doing all the these healthy fun challenges! This app is so creative and amazing! 100% recommend

title: This is THE self-improvement app.
review:
I recently got the app and since the yearly price was so reasonable I got it. I heard many good reviews. Every single one is true. I have been using the app everyday for four days. I look forward to opening the app. It‚Äôs very therapeutic and I love listening to the music. 
They start slow with the goal, so you don‚Äôt become overwhelmed. The reason I ended up quitting the other goal apps was because I would put every life goal I wanted to accomplish and would be wanting too much too soon. On this app I feel guided.
-Danielle

title: Wholistic approach to build Good Habits
review: Normally, other Apps provide a checklist or ability to set reminders. But this App has a wholistic approach to building Good Habits and addresses the right questions , answers why and how a particular habit will help, and much much more so I don‚Äôt need to search in multiple sources to get the information. These Habits seem simple at first but the best part it is provides the flexibility to Add as many Habits as you would want to your routine and customize them. And to actually see your streak, gives a perspective on what can be improved on

title: Support to reach your goals at a gentle pace
review: Fabulous let‚Äôs you select the goals that are right for you at this moment. And they give you lots of encouragement through coaching, reading positive quotes and reflection on your journey. I really like the pace of this program. I have used another program that is similar to Fabulous but I felt really pressured all the time and the set up was not user friendly.  The daily readings / information/ reflection provided were like Tinder Swipe. So Horizontal. I prefer my information to be read in a verticals way. Like Facebook.

title: I think it‚Äôs definitely a benefit.
review: So I really am liking the app. It has helped me pay more attention to my goals. That said I do think there can be updates to make the app better. I feel it‚Äôs a bit in organized and when you look at it, it can be over whelming and un clear. I feel sometimes it‚Äôs hard to keep track of everything which has made it hard or made me less motivated to do my daily routine. Also with the love challenges I wish it would actually tell you what the challenge will be before adding it to your daily goal.  But other then that I think it‚Äôs pretty good.

title: Feels like a scam.
review: The app starts with very basic things like drinking water, which feels unnecessary for me. And while there are a lot of nice graphics and animations, I would rather have a direct approach; I‚Äôm not looking to be pleased by visuals but rather to reflect on myself (because that‚Äôs what mental health is about). I was trying to unsubscribe from the app but it was very hard to find the button. When I did find it, I thought I unsubscribed as soon as I answered questions about their feedback and pressed the unsubscribe button, but I didn‚Äôt realize there was yet another action to take. This is very misleading. $40 out of my account without a warning or receipt. When I tried to send them an email, the email was unable to be delivered. Honestly feel scammed.

title: Everyone should have this fabulous app!
review: When I first got this app, I wasn‚Äôt sure that I would like it that much. But when I opened it, I started getting on it everyday. It is amazing! It really works, I now have several healthy habits. It‚Äôs made my life great. If you are reading this and not sure if you should get it or not, you should get it! And you can use most of the stuff without even paying! There‚Äôs so many available stuff you can use. And there‚Äôs no ads, which makes this app even better! Shoutout to the people who made this app!

title: Great!
review: I love that it gets you into these little routines to start better habits and easily form new long lasting ones. I need something like this because of my suffering mental health from my anxiety. It‚Äôs hard to remember to do simple things like drink water or brush your teeth and go to bed early but when you have this app it reminds and rewards you! Imagine if it could have better ways to calm anxiety through physical things like deep breathing or using ice/cold to ground yourself. Even to get out of a depression episode like to remind someone who‚Äôs been in bed for weeks to brush their hair or drink some water and stretch or to even simply eat.

title: The best app ever if ur looking to change ur life.
review: This app is so nice, it actually makes me feel like it really cares for me and wants to see me success. I‚Äôve been using it for pretty much a week now and there aren‚Äôt annoying adds or subscriptions so far. I highly recommend to get this app if you‚Äôre trying to build habits and change ur life. The animations are so cute and and there are poems and little short films to explain why these habits are important. Overall aesthetic of this app is a solid 10/10. The app itself is a solid 10/10. Try it!

title: Love it
review: During pandemic, I feel lost and break down. I want to be better, become a better version of myself. But I don‚Äôt know how. I feel lost and sad. I found fabulous and I gave it a try. I love the voice and the quote they use on the app. They show and lead me to the path way. I do not feel lonely anymore. They reminded me to drink water and do meditation. The voice and the stories from the app are excellent. I‚Äôm a sensitive and emotional person. This app is really helpful and needed, especially when you are feel lonely or lost during pandemic, etc. Love this app.

title: Fabulous Works... Fabulously
review: After completing grad school (second time around), I realized I had left with many unhealthy habits and lost track of those that really grounded me to my true self. Funny, with a masters in psychiatry, you would think this wouldn‚Äôt have been so challenging for me to reset! Over the past week, I‚Äôve used Fabulous daily to help reignite some simple habits that build up to real, positive, lasting change. Highly recommend this app! I‚Äôve told so many fellow colleagues, clients, students, friends and family. You will not be disappointed! üíó

title: Accountability
review: I‚Äôve been using Fabulous for 4 days now. For the past 28 years, my parents, my teachers, and myself, have struggled with instilling a sense of self-discipline within me. I‚Äôve always been successful in school and my career, but taking care of myself and my home life have always been a struggle for me. In the past 4 days, ‚ÄòFabulous‚Äô has (gently) held me accountable for things i never prioritized. I‚Äôve found more success in overcoming these obstacles in the past 4 days than i have in my entire life. I can‚Äôt wait to see my progress a year from now!

title: A little better a little at a time
review: I have the bad habit of trying to change everything at once. I still do that, BUT this app helps me remember that even being able to do a few healthy things at a time can be good enough. Good tools to keep up momentum and articles to explain why to do the things. I feel like even if you don‚Äôt do all of the things consecutively as long as you‚Äôre doing them at all is still a step in the right direction. Looking forward to the rest of the exercises and stuff.

title: Good app
review: So far it‚Äôs been good for helping keep me mindful of staying on track to develop new habits. But I don‚Äôt like that it pushes me to use the immersive experience first thing every morning. I have an 18-month old kid that does not allow for me to hear the immersive experience and I am not going to put earphones in and listen before I‚Äôve taken care of the kids‚Äô. It‚Äôs a beautifully designed app but maybe too beautifully. I think for busy moms it would be better to have a simpler way to interact with the app and then allow us to have the immersive experience when we have a moment to really engage.

title: LOVE this app!
review: This app has helped me SO MUCH! I‚Äôve been struggling to prioritize and stay focused to get my life in order. Fabulous has helped me take little steps and feel good about myself while doing so. I had the app years ago, but didn‚Äôt do much with it. It is totally updated and SO much better. Now, instead of going on social media and wasting time looking at everyone else‚Äôs life, I‚Äôm focused on me! For the first time in my life I was able to stay focused and for DAILY healthy habits for 2 weeks straight! Everyday I look forward to my next challenge!

title: A little goofy but overall really great
review: Love the subtle mechanisms Fabulous puts in place to hold you accountable. It dissuades you from adding a second habit until you‚Äôve been going strong on your first one for a full three days, preventing the ‚Äúover commitment and under delivery‚Äù cycle I‚Äôve run into with other habit trackers. When it came to ‚Äúeating a good breakfast,‚Äù Fabulous checked in to make sure I‚Äôd thought about what ‚Äúgood‚Äù means and even created a reminder to buy the necessary groceries. Its poetry readings and storytelling are a little goofy but overall also effective.

title: Fabulous
review: When I found this app my cracks were starting to swallow me whole. My depression and my PTSD we‚Äôre at an all-time high. The way this app is set up, it‚Äôs made it easy for me to refocus all the little things. It‚Äôs helped me get back to a regular routine every day. And I‚Äôm even noticing that after about 15 years I can write my poetry in my stories again. I highly recommend this app for anybody who is struggling to find their path again. It doesn‚Äôt find the path for you but it helps you calm the mind and refocus so you can find it for yourself.

title: Helpful!
review: Ever since I got this app I have loved it! It changed my life! I hav a problem where I usually am negative and procrastinate a lot.. ever since I got this I have been doing things immediantly when I need to. I am more productive. I now have a gratitude journal... and I am more positive and am in the process of becoming a kinder person.. I learned abt meditating and now I meditate with this app! I do the yoga on here every day! And it just makes me feel better about everything.. love this app! Really recommend!!!! It also gives u ideas of what to eat and workouts!!

title: Keeps Me on Track
review: I was looking for a simple way to stay on track with daily personal goals and a regular list was not cutting it. This app is user friendly and helps you set up your day to accomplish them in the morning, afternoon and evening. These are personal goals I‚Äôd been trying to implement for years and I never met them as my days would just fly by. Now I get alarms on the app to remind me to complete my goals and it‚Äôs a nice sense of accomplishment when I get to check off a goal followed by positive reinforcement from the app. Highly recommend!

title: Overpriced & Ineffective
review: Stay away! One star is too generous. Not even remotely worth the $40 subscription! Explored this app as a potential tool to offer to my therapy clients. App is full of fluffy weird graphics and random stories meant to be inspirational but that have no truly realistic value in helping improve your motivation, or positive mental or emotional change. Beyond the basic principle of attempting to make changes one step at a time, the rest is not even pseudoscience that could even be disguised as helpful. Also make sure you cancel your trial a day before it ends or they will charge you multiple times when you cancel and blame your iTunes account, even if it‚Äôs not linked. It appears you have zero recourse for refunds no matter the reason.

title: ü§©ü§©ü§©üëåüèªüî•‚ú®üíù
review: This is literally the best personal health app I have ever had/ seen! It is so Tailored to you, and it isn‚Äôt like the others! It is nicer, especially when it sends you reminders. I recommend this app dearly. It is more than just a reminder, and it is not just trying to get downloads. This app/creators actually care about your well being, and personal health. Honestly, I‚Äôve had many apps, and none of them come close In comparison to this!! honestly, if I could give more stars I would, but I‚Äôm only limited to 5; so I will give all 5!! ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Really confusing
review:
I gave this 3 stars because the idea seems good, and maybe I works for some people, but it just seems chaotic and confusing to me. Stuff is constantly popping up - ‚Äúfabulous moments‚Äù and ‚Äúletters‚Äù - cheesy things to read that have no relevance for me. The format isn‚Äôt like anything I‚Äôve used before, and it was hard to tell what to tap to check things off or make them go away. 

What I really want is an app that will guide me through adding baby step habits to my life (which this attempts to do) but in a simple, low-energy, high-praise way (which this does not do). I want gold stars for sticking with a habit for 5 days, not a long, new agey letter to read.

title: What the heck happened?
review: I used this app briefly about a year ago and it was such a great experience. I wanted to subscribe at the time but was strapped for cash. I decided to try it again after several big routine changes, and now it‚Äôs full of frankly irritating and unnecessary flavor content, ruining the elegant simplicity which once worked so well for it. I don‚Äôt want to put headphones on first thing in the morning, and I do want to be able to close a window easily. Notifications to look at something will pop up and force you to click them or close the app entirely, and when you click them it will prematurely mark your task complete! Please, bring back the inspiring simplicity of the previous version!

title: Great app!
review: I have only had this app for 2 days, but I am loving it! I have really been struggling to create better habits, and this app really is helping to motivate me. I can already feel the success! I highly recommend this app for anyone who is struggling within themselves to create a person with good habits that they can love. I wish, however, that I could focus on some other habits that are not listed as part of my ‚Äújourney.‚Äù But I‚Äôm sure that the habits that I create through this app will really help me create those habits too, so I guess it will all work out!

title: Sugar Detox Weekend
review: I didn‚Äôt think I would be able to do it. I told my husband that. He said he knew I could. He was right because I made it through the weekend with no almost no added sugars! My cravings are fewer and less intense and I lost a pound! The letters and encouragement from the Fabulous App were amazing. I‚Äôm loving this app so far but I will admit that I have to work to not feel bad when I haven‚Äôt completed all of the tasks on my checklist. I‚Äôm sure that I just need more time to figure out what works for me and adjust the lists accordingly. Thank you Fabulous!

title: So far so good but the friend option disappointed me
review: Fabulous continuously recommended to try challenges with friends and to push each other so that I could finish them and create good habits. I was so excited that I got my friends to join but then realized you can‚Äôt actually add them or connect with them to see what they‚Äôre doing. That disappointed me so much that I‚Äôm writing this review in the hopes that they can add this feature in the future. Besides that, I love the app and it helps me push myself to create good habits and helps me get there with suggestions, advice, and soothing music. I would recommend!

title: Amazing.
review: I just started using it but I can tell you that even though it‚Äôs been a week I have seen a small improvement. It‚Äôs silly I know but when I finish a small task or accomplish something it rewards me with nice words. The voice coaching or like the little stories are so nice they are comforting. I was recommended to this app by a friend who was always in such a chaotic schedule and with time she improved and I would definitely recommend this because It has helped to have a clear mind and a good way to start the day.

title: Awesome routine builder
review: I had been listless during this pandemic. I‚Äôm unemployed needing to work again, but I hadn‚Äôt cared what time it was, what day or if I even woke up. Now I‚Äôm waking up in the mornings again. I‚Äôm drinking water, eating breakfast and starting to exercise again. Just by doing those few little things alone I have already lost a little bit of weight! Please use this app if you need the help line I do, so you can remember that you‚Äôre worth it too. Any time of day can be made into a fabulous moment when you learn to use your magic again.

title: Immersive view is not great if you have ADHD
review:
I wanted to like Fabulous, because I really need routines in my day. I have ADHD and forming habits has been a life long struggle. 

The biggest issue is the immersive view. The idea behind it is great, but it is more cluttered and distracting than the list view. There‚Äôs a banner at the top encouraging me to take notes, a timer, music, artwork, sounds for everything, and like 3 banners at the bottom I couldn‚Äôt even process at that point. 

Secondly, the app keeps you from doing most things until you have read a lesson and answered a question about whether you agree. They also play cute videos at the end to tell you about your journey. Theoretically, that should improve your commitment to your goal. In practice, it acts as a distracting barrier to the routine. 

If I‚Äôm doing my morning or night routine, I‚Äôm already multitasking by using an app. I don‚Äôt need it demanding extra cognitive bandwidth on top of that. Fabulous is meant to support my routines, but more often than not, its design gets in the way.

title: No refunds even if you canceled subscription
review:
So I decided to try the app and then ended up not being able to be on my devices all the time to do these modules they have. The concept is fantastic but it locks you to your phone all the time. For people who are always running around with no free time it probably wouldn‚Äôt work well. 

I cancelled the subscription on my phone before the trial ended and was charged the monthly fee. The refund program is very removed from real customer service agents and it‚Äôs just an automated form telling you sorry you can‚Äôt have your money back. 

The other downside of this being on the phone is that every time you pick up your phone there are other things to distract and take your time.

title: Fabulous is FAB
review: Ever since I started using this app I find myself feeling the need to follow through with the goals I set for myself. As a busy mom who works full time I purchased this app to encourage me to take time for self-care. I can honestly say this app has helped me in so many ways and I am already beginning to feel healthier and happier. I would give this app a 6/5 star rating for being such a genius idea and it has research to support the concepts taught. I‚Äôm excited to continue my journey with Fabulous and watch myself grow into a healthier me!

title: Surprisingly awesome
review: I have tried a TON of well-being apps. This is the first of them that once I skipped a day I actually found myself wanting to go back ‚Äî and not because I felt guilty. It is actually enjoyable and not nearly as cheesy, unrealistic, of or overbearing as others. Nice to see that they include the latest science and theories behind sustained behavior change and that they include references to people with kids (most apps seem to ignore that app users may also be caring for unpredictable offspring). Overall incredibly impressed so far with this app!

title: Life changing
review: I struggle with bipolar depression. Some days I can‚Äôt see the positive in life. I can‚Äôt stick to a schedule bc my mood can be all over the place. This has absolutely made a huge impact in my everyday life. It holds me accountable but in a gentle and slow way. This way it creates a change that sticks. I‚Äôve only had this app for about a week but I can‚Äôt imagine not using it every day. Don‚Äôt judge it on the first day, bc there is a learning curve. But once you get it, it truly is life changing. Thank you Fabulous for creating this wonderful app ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: An amazing tool for mental health
review: I‚Äôm usually very skeptical when it comes to downloading (and especially paying for) an app made for mental health, but this one surpassed a lot of my expectations. It allows you to use the app as a tool to help track your good and bad habits. I‚Äôm not very good at keeping up with these apps, but fabulous creates goals and soft reminders that inspire and drive me. This is one of the few health apps that makes me wish I could spend more time on it! So it becomes easy to check in, and reward yourself for those little milestones.

title: Stuck in a rut
review: Being stuck in a rut and feeling like there‚Äôs no way out has been my state of mind lately. Frustrated, upset about everything and feeling absolutely helpless have been consuming me but with fabulous, I can see through it all. Life is hard, especially 2020, but fabulous gives me that little light I need to head out of the dark and find the purpose I have been feeling I lack. It‚Äôs also giving me the confidence to move forward instead of pondering the what if‚Äôs. Very grateful to have stumbled upon this app!

title: Loving the process!!!
review: Usually I hate when I download an app that tells you all of these fabulous things about the app and it never pans out about what they are promoting, but this app is way more greater than what I expected and I absolutely love it. The subscription cost is also very low and I thought it was going to be way more expensive than what I thought it was. I feel way more confident in my daily routine now that I have it listed out and that there are reminders too. It‚Äôs 5 stars for me and I also never write a review!

title: Life-changing!
review: That‚Äôs a big statement, but my life truly has changed since I started using this app. From a life of angst I have moved to peace. In addition to following their prompts, I was moved to make changes that weren‚Äôt suggested anywhere on my screen, but were important in my life, namely faith-related. (In the past, I failed at trying to make the same changes.) This is the real deal. I bought the premium membership and encourage anyone looking to journey to a better self to do the same. (I‚Äôve never written a review like this for an app before!)

title: This app is Fabulous!
review: This app is probably the best choice I made for myself! It is really helping me improve my mental health, lower my anxiety, build more self confidence, and learn how to practice self care and love better! I am dealing with depression and high anxiety, and I can feel the improvement in my life already! I am much happier than I was before and I only have just started! I strongly recommend this app to anyone who wants to learn better self care, has low self esteem, and/or wants to make a better change in their lives for themselves!

title: Gentle reminders
review: Finally an app that doesn‚Äôt blow up my phone or suggest changing everything at once. This app started so small I almost laughed- then realized this is exactly what I need, to prove to myself I can follow thru with such basic acts of drinking water when I wake up. I‚Äôm on day 4 and have enjoyed the coaching, the availability to write notes to yourself, and it even stops me from overloading my plate (suggests to give myself more time experiencing the morning routine before adding an afternoon/evening schedule). This will be well worth the fee.

title: I love this app!
review: I am feeling fabulous already! I love all the motivational letters. I do really well when I don‚Äôt set my goals too high, and Fabulous keeps reminding me to take baby steps. In the past I have always tried to do everything all at once, and then fallen off the wagon when it is all to much. This app is reminding me to start small and slowly build up my good habits. And it‚Äôs working! The beautiful graphics, bright colors, and soothing voices help as well. This has quickly become me favorite app, and my favorite part of the day.

title: Mom of Many & Student of the Universe
review: The more children you joyfully add your your life, the more you can expect to juggle. It‚Äôs easy to loose track of your our wellness, goals, and fulfillment, for the sake of minding your family‚Äôs. This app is fabulous, rewarding, and easy to use. I find that it has added to my sense of well being the more I use it to build healthy routines. It also has increased my sense of worth as I‚Äôm meeting more of my personal goals, using its productivity tools. Try it, even for one goal, you will not be disappointed.

title: Amazing
review: I was in a huge rut and trying to make a change and I downloaded a bunch of self care apps and I am just loving it so far its great at getting you started building new habits and the infographics are my favorite. I love sharing them with friends and family when I first wake up. I love looking on the pinterest page and seeing the infographics. I am giving the live challenges a try and they seem great so far. If you are ready to build better habits and want to start give fabulous a chance. Its an amazing and realy motivating app.

title: Get the app !
review: Okay so me being me I‚Äôm broke and I can‚Äôt afford to pay the premium but ... even without it the app is still good ! Like I‚Äôm in love it‚Äôs changing me and making me like eager to do the morning routine, afternoon routine , and sleep routine because idk it like clamped and pulled my heart strings when it shows you the nice and peaceful fabulous moment . And it keeps me on track of things like breakfast, organization ,exercise , reading , etc. I really recommend this app because it‚Äôs helped me so much! It‚Äôs changed me for the positive and that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm so happy for üòÑ

title: Made by money grubbing devs, refusing to have basic decency.
review:
Thank you so much fabulous, for convincing me to sign up for the 30 day free trial, and then not giving me so much as an email to tell me they will be charging me $40, and then after emailing them asking for a refund they feed me the ‚Äú we are sorry but we aren‚Äôt going to do that‚Äù response that money hungry developers who absolutely, despite their claim they ‚Äúcan‚Äôt‚Äù refund my money, won‚Äôt because they got exactly what they wanted by asking you to sign up for the MONTH long free trial, wait for you to forget about it, and then refuse to refund your money. 

This apps developers don‚Äôt care about you, they don‚Äôt care about putting your account into the negative, they just do not care about you as a user. 

Refund my money.

title: Excellent. Pricey and a little complicated
review:
It's unclear when journeys should be embarked on early on in using the app and whether or not you should be adding your own habits or waiting to complete the journey first. Also, no student discount :(
For what the app offers, it's pricey. However, overall it seems to be an excellent program coming from someone over a week in. The slow and steady iterative approach is much more reliable than having you create a perfect morning schedule on day one and attempting to stick with it.

title: Not helpful
review: This app is so busy. It keeps adding on lists of habits to acquire which then become an additional list of things to check off. As you check off accomplishments for the day, music is played with a ‚Äúyou did it!‚Äù note, which is fine, but takes more time. It then keeps asking you to invite friends to join you. It never stops asking! It is not helpful and the screen becomes so busy with all your habits that it‚Äôs annoying to even check the app. I love the idea but it would be helpful to make it a bit more customizable in terms of layout and ‚Äúreward‚Äù as well as quieting the invite requests. Although I know having friends with you can help with goals, it comes off as suspiciously forcing you to gain the app more customers.

title: Beautifully Supportive!!
review:
I love this app!! The daily reminders keep motivation high, and if I can‚Äôt fulfill my self-chosen goal it just continues where I left off. LOVE that these are small commitments and no negativity or pressure.
I go at my own pace and have one reminder a day to try to do better, and it niggles at me untillll.... I‚Äôm becoming consistent in my habits and my day is still free, not a time-stealer. 
This is easily my best motivator‚Äî an app that understands when I miss, and forgives and gives me a gentle nudgeüòÄ. Liking the water music and graphics! 
Big thanks and much gratitude. üôèüèªüíã

title: A Real Life Change
review: This app had helped me in ways that most, if not all, of my family and friends ever could. It's hard to find consistency especially when most of the time the people I reached out to to be my accountability buddy weren't actually capable of helping me. This app however, has been able to be the best and a very supportive influence on my daily life. Progressing in life is so extremely important and should be taken more seriously. This app can most certainly help you find that. I absolutely love it!

title: LIFECHANGING
review: Okay but seriously. I did couple using this app with going to a facility that helps people with my issues. I went through a traumatic experience recently and I have healed so much. I‚Äôm doing so much better and this app has daily and even hourly encouragement!!! I‚Äôm so proud of how far I‚Äôve come. I‚Äôve made a lot of progress. I went from not being able to eat (due to lack of nutrition) and now I can eat 2 full meals! I am bringing myself around good people and drinking more water and eating good food. I‚Äôm feeling so much better.

title: Fabulous is actually pretty good.
review:
I have been using Fabulous for almost a year ; and it has helped me improve immensely. I have some great new habits and lost some bad ones. 
Actually, not using the Fabulous App for a month I regressed and started to fall back into old habits then renewed my subscription for next year and am back on it daily. 
The Fabulous App helps keeps me on track helps me stick to a routine/schedule and motivates me to follow through. Challenges help me break out of my comfort zone to try and improve all areas of my life.

title: Not a personalized app as advertised
review: You can‚Äôt control your goals, it just tells you to drink water every morning. Navigation isn‚Äôt great - reminds me of Candy Crush in how busy and overworked it is. Every time you click something, several windows pop up and none give you the information you‚Äôre looking for. Overly wordy, sends you ‚Äúletters from your future self‚Äù that don‚Äôt relate to the goals you‚Äôve selected. I selected focus-related goals and it kept sending me health-related motivation (fitness level and drinking water). The app has beautiful illustrations and a lot of information, but it isn‚Äôt usable. It could be pared down into several other apps that would work better.

title: It‚Äôs worth the money.
review: There are lots of apps out there for self-improvement. This is the best I‚Äôve tried. They start you off slow so you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. And there are endless articles, videos, and suggestions to help. The app truly does encourage me to better myself and my habits. And I‚Äôve actually done that. When I missed a week, I felt guilty and avoided the app. But when I opened it up, there was a video and exercise dedicated to helping me get back on track. It is like having your own personal life coach.

title: Could be 5 star
review: I really enjoy this app and have NEVER experienced anything like this. However, the subscription fee is steep and could be cheaper. Now, I do think that this app should come with some type of merchandise and be mailed to each user every month. Something like a journal, fancy pen, a Fabulous T-shirt, magnets for the fridge, bumper stickers for the car, shades, hats, sandals, candles, incense, notepads, planners, stress balls, stuffed animals, etc. I feel that I would be even more grateful and appreciative of being a premium member with extra incentives. I‚Äôve bought my own side journals to incorporate with this app just so I won‚Äôt be glued to my phone so much while working on my inner self. This is a Fabulous app with Fabulous features. All it needs now are some Fabulous merchandise üí´üòáü•∞
