title: Great, But Could be Better
review: I love this app and I use it a lot! I have ADHD and I tend to cycle from planning method to planning method, but I‚Äôve generally stuck to Fabulous and my routines in it since I‚Äôve had the app (for a bit over a year now I think). The only thing I think it‚Äôs missing are more yoga flows! There‚Äôs only one right now and I like it, but it would be really nice to have two or three more to switch up or to do at different times of the day. This may be a personal (and ADHD) thing, but I like variety, and sometimes I need it for a routine or task to hold my attention for the long term.

title: Quirky but really, truly effective
review: Nothing has worked in the past for me. I‚Äôm an over-intellectualizing perfectionist who is a touch too cynical. And yet, is was this colorful, narratively-driven, and deceptively clever app that found me at the right place and the right time and has been successfully helping me to create structure and find gratitude in my life. I‚Äôm on week 4, and I can already feel a massive difference... so massive that I‚Äôm telling you about it. I hope this app, or something else, makes a difference for you too.

title: Novel & Keeps my Attention!
review: As someone who shudders at the idea of structure and repetition (yikes, sounds boring!) this app was made for me! It keeps things novel and I look forward to checking off each task every day and seeing what the app has to offer me next. There are so many choices for challenges and opportunities to build habits that I know I‚Äôll be using this app for a while to stay motivated. Also great to know that it was developed by university researchers, and I can tell the science-based approach is having an impact on my daily routine!

title: Too cluttered and confusing, can‚Äôt cancel
review: This app might be great for someone who needs intensive coaching, but as a goal-setting and habit-tracking app I found that it suffers from ‚Äòfeature bloat‚Äô. There is a lot of content and functionality but it‚Äôs not organized way that makes sense, and I would often get lost and frustrated trying to do the simplest things or get back to where I was before. For example, I would accidentally click on ‚Äòfabulous moment‚Äô and get trapped in...I‚Äôm not sure what?? Anyways, the worst is that I somehow accidentally subscribed for the premium version, and now I‚Äôm out 40 bucks that I will never see again, and there is no way to cancel. Will I get fleeced for another 40 bucks in a year? Only time will tell...

title: It really is Fabulous
review: I put the app aside for a bit while I dealt with life chaos.  Finally, during the pandemic, I had time to revisit it and remember why I liked it in the first place.  1. It‚Äôs not pushy.  It helps order your thinking without annoying you with alarms making each task dreaded.  I have ADHD. I NEED to be reminded and this is such a simple yet effective tool.  I only stopped using it because phone storage ran out and I forgot my habits for a bit. Life got too busy. The fresh start reentry was just what I needed to get motivated again.

title: The interface and tools are truly helpful
review: It took me a moment to really start to use this app. Like the saying goes, you get out what you put in. Once I really began to pay attention to the habits that the app was helping me to form, paid attention to the alarms that I set and achieved goals, and focused...this REALLY HELPED ME. The interface also is lovely and is easy to use. The motivational notes and pep talks along the way, help you fuel my drive. In addition, when you have other people to chat with and ‚Äúwin‚Äù with, there‚Äôs no stopping you!

title: Just wanted to give you guys your props!!
review:
Thank you developers and to everyone else who works hard on this app. This app really has been a blessing. Wishing you guys the best success as you move forward. 

I love this app.  Been a long time off and on user. (Still struggling with consistency) It great to see all the changes they made on this app. The new features are really helpful but my favorite part  is the tips and explanation of why the habit is important or how to break it.  I‚Äôm a health coach and share this app with my members and friends.

title: Great Motivational self-help app
review: I love that this app is motivating me to create a morning routine first and slowly add in more habits to form my perfect morning routine! I‚Äôve never been a morning person before but now I‚Äôm starting to wake up earlier and get up quicker, though I still lean towards being a night owl at the moment, I‚Äôm only on day 5! but I‚Äôm improving my life slowly and it feels great! I highly recommend to all my friends and never write reviews but if I can help even just one person with this review it‚Äôll be worth it :)

title: Very helpful
review: This is really helping me get back on a routine, I no longer work full time due to illness. This is helping me set reasonable goals for things to achieve around the house and for myself. I have been doing it for 3 days now and I want to slip back into my bad habits but I go back to the app and remind myself what I have planned for the day and do my best to follow. I can say emotionally this is helping me to feel better and hopefully I will get to where physically it helps to where I don‚Äôt feel like my illness runs my life. Thank you

title: One of my 3 favorite apps for wellness
review:
You can tell the developers know a lot about what motivates behavioral change and that is awesome because it‚Äôs not willpower like a lot of other apps try to sell. I love the story elements and the reinforcement options. It is designed in a way that really integrates current data on wellness and self care. Best app of it‚Äôs kind hands down. 

I‚Äôm subtracting one star simple because the sharing moments function seems to be broken. It doesn‚Äôt usually share the thing it shows you it will share. Not a huge deal but I‚Äôd love to see that bug squashed.

title: Fabulous is Fabulous!
review: I haven‚Äôt been using this app for long, but it sure has impressed me enough to want to stay on. After completing my new habit on the first day - drinking water as soon as I woke up - I felt better and was smiling! I like the questions they ask; the chance for us to choose our new habits and think about our goals; the way in which this is done with little stories, wonderful music, encouraging statements; and the reminders to make changes slowly. Thanks Fabulous for being fabulous!

title: Fabulous App
review: I often feel that I am surrounded by impediments to completing tasks and pleasures in my day. Fabulous helps me to accept these obstacles, interruptions and then refocus. Not because my goals are more important than the impeding instances (though what can you say about technology and communication failuresü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è)but because my selected tasks and goals have value and significance also!!!   Also I am always amazed that this App affirms my essential nature. It is comforting to think that those who created this App seem to ‚Äòget it‚Äô from my perspective! In a world of dissension abounding the App is a refuge for me.

title: Artfully done imagery, music, and fantastic scripts. Needs a la carte add-on‚Äôs.
review:
Missing one star only because of a suggestion. I‚Äôd like to be able to buy features a-la-carte with one-time purchases. I‚Äôd spend a lot more money here in the app if there were features to buy in here seasonally to collect and keep. I want on-time add-ons. 

I love this app because it is visually very pleasing and rewarding to look at and I love how eloquently the stories and descriptions are written. They really engage you and game-ify your habits and make them deeply and genuinely rewarding and motivating. Very artfully done in the  imagery and the written scripts.

title: Excellent at first but turns into scam!
review: It‚Äôs a very useful app during the first few days until it offers to upgrade. Having the option is no problem but Unfortunately it‚Äôs going to charge your account regardless of what you pick. This app ran my account a total of 8 times before it got the amount. I even had the app deleted and it STILL charged my card. Very useful app, unfortunately your money is on the line while using it. I‚Äôm going to contact someone today about a refund.

title: Too clogged
review: I‚Äôve been using this app since it first came out and it has been one of the best tools! However, as time went on, they added more and more to the interface where it is now too clogged and hard to look at. I kiss how simple the interface use to be. Now I can‚Äôt even get the alarms to go off no matter how many instructions I follow. Without the alarms and push notifications I use to get, this app has become quite useless to me. I‚Äôve kept it installed for years without using it in hopes that the alarm will finally go off one day.

title: Holding me accountable table - sooo easy to follow along with
review: So far this app has helped me restart the life I want for myself. In reality, sometimes it‚Äôs hard to start on your own. Life is crazy, man! However, the slow-build to better my daily life is realistic and just makes so much sense. If you truly are looking for change and do it the right way, slowly but surely. Give this app a shot. My gah, it‚Äôs in $5/month. I think you can manage without a cold brew coffee/drink once a month to gain control of your routine.

title: Charged for an app I didn‚Äôt want
review: A friend recommended this app and sent me a link through their Fabulous app so I could try it. I did not like the app at all because it is badly organized and it was impossible to find the features I wanted. PLUS: the app automatically registered me for a premium subscription that I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO CANCEL. This was a complete waste of time and now they are charging me for a subscription that I cannot find - not in my apple account or through the App Store. I am still trying to figure out how to cancel this useless subscription. All in all: the app features are badly organized, and even their subscription system appears to be so badly organized that it‚Äôs impossible to cancel payments.

title: See potential not results
review:
I can see where this app is going, and I think it could be great, but it‚Äôs not how I would go about building a habit. I hated that I couldn‚Äôt add my own personal goals to my ‚Äújourney.‚Äù There are specific things I want to change about my life and lifestyle. So I think it‚Äôs a great app if you are going for a lifestyle change, but if there are just certain habits you want to make, I would suggest a different app. 

Another thing I struggled with is I asked for no motivational emails, as I find them more cluttering and just another thing to move to the trash, unread. But I still get them EVERY SINGLE TIME I mark down a goal for the day. I found it very frustrating

title: Interactive Journey to Productivity
review: This app makes productivity and wellness a traversable journey. You constantly take on new habits and internalize them, and in turn, you form a better opinion of yourself; of the things around you. Wellness is a lifestyle and this app helps guide you to start living it. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this app more highly in terms of anything that performs the same/similar functions, but you can always use apps that could help in conjunction with this one (i.e. a meditation app, a workout app, a journaling app).

title: Holding the Gains
review: I have made efforts in the past to make changes in my life that have failed. Not all of course but I didn‚Äôt realize how important starting small, making gains and then building on those gains is to achieving the overall success I was looking for. I am finding that out now. The messaging is so helpful and you get it early and often and it always seems to be the right message at the right time. And you go at your own pace. I highly recommend you give it a try.

title: Simple but surprisingly rewarding and refreshing
review: I have always felt I just go with the flow. I never felt I had direction or a schedule per day! At first I thought it was maybe a little simple and unnecessary. It starts you tracking simple habits that you might already do! I started noticing I was more mindful within the first week. I feel more aware and present in my life now. I am surprised to say I actually did pick up new habits, as well as curbed others. Apps like these are what you make of it, but it‚Äôs top notch.

title: It‚Äôs deep cleansing; great illustration posters!
review:
This is not an app to simple check off your todo list. It‚Äôs a gateway to your true self. Besides daily habits you can choose from, it has behavioral science structure in place where it will encourage you, and set you up with mechanics to foster long term success. Bc most people do want to make positive changes but it is hard to be motivated all along.

I also like the poster after each action. It‚Äôs so simple, informative and great illustration in macaroon colors!

I especially like the ‚Äòchallenge project‚Äô where you can choose your own focus, and join a community of people who shares their progress and struggles. I am doing 5-day decluttering challenge. First day is to ask yourself ‚Äôwhat ideas/thoughts are holding you back?‚Äô 

That‚Äôs very cool, and helping me become more authentic to myself. That‚Äôs why we wanted change after all. 

Good job Fab team!

title: Keeps things simple
review: I have a problem with trying to do too much. And end up getting overwhelmed and having to drop things off my list. Fabulous is slowly building up habits in a way where I‚Äôm not overwhelmed and can do it. It‚Äôs almost bringing time to a healthier mindset of less is more. And from all the reading I‚Äôve done about habits, this is the way you‚Äôre supposed to build habits. One at a time in a slow progression. I also like the encouragements and articles and check offs every day.

title: It really works
review: I am so impressed by this app.  I was in a place where I wanted to be told how to be successful without any preconceived notions of how to do it (or else I wouldn‚Äôt need the app).  By following the recommendations and keeping an open mind, I‚Äôve been very successful at maintaining a daily routine that has made me more productive, less stressed, and healthier.  The design is a little different so it took a little getting used to but I am so happy with the premium upgrades and have not stopped recommending it to friends.

title: Stop what you‚Äôre doing and buy this app
review: I am someone who struggles to create new habits with my ADHD. I might be the worst! I try so many new ones but fail most of the time. I‚Äôve tried many apps on the market to try and instill habits, but none have worked as long as this one. won‚Äôt have it I‚Äôve been waiting to achieve. The Fabulous app is different - the structure makes it possible for anyone to feel successful and it starts out slow and steady. I love this app and I tell all my friends about it!

title: Nice app would recommend
review: I‚Äôm broke so I can‚Äôt get the premium, but I think it‚Äôs quite fair. It has a nice format, idea, and concept. The premium sounds rly cool and if you have the money I recommend you go for it. The only thing I would like the Fabulous team to add into the app is the ability to create your own habits. This is because I have very specific needs I feel like I could make into a healthy daily habit. Other than that, totally recommend 5 stars it helped me become healthier in so many ways üíï

title: Too Glitchy
review:
I‚Äôve had this app for a couple of years. My first year I loved it, but after some major updates the app is full of glitches. It only stays open for about 30 seconds before the whole thing crashes. I can‚Äôt read or check off a single thing because it shuts down - it‚Äôs basically unusable at this point. It‚Äôs already an expensive app to begin with, the fact that it can‚Äôt stay open is very disappointing. I‚Äôve tried contacting their help feature several times now.
I don‚Äôt believe this is a problem with my phone since all my other apps are working perfectly. 
I‚Äôd love a refund if the app is going to remain unusable, but I‚Äôd much prefer they fix the app so I can use its features.

title: Great idea, but needs alot of improvement
review: This app is an awesome idea, but even after paying for a premium membership (which I didn‚Äôt even mean to buy, but the app mislead me) I‚Äôm still constantly prompted to invite friends and answer stupid questions. This should be optional in settings. I‚Äôd also prefer more guided challenges. The action items are only in the discussion area and you can only view the discussion for one challenge even if you‚Äôre subscribed to more than one. I read the reason they did this in their help section, but some challenges actually work hand in hand with others so this is really annoying. The app overall is difficult to follow.

title: Baby steps
review:
When I found fabulous I was in a rut feeling like a failure and disaster so I bought the app immediately because the name of it spoke to be and now I no longer let all my days blend together because the alarms of fabulous signal me my meditations make feel each day is a fresh start and while I am not perfectly using the app I‚Äôm up and moving again and eating nutritiously again so I‚Äôm grateful and determined to get better at using all the wonderful tools within the Fabulous app.
Thank you Fabulous

title: Horrible App
review:
Absolutely a horrible app. I found it extremely confusing and decided it was not worth my money. I cancelled during my free trial but lo and behold they still charged me for the year and refused to refund my money. It‚Äôs not my problem if you app is janky and has issues working. I would highly recommend passing on this one.

Edit 11/30

Funny that I got a response here saying they are ‚Äúwilling‚Äù to help me if I emailed them. I did immediately after they fraudulently charged me and they refused to help me then. Obviously you can see from all the 1 star reviews that this is common problem with users. I also canceled a week before my trial was supposed to end so the 24 hr prior charge doesn‚Äôt apply here.

title: Shame or Love?
review:
That‚Äôs what every decision and action book to, for me. I realized most of mine were/are based in shame. 
I have gone through, and will continue, years of therapy. It has been the toughest thing I‚Äôve ever done. One of the hardest parts is practicing love and not shame.
This app was a little overwhelming, but colorful. It has a lot of positive, encouraging , loving phrases every time I do something. So when I beat myself up for being a loser... lazy... pathetic... dumb; it reminds me that I‚Äôm taking the steps to improve myself at my pace.

title: Surprised me
review: I actually really like this app, it was a lot more than I expected. Other than the fact that you have to pay for the whole version the app is really great, it gives you tons of things that you can do within the free version that other apps do not allow you to. I love the fact that it gives you the ‚Äúfabulous moments‚Äù that really makes me want to complete my goals. This isn‚Äôt like an ordinary planner, you get to make your goals, but it‚Äôs rewarding to you and it makes you feel happy. I would definitely recommend.

title: Morning Motivation
review:
I‚Äôve been using Fabulous for almost two weeks and it‚Äôs been a positive experience. Daily quotes from distinguished authors, journaling, healthy habits, and community to keep engagement. Sometimes the app feels a little slow, although it helps to keep me focused and remember that using this isn‚Äôt about beating anyone else, just joining together to bring the community to that goal of inner peace.

Starting to notice all the small ways that fabulous has helped me improve, and that knowing the road that seems easy to walk rarely is.

title: Fabulous app!
review: Wow, I was a bit surprised when I downloaded this app and all the features it has. It really is a life changer if you want to get into self-care and self-love. It has everything, self-challenges, and if you work better with friends you can challenge friends to join you. You can write a bunch of notes and journals about how you feel based on prompts, etc. and there are so many other things I have yet to uncover. And a lot of features are available free!

title: Surprising useful
review:
I never think that these kind of apps would work. However, lately I‚Äôve been having trouble with balancing my life, and it just wasn‚Äôt good.

When I got recommended this app I gave it a try, and at first I was hesitant because it was only giving me a free trial, and afterwards it would be around $30 for an entire year. I did some consideration and and tried the free trial. 4 days later (today) in slowly feeling better about my life, and while I know there is so much more to work on in my life I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm getting a start to make it better. 

There is so many activities on here to help with yourself, and no matter what issue you have there is always something to help out. 

As of now I‚Äôm in love with this app because it is helping me become a better ME! 

Hopefully I can give an update to give an honest full review on this!

title: MISLEADING ‚ÄúFREE‚Äù TRIAL - Not Fabulous
review: Do not try this unless you are willing to preview the app for $50! This product did not work for me. I requested to cancel before the free trial was up and was charged the next day for a year membership - there is no monthly option. There is no customer support so you are misled thinking you can preview the app before investing. For an app based in behavioral science, they use tricks to take your money. Eventually this bad practice is going to catch up with Fabulous. Also, the email address in the previous reviews is an ‚Äúunmonitored‚Äù inbox so you get an auto reply with instructions that send you in a circle with no real reply. The only way to get someone‚Äôs attention is to write a bad review.

title: Better than Expected
review: This app is honestly pretty awesome. I‚Äôm already seeing changes in habits. This app has almost seamlessly become apart of daily routine and I actually look forward to opening the app and checking off which goal I completed for the day. I also look forward to the small pieces of info and daily inspiration. The app is put together very nicely and with a lot if thought. I‚Äôd recommend for anyone to try it out, you may be surprised how much you change in a week.

title: Writing a Review about this app.
review:
It‚Äôs very good, it‚Äôs helped me achieve goals and I only started Saturday night. Ever since then I haven‚Äôt been working too much about school or anything in general, it keeps you notified if you tell them to remind you and to me it keeps me motivated to keep me doing the next thing and updated 

That‚Äôs why I think you understand and you should get this app. Also it‚Äôs helped me with stress lately. I even started eating breakfast as one of my Goals for school or anytime.

title: Really good.
review: I didn‚Äôt think exercise apps like this work. Usually I download them and have them on my phone for a while and never use them. This one is different tho. This one motivated me to continue the steps. They start off small so it‚Äôs not overwhelming. It‚Äôs also very interesting because they give you a story and they give you a piece everyday which makes you want to come back and continue the story. I wish that the premium didn‚Äôt exist tho because they have some pretty cool stuff that‚Äôs locked for premium only.

title: Built on what works
review: I‚Äôve read a lot of self help on starting habits and developing growth mindsets, so I understand how this app works and know that it‚Äôs based on real science.  I‚Äôm not learning much by using it that I didn‚Äôt already know, but it‚Äôs nice to have the app and the community behind it helping me along so I don‚Äôt have to do everything myself.  It‚Äôs very easy to customize and feature packed but it starts you off small and slow so it won‚Äôt overwhelm you.  Try it and see how it feels

title: Best Habit/Routine Tracker I‚Äôve Tried Yet
review: I‚Äôve tried several apps like this, and Fabulous is a better fit for me than others I‚Äôve tried because it has the most structure. It does seem quite flexible/personalizable if you have specific goals in mind, but if you‚Äôre struggling with routines and intentionality at a more fundamental level (as I have been in late 2020/early 2021), this app requires less decision making at the outset and a clear path of incremental, concrete steps to take toward establishing sustainable routines.

title: Great app
review:
I honestly did not know what to expect when I got this app but one thing is for sure and that is the app is very helpful. 
I had zero morning routine before this and my sleep schedule was all messed up. 
Now that I‚Äôm about a month in my sleep schedule is on track and I‚Äôm actually motivated to drink water, eat breakfast, and get a small amount of exercise in every single morning. That motivation fuels my day. 
Also you don‚Äôt have to pay to use. Which is fantastic. 
Thanks Fabulous!

title: Skip this app pleaseee
review:
Everything I‚Äôm going to write will be relevant to your experience with the app and how they could hinder you from actually forming habits. 

I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to skip the water habit because I already do that every morning. Therefore, it made 3 days of my free week trial validating something I already knew I could do. 

Next, the app will freeze and stop working on my phone. It takes so lonnnng to load the next page. 
When you open the app a melody plays, every time!! There are so many pages where music, a voice is speaking, or a sound is playing and you just want it to stop. So annoying. 
There is so much going on in the illustrations. For example, the gradients and all the colors. The detail in the map is so much when all its showing you is your progress. It doesn't have to be that detailed, ‚Äújust keep it simple stupid.‚Äù 

Finally, the costumer service is TERRIBLE. So if you need a refund for any reason such as getting charged even if you cancelled its a struggle. 

If you want to form habits check out BJ Fogg Tiny Habits and start there.

title: Worth a try
review: I found this app without looking for it, but it‚Äôs really helped me establish goals and been a good accountability partner to help me stick with the habits I‚Äôve always wanted to create. It‚Äôs a little confusing as far as there is no ‚Äústep one, step two, etc.‚Äù (reasons 4/5), but I would recommend it for anyone who needs gentle guidance with establishing healthy routines and habits. I‚Äôm curious as to how effective it is for long-term changes, as I‚Äôve only had it downloaded for a week. You have to be willing to change though, it won‚Äôt do the work for you.

title: What I needed in my life.
review: Helps motivate me! I always have tried to write my goals down, but that does not fully help me achieve them. I love using my phone and always have it by me. I go to fabulous to see what I need to get done and accomplish any tasks I put off, instead of endlessly scrolling through social media apps. I like that I can form habits and create new ones with this app. Keeping a log of my accomplishments without having to reach for a pen and paper is an even bigger plus!

title: Much better than the first time I tried it.
review: I tried this app a couple years ago and lost interest pretty quickly. It‚Äôs different but familiar now. Of course, so am I. I already seem more drawn into after a week. A big difference is that it seems to be building on itself quicker than before, which I like. There‚Äôs a really feeling of gathering momentum rather than baby stepping through self improvement. It feels like a big difference and I‚Äôm much more engaged.

title: I have been looking for an app like this all my life
review: Finding a routine that works has been a struggle for me. I know routines are good for us, and I‚Äôve tried to start many things before hoping I would find something that sticks to energize me again. This app has made creating and committing to a routine simple and shame-free. Each habit is paired with a visual and musical experience that brings awareness to the moment. It has special prompts and inspirational coaching. Worth the cost! Highly recommend it!

title: Lots of Potential
review: If you can figure out how to customize the app to your liking, it has the potential to be very powerful. I had a lot of morning routine habits already in place when I began the fabulous app, and I have added them to my Fabulous morning routine. With a target duration for each habit, Fabulous helps me to stay on task. Looking ahead to various other available ‚Äújourneys‚Äù, I see the potential for growing myself in the areas of purpose and community after the app has helped me solidify the foundation of my self care habits, routines, rituals.

title: This app is a huge tool in my self growth journey
review: Fabulous really has it all, folks. It has the tools and guides for doing inner work and outer work. From moving on from the past to working out. I haven‚Äôt gotten there yet, but I even saw a journey that shows you how to help out your community. And that‚Äôs just scratching the surface. I highly recommend you get the premium membership. Paying for premium is cheap and it provides even more motivation because it is a monthly investment in yourself.

title: Habit building app that tries most of all to make a habit of its own growth flytrap
review:
I get it. I‚Äôm a tech PM too. You want shares because shares drive adoption. But If the habit I want to break is social media, I really don‚Äôt want to post, share, tweet, message, or even read your ‚Äúinspirational‚Äô content. I just want the tracking, meditation, and in-app Pavlovian conditioning i was promised.  Everything else is great, but it‚Äôs just day 2 and I‚Äôm looking for another app. 

And I was on the cusp of paying for Premium. Fix it, at least for premium customers - give us the option to turn off all social media and comms links. I don‚Äôt care if community is proven to help. Some of us literally are trying to build independence from the validation of digital ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù.

title: Recommend this
review:
I recommend this app to all of those who really want to have a better life because this app help me within the free seven day trial that I had and now I just have the natural habits by myself but I did buy the subscription which really helped improve myself even more. I definitely recommend this to all those who want a better lifestyle.

If the developer (s) could respond to this and make it so lots will see, that would be great‚Äô but I totally Love this app

title: App support stinks - important feature stopped wo
review:
I loved Fabulous!!! Life changing!  So why the crappy review? A major feature of the app that is critical to keep going- morning coaching has stopped working. I waited a week to see if it would fix them itself. I followed every suggestion that I could find - no luck. Two support requests that only received a ‚Äúthank you for contacting us - we are experiencing high volume‚Äù email followed by nothing for over. That was three weeks ago.

If an app is designed to become an integral part of your day and mental health they have a responsibility to keep it working.

Please up your game so I can go back to loving the app

title: Fabulous is a very helpful tool
review:
Thank you for this great tool!  Have been enjoying it a lot.  
A few things however I don‚Äôt quite understand.  In none of your emails or messages is there a name at the end.  It‚Äôs a bit impersonal I find.   Or are you trying to play ones future self?
Also, the daily coaching is done with such a calm and empathetic voice.  When I got to the exercises I was so surprised about the commanding tone in the instructors‚Äô voice.  Is it on purpose to stimulate ones willpower?
Thanks and keep up the great work!!!

title: Confusing
review: I want to love this app‚Äîgreat idea and beautiful graphics. The app itself is time consuming. It constantly shows 6 notifications & when I check the app, there is no clear indication of what the notifications are. The menu path is winding rather than logical. When I don‚Äôt want to do something the app wants me to do, there is no way out of the prompt other than closing the entire app. I‚Äôd like to explore it further, but the billing criticisms are a concern. I have apps for meditation, household chores and my calendar/email battling for my attention. I need this to be a little more precise and clear cut.

title: Life changing
review: If you truly follow the plan I can see how it truly brings about change. I have ADHD and this app helped me conquer the number one obstacle in my path. Me. I would always rush into trying to create a routine that encompassed everything right away. With the building blocks and gentle reminders from the app I was able to build my routine one piece at a time and was less over whelmed and have managed to stick with it much longer than anything else I have tried !

title: Fabulous
review: Very excited about this app! It‚Äôs colorful, fun, positive, and so far very effective for me for developing good habits/goals and dropping ones that are not positive. It‚Äôs obvious that a psychologist had a part in putting this together. It will be interesting to see if this app will help people stay motivated in the long term after the newness wears off. My only constructive criticism is that initially the format seemed confusing and a bit all over the place. With time and practice though I‚Äôve begun to understand how it works. If I could, I would have given this app 4.5

title: Everything‚Äôs good except the new daily coaching!
review: I like this app, enough to have paid for the annual subscription. I‚Äôm glad that they‚Äôre updating and seem to be gaining traction, but the new daily coaching lessons aren‚Äôt quite what they used to be! I found the original voices much more soothing and the constant pop culture references and jabs at trying to sound ‚Äúcool and hip‚Äù and ‚Äúrelatable‚Äù are really annoying! Why are they making references to ‚ÄúThe Office‚Äù and such? What if you don‚Äôt particularly care for that show? Plz try to keep it more zen and self-development focused..

title: Annoying, sorry
review: It looks like someone put some thought into creating a useful app here.  Sadly I hate to even open it because I know it is going to take time to deal with all the nifty surprises and a sales pitch when what I really need at that moment is the to-do list to check things off.  The menus are unclear; it seems that if you ignore processes when they are presented then you do not have the opportunity to go back and re-visit later.  When I schedule a morning routine I do not expect to be sidetracked into adding further items and developing new routines by the very app that is supposed to be helping me stay on task.  The music is too loud and intrusive first thing in the morning and at night as well.

title: Perfect lifestyle changing app
review: I recommend this app to everyone that‚Äôs trying to get their life right. It‚Äôs going to change your life for the better in so many ways! The premium is expensive, but they still have everything you need to completely turn your life around for free. I highly recommend that everybody just follow this app‚Äôs instructions for a week, and then decide if they wish to continue. Thank you for making this app!!!

title: This is my first app review and I‚Äôm 27.
review: I love this app! It is helping me make slow and steady changes which is helpful with my mental illness and ‚Äúall or nothing‚Äù personality. I am also dealing with the side effects of Covid - I‚Äôm having trouble remembering things. Having a tangible way to check off meds, tasks, and self care is helpful for that ‚Äútime loss‚Äù. Highly recommend to anyone who is wanting to change habits, introduce new ones, or have a better wellbeing overall. Thank you Fabulous!

title: So many options and lots of possibilities!
review: I stumbled on this app and I‚Äôm having a great time exploring and starting with some slow changes but there‚Äôs TONS of options. It‚Äôs really a great app so far. $35 bucks worth of options, goals broken down and support. There are live challenges even, where you can post on progress and get support. Save the money on a new calendar or diet and TRY this. It even has meditations and stories to help you if you get stuck. It‚Äôs really awesome!!

title: Too slow
review: cute at first, but far too slow at getting started. it seems like they‚Äôre trying to push you out of the trial period and get you to subscribe. the first habit the app tries to get you to form is to drink water, WHICH I ALREADY DO. it was super frustrating to have to wait 3 days for a new habit, so i deleted the app. having to click through ‚Äúletters‚Äù and ‚Äúfabulous moments‚Äù first thing in the morning also didn‚Äôt really do anything for me. i‚Äôm not one who gets anything out of reading inspirational quotes, so the whole thing was just kind of fussy to me. sad, because they really could be onto something with how cute their interface is.

title: Very pleasing design and helpful approaches to lifestyle change
review: This app is pretty affordable and gives me what I need such as helpful cues to guide me to making positive changes with small goals such as flossing or drinking water- tasks that I tend to avoid but am much more likely to complete them with the way it reminds me and supports my process. As I get better, the more it offers different supports like healthy eating, exercise, etc. I think it‚Äôs a cool splurge as far as apps go.

title: Enjoying the first week with this app!
review: I started my habit of drinking water in the morning when I wake up for at least a year now. I always bring water by my bedside. It‚Äôs nice to stay on a streak :-) I like that I can check it off via an app. I also like that I can add more habits I‚Äôm trying to master. Today I joined my 1st live challenge of taking deep breaths daily. I‚Äôve wanted to be more consistent in my meditation, and I believe this challenge will help me meet my goal. It‚Äôs a great app! Highly recommend!

title: This app is a waste of money
review: I initially looked into this app because of the awards it had and reviews. This app is so stupid. I signed up for the premium version because I was excited to build habits went through the whole set up. All it is, is a whole bunch of notifications with no useful offerings. Legit this is just an upgrade on UI from the reminder app on your phone. They give you letters on health/wellness but it‚Äôs just repetitive content that you have heard throughout your life. Chances are that if you looking into this app because of wellness motivation, you will not be offered anything useful or new. Try the free week just to receive a notification everyday to drink water lol

title: Game changer!
review:
If you‚Äôre reading this review it means you are deciding wether or not to download this app. Don‚Äôt let your pride or doubt dissuade you from utilizing this incredible tool. Simple, to the point, and fun. It‚Äôs amazing what a few little tweaks to your daily routine, with a dash of joyful encouragement and a sprinkle of accountability can do. I use the free version if you‚Äôre telling yourself this is a fake review. Do your future self a huge favor and try it out for a week. It‚Äôs worth the time you will spend.
I promise.

title: Starting small
review: After one week of starting with small changes I already feel those habits creating a stronger foundation for each day. I wake up happier and I take moments to be present. I have become more aware of myself and my body. When bad situations creep up, I now feel like I can take the time to rethink of how to react. This program, so far, is amazing! It really encourages tiny steps of habitual change, which is far better than unrealistic big changes.

title: Astounding. A truly unique app.
review: I can already tell after 6 days using it the effects it has had in teaching me how to change old habits and create new ones‚Äîones that aren‚Äôt just default behavior. Clearly, a lot of time and effort went into making this app. The storyline and writing is top notch. The animation and effects draw you in and just make you feel good. As far as self help goes, this is the next level. Most of all, it‚Äôs just fun to use and explore.

title: Most Effective way to make a change!
review:
I have struggled with routines for years. I tried many different techniques with varied success. Fabulous really excels at simplifying the process of habit development and is encouraging along the way. I experience more energy and am able to maintain my goals even through distractions or outside impacts. 

Fabulous is the right place to get help and take control of your routine. If you are struggling, this will be the solution you have been wanting.

title: Life changing..starting
review:
I have a low tolerance for self help. I love this app. Im‚Äôm disabled and can get depressed and unmotivated. I started with brush my teeth. 9 out of 10 days that is achievable. It shouldn‚Äôt have changed everything but it did. From there I added more habits. Pt, cleaning, 3 important things. Start with one habit and build.

Update I purchased the full package which is now unavailable and won‚Äôt update on my phone. I also wish there was a way to just use the app and timer. I do not have time to meet myself every morning. I have to get everything done before I run out of energy

title: This App Makes Life Easier
review:
You can suggest ways to make the app easier or vote on another idea. The app has improved since I last tried it, and it was amazing even then, so I can‚Äôt wait to see how great it will be in ten years. 
 You will make new habits and a routine for morning, afternoon, and evening. I got five free 30-day passes to give out. Mine was only a week, but my first year was just $3/month. Make that first step and download this app. I‚Äôm glad I did! Enjoy your new journey.

title: Loveee
review: I‚Äôm very unorganized and have trouble starting routines, this app has made it possible for someone like me (ADHD) to keep track and organized throughout my day. It holds me up to a higher standard and reminds me to complete daily tasks to stay on routine. 100% recommend. Especially if you are trying to incorporate certain habits in your life, better sleep, healthy eating, studying, exercise. I did get the premium but I felt like to get the most I needed to. Choice is up to how you feel.

title: Incredible vehicle for change
review: I love the beautiful graphics, the animated interactive play, how personalized it is, the map, the focus on journey, all of it! I‚Äôm inspired every day and it seems that every time I click the app, there‚Äôs something new to read, to check off, or to engage with. Habit building is HARD! But if you choose to give this app a shot, take it slow and let the app lead you- I found the most success with approaching it this way. I am in LOVE with this app!

title: So far so good!
review: I‚Äôm on day three and already feeling more confident in my ability to stick to goals. The app is very creative and different from any other habit tracker. My favorite part is the story-based elements! The little water sounds when you drag in a habit are very cute. Not super intuitive but as they say, that‚Äôs the point. It‚Äôs meant to be an instrument. The team clearly put a lot of research in! If I could fix one thing I wish there were more tutorials or even video tutorials after day 1, I did feel a little lost on day 2. Great app!

title: Daily improvements!
review: Love seeing the growth on a week to week basis, sometimes even a day to day. When a habit settled and implemented, it feels really good. I‚Äôm grateful there are some healthy apps focused on improving quality of life. I needed something like this. Worth the money if it can better my life for years to come. Only paid once for life too. I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing how much more I can learn, and who I could be in a few years or even next. Pretty neat. Five stars.

title: Very helpful
review:
I‚Äôve used it for a good while now and it honestly is life changing. It forced me to slow down and implement one tiny change at a time and wow those changes stick so much better when I take it slower. The encouragement I get from the app is really great too. 

The only drawback for me is that I wish the diet talk and food jugements were optional; as someone with a past history with an eating disorder, I prefer not to have my food choices labeled as bad or good, especially without any warning or opt in/out feature.

title: I love this dang app
review:
It really does help get you to start what you've set out to do, and using scientifically backed techniques, it sets the foundation of what will help make you the best person you can be.

My only complaint is a tiny one that's kind of like "well now you're just being picky", but I do sort of wish that we could save the daily journals and reflections to view later. I've been in the app for over a year and there have been so many wonderful quotes that I wish I could just pull them all up at once, but they currently disappear into the abysess. To be able to go into the archives and look back on all that you've achieved and seen would be phenomenal.

But really, I drink water when I get out of bed, my nightly routine is stronger, I'm eating healthier, I'm exercising daily-- and I can thank this app for helping me form those habits. 

STRONGLY reccomend giving it a shot.

title: Step in the right direction with legitimate use of apps potential
review: Been struggling for years with being blatantly honest with myself in the hope to find root issues and discontinue negative behaviors/habits/mindsets and so far this app has helped to atleast get me started and have something solid to focus this on instead of a mind full of disorganized thoughts, I see real potential in this app as a tool as my goals continue I‚Äôve already bought the year subscription ü§ç‚ú®

title: So engaging!!!
review: I‚Äôm really digging this app! There‚Äôs so many engaging experiences from exercising to breath work, meditation challenges and daily reminders to make your bed. I love that I‚Äôm able to customize my own routines, add to them, or when I‚Äôm finished with a goal, there‚Äôs so many other challenges and goals to tackle. The sounds, speakers and visual art is amazing (especially with headphones). This is really keeping me on track and engaged which is always my downfall when I try to stay healthy!

title: Creative and Engaging
review: I‚Äôve enjoyed using this app so far to build healthier habits. I‚Äôve tried many different habit tracker type apps, but this one stands out because it uses colorful and imaginative ways to talk about habit building and the mind. It is very engaging and is designed to make you feel like you are on a journey or quest rather than a regimented task. My husband enjoys the frequent reminders, activities, and narratives provided that reinforce the habit you are building. Could be great for kids too!

title: Love the app, but constant crashing :(
review: I had an old version that was stable, upgraded and it crashes constantly when managing lists. Force restart keeps it stable briefly then it starts crashing every time I enter a routine to update progress. Also, in this latest version the Fab moment button is constantly bouncing, bad UX. That‚Äôs not my primary goal in the daily routine menus, I‚Äôm there to check stuff off. It‚Äôs annoying and not sure what the product goal is. It even bounces when I have nothing checked off. Sad I upgraded. If you fix the crashing at least I‚Äôd give the app 5 stars. I‚Äôm on iPhone 7 with the latest iOS version.

title: Always Something to Look Forward To
review: Very colorful, sound effects are interesting. There is always something new and exciting to watch or read or work on for self improvement. It can be a bit jumbled and you feel like you‚Äôve missed something some there are so many buttons you can push and choices to select but it‚Äôs also like finding small gifts and surprises when you find a new tool or button.

title: When you want to be held accountable
review: I‚Äôm an organized and hard working person but I have my flaws. One being I get easily distracted! Lately I‚Äôve been getting too distracted and this app helps me stay focused. It holds you accountable, has a great community, and the UI is simply motivating! Love the journey stories and all the features available. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth the money for you because I know I‚Äôm always on my phone anyway might as well add some motivation to my work routine.

title: BEST SELF-CARE APP EVER!!!
review: Fabulous is just what I needed!  I tried everything to build go habits like different articles, apps, journals, websites, and more. Then I found Fabulous.  I didn't have high hopes for it in the first place and I thought it was like all the rest but I WAS WRONG!  It will keep you on top of your habits and it will give you new healthy habits!  Some of them may seem very small and won't make a difference but just stick to it and it will make a difference!  Thank you for you time!

title: High Quality Twist to standard habit apps
review: Fabulous is not only a personal habit tracker. It‚Äôs a science backed, personal guide through the process of building small habits which will lead to the bigger changes you know you really want in yourself. It just takes time. If you‚Äôve been using other apps, trying to make something stick, and having things fall through, maybe it‚Äôs because you‚Äôve been doing it alone. Try Fabulous! They‚Äôve got you.

title: Good but could be better.
review:
My issue is that it isn‚Äôt structured or intuitive enough. I find the app slightly confusing, because I don‚Äôt know if/when I‚Äôm supposed to click on different things to proceed on the ‚Äújourney‚Äù it lays out. 
Maybe it‚Äôs my age (40) ‚ÄîI guess the app is designed for young people who find it really intuitive. (But I‚Äôm not new to using apps, either!) I think I would get more out of it and find it more helpful if it was just super straightforward and structured‚Äîdo this thing today, click here now, here‚Äôs what you do tomorrow, now check it off here, etc.

title: Uncannily successful
review: This is somewhat scary, after failing at making new habits for roughly 35 years of my life at least the past 35 years I am experiencing success right off the back‚Ä¶ OMG I‚Äôve looked for many apps that promise this and have failed. Maybe this review is premature it is only day 2 but for some reason I am feeling very confident more than I have ever before. Maybe because of the ease in which I am accomplishing the challenge that was set for me. Prays for me as I push forward .

title: Pretty great!
review: I like it so far! I have only had it for a couple weeks but it send you notifications to make sure you‚Äôre doing your daily routines and such! And there is quite a lot you can do without premium! It even has daily plans, workouts, getting productive, coping with serious addictions and more! I really enjoy it so far!! It‚Äôs really motivating! Highly suggest you get this app! Even if you just want to start a daily routine or workout!

title: HELPS MENTAL HEALTH!!!
review:
This app is simple to use! It makes you feel good about yourself! It helps your mental health by reminding to take care of your self! Drink water, eat , take a breather and so much more it helps you be a better person and build habits! This app should get rated more than 5 stars! I really like this app and I have only been using it for a week and it‚Äôs already some of my stress in life more bearable 
This app is definitely something you need to have downloaded

title: Love this app!
review: They have great content! To push you every single day, love the way they organized the journeys! It takes time to accomplish your goals and journeys because they walk you through one step at the time. However for me that‚Äôs actually great because you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed or like you‚Äôre doing too much. It is easier and definitely something anybody could achieved üôå thanks a lot fabulous ü§ó

title: Best Motivation App I‚Äôve Tried
review: This app is joyous. I don‚Äôt k ow how to describe it better. It is affirming and helps you see yourself and your efforts to earwax your goals in a positive way. Unlike other motivational apps, something about this one makes me enjoy using it. I look forward to checking my day‚Äôs progress and adding new goals, rather than scrambling to get annoying notifications off of my screen. And the insight provided is fantastic ‚Äî even the occasional corny rhymes.

title: Just what I needed!
review: I‚Äôve been wanting to set up healthier habits and routines but just simply making a to-do list wasn‚Äôt cutting it. I love the way Fabulous breaks down my big lofty goals into small manageable steps filled with encouragement and lessons along the way. I love the communities that are available with daily pledges to certain goals and the aesthetic of the app is wonderful and calming. I üíØ recommend getting this app if you‚Äôre wanting to have positive change in your life ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Really helpful so far
review: Going into it I thought it was just another stupid app that I saw advertised by someone and that it wouldn‚Äôt help me in anyway, but it ended up being very helpful for me. I have struggled so long to be organized and to form good habits and I felt that I was stuck in this rut of doing nothing and having no motivation. Through this app though, I have been able to find the good in the little things and I enjoy using this app everyday.

title: Beautiful and well researched
review:
I like to set goals, but often don‚Äôt meet them. I start off strong and then let it just kind of fade. The good thing about Fabulous is that they won‚Äôt let you start off and be overly ambitious. Ridiculously easy goals to start and then they add just a little more. The idea is to boost your confidence so you know you really can complete a goal. 
Additionally, the app has a beautiful interface and many self-care moments. It‚Äôs just what I needed.

title: This app changed my life!
review: I spent 5 minutes looking through the app when I first got it and immediately felt medicated it‚Äôs challenges or discover page gave me ideas and made me excited to be a better person I give this I 10/10 I would definitely recommend this to my friends but i can‚Äôt because I already did! I have struggled with sleep and not being motivated but this app has seriously changed all of that! Get this app NOW!

title: Fabulous helped me cope
review: I‚Äôve only been using Fabulous for a few days now, but it‚Äôs already helping me improve with my depression/feelings of guilt. It makes the whole process ten times more fun by making it into a grand adventure. The app serves as something of an accountability buddy, and it encourages you into developing habits that help better yourself as a person. I would highly recommend this to anyone going through tough times, because this app helped me tremendously

title: Pretty great!
review: I like a lot about this app and it‚Äôs working for me so far. It‚Äôs not obtrusive. The elements were chosen and designed with care. Not only can I customize how much and what I take on, the app (wisely) encourages moderation. The app is clearly designed for a certain, more privileged, segment of the population. As such, it is missing powerful dimensions that would tap more fully into my spirit and motivation. Perhaps there will be some evolution there. Nonetheless, of the many habit/health apps I‚Äôve tried, this is the first to hold my interest for this long.

title: No search feature
review: I wish the app was a bit more user friendly, the routines that you have to check off are at the bottom and it would be nice if they gave you the option to move it to where the user prefers, for me, this would be at the top. I‚Äôd much rather check things off my list and then read their additional content. My second complaint, why isn‚Äôt there a search function, I read something that I loved yesterday and can‚Äôt find it today. Very frustrating, I like the app, but these thing are just a tad annoying

title: Let‚Äôs be honest - it‚Äôs useless
review:
Although this app is filled with beautifully designed graphics it‚Äôs overly complicated, has non stop pop up windows, and the features are incomplete. It‚Äôs also NOT FREE. 
I wanted a calming app to help me develop a healthier routine. Working out is something I need to start doing again. There is a work out option but it‚Äôs so poorly executed. The durations of the exercises don‚Äôt make sense, they only have a single image to show you the exercise with no explanation what they want to you to do, and there isn‚Äôt a way to go back or edit the workout routine. You‚Äôre stuck with what they give you, and it doesn‚Äôt feel like much of a workout.

title: So far so great!
review: I will update this rating as I go, but so far it seems to be the best all inclusive app I‚Äôve tried! It has tons of materials to help you in virtually ever aspect. Physically, mentally, emotionally, spiritually... within yourself, with in your home, and within your relationships. -I do tend to get a little overwhelmed with everything it has to offer, but once I sit down and filter through my main focuses and prioritize them within the app, I am sure it will be cake!

title: A fabulous support for self care and personal development!
review: This is a beautiful app that helps you motivate yourself. I love the explanations the app gives for why the app is structured in the way that it is. The app is simple to use once you play around with it a little bit. The content is beautiful and the words are written in an easy to understand but fun to read way. Very helpful for anyone who wants to track habits, improve their routines, and better their self care!

title: Game Changer
review: I‚Äôve tried many task, organizational, journal oriented apps and Fabulous is unlike anything I have come across. The execution is outstanding. The building of solid routines serves as the foundation for success in pretty much every other area of life and Fabulous taps into this in an almost psychotherapeutic kind of way. The philosophic insight interwoven with science based approaches to habit formation and goal driven success is a home run for the ages. I think EVERYONE could benefit from this app. I‚Äôm so thankful I found it.

title: Only app that‚Äôs actually gotten me there!
review: This app really helps you build habits and it makes it fun. Too many apps give you free reign and just depend on you to check off as many habits as you‚Äôd like in whatever order you‚Äôd like, kind of like a checklist. Fabulous makes you go slow and think about WHY you‚Äôre instilling new habits, and increases your chance to be successful with them. I‚Äôm ADD and it‚Äôs a huge challenge to get myself to be productive. Thanks for the help, Fabulous.

title: Life saver
review: I absolutely love this app. It saved my life, it made me more productive. I love how this app has a lot of options And varieties and most importantly it‚Äôs not too harsh and has techniques that actually work. I am literally the laziest person ever but this app pushes me to take tiny steps that make a huge difference in my life. It made me workout and I haven‚Äôt worked out in months but it just motivated me with their amazing quotes and I feel like someone cares it just feels like free rehab or therapy.

title: A new way to stay on track
review: I have been using this app for a week and I love its methods! I the checklists and reminders are great, but I love the inspirational letters, nice graphics, and the story being told as I reach each goal. I keeps me coming back to see the next step in my progress AND the pretty story/journey. I‚Äôve tried many a plans to eat well and exercise, but this feels different. I‚Äôm excited to see how my journey continues through the next few weeks!

title: It truly is helpful
review: Between my busy college schedule, work, volunteer, and tons of other things, it‚Äôs easy to get caught up in what your doing without giving paying attention to your well-being and health. Especially in the pandemic, our wellbeing has become more important than ever. This app truly is wonderful in that it helps to build positive and healthy habits while also making sure to work with your schedule. I love it!

title: I totally recommend
review: I am in high school and these are really hard times so this really great to help me remind my self to do thing, to work on my physical and mental health, and unlike others this app still slows you to do things and get satisfied with this app without upgrading it to premium, because it is so annoying to find an app that has so many benefits and is aesthetically pleasing, and have a catch that you have to pay so I am really loving this app‚ù§Ô∏èü§©

title: Life long prescription?
review:
I had this App when it first came out. 
I went a year without it. 
Life was better when I had it. I was better, focused, happy, productive. 
  I thought I could do it on my own. 
My good habits slowly slipped away and I found myself lacking. 
My life was missing something. 
It was this App.
I didn‚Äôt realize how much using it helped me stay on a healthy path. 

  So I reordered it and I am glad I did. 
I payed for a year of Prime however 
I am considering the life long subscription. 
  I will probably live longer because I enjoy using this App. 
  I no longer waist time on social media. 
I still enjoy ‚Äúscreen time‚Äù however 
I prefer to focus on me and my life . 
  Self-love. It is a thing some have to seek out. I am one of the some who have dedicated most of my life to caring about and taking care of others.  
  Fabulous is ME time. Time to focus on my hopes and desires and it has become a foundation on which I stand. 
  MY goal is to become the best version of me that I can possibly be and grow gracefully into a new mature me.

title: Positive and User Friendly
review: It takes a second to understand the purpose of specific tools like ‚ÄúFabulous Moment‚Äù but they are all helpful. This app gives you plenty of ways to interact with it and offers a lot of positive reinforcement! You can choose to use as much or as little of it as you want, but it gives you plenty of ways to stay successful. It‚Äôs colorful, peaceful and fun. It really has helped me stay connected to my goals and growth!

title: Life changing!
review:
Maybe I needed more help than most, but establishing a routine is difficult for me. With many life changes and erratic schedules and income, I felt completely ungrounded. I needed structure! The tools in Fabulous helped me significantly adjust my behaviors and still help me reset and track my progress. 

I still haven‚Äôt met all of my goals, but my perspective has shifted and the journey is wonderful! My only suggestion is a thorough tutorial. This app has SO MANY cool features. Well worth it!

title: Help yourself start healthy habits
review: I have enjoyed the free trial of this app, I like the check mark accountability after completing my morning routine. I like how it has informative articles that reinforce the habit with logic. I don‚Äôt really love the stories and voice that talks during them but they are ok... I‚Äôm not sure how to explain, they just feel cheesy. While I would like to keep trying this app a little longer before deciding if I want to get it, the trial is short and the app is more expensive then I can commit to at this time.

title: Cheesy Graphics
review: I think the concept is good and I like the personalization, but as a professional graphic designer of 30 years, I think your choice of graphics/images you are using makes your product appear very cheap. It truthfully is hard to appreciate the app and see it‚Äôs value with your graphic images being the main focal point.  Your choice of graphics used are something you‚Äôd see illustrated in a children‚Äôs book. If you want to have people take this app seriously, you should use high quality images to emulate a professional look.

title: Feeling Fabulous!
review:
I‚Äôm currently 4 days into the free trial and really enjoying the app! It‚Äôs been super easy to use. I love that I can set specific alarms and general reminders. As a stay at home of two littles I tend to lose myself in the daily todos. Using this app has aided me in becoming more mindful of taking care of myself in short bursts throughout the day to keep myself going without burning out.
I will be paying the $40 to keep the app after the trial runs out!

title: Love the app
review: I just got the app and I must say I do love it, but when I downloaded it, it showed me an option to subscribe to this monthly, which was 3.99, not bad. I can do 3.99 a month, but I can‚Äôt afford to pay the yearly price a week from now. I would love to find out where to do the monthly subscription if they only show it once, and I was unsure about the app when I downloaded it but now that I‚Äôm sure I would want to subscribe, I can‚Äôt find the option that I‚Äôm able to afford at the moment

title: Happiness is possible
review: I‚Äôve struggled with the idea of self care my entire life.  I was so used to caring for everyone else from my childhood on that there was no time left for me.  Now I‚Äôm making me a priority and the anxiety that I‚Äôve dealt with my entire adult life is beginning to fade away.  I like having a routine that nourishes me.  I go to bed excited about the next day and I wake up looking forward to tackling whatever the day throws at me.  I think I might be heading toward happiness.

title: Enjoyable Gamification to Build Practical Habits
review:
I‚Äôve heard much about habits recently, but few apps have involved me as quickly as Fabulous.
From the intro, fabulous suggested highly practical, easy to implement habits to address my low energy. It provided just enough info to make me believe in these habits and an enjoyable gamification process to keep me coming back each day.
I find life difficult without a superordinate goal. Fabulous helps me make progress toward that.

title: Amazing app, we love it!
review:
So me and my bestie decided to diet and make healthier choices lately. They make a personal plan, and it‚Äôs awesome. One thing, I wish we‚Äôd get a bit more of a first challenge than drink water three times. But it‚Äôs a great app, five stars, and I totally recommend it.

With love,
Leah ü§ô

title: I like it but it‚Äôs also annoying

title: Amazing

title: Love this app!
review: I love this app! And I have to yet subscribe to unlimited but so far is great! It has several ways to challenge yourself depending how what you are looking to achieve. I love doing their challenges and the app keeps reminding me throughout the day to get them done. It always keeps everything positive and there‚Äôs articles you can read about self care and self growth. I would recommend this app to everyone! That‚Äôs why i rate this app 5 stars‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Life Changing
review:
While I immediately fell in love this app I wanted to wait a while before giving it a review. I‚Äôve been using the app daily for 34 days and it has changed my life. 

I‚Äôve always struggled with keeping routines. I start out great and then within a week I stop. This app gives you a daily streak. My first streak I made it to 13 days. I fell short. But it was easy to pick myself up again. Every day you add small steps to your routine. I love this app.

title: Gorgeous App
review: I wanted an app to help me stick to my routines and I‚Äôve just been absolutely blown away at how gorgeous this app is. I‚Äôm a graphic designer and I never would have expected a habit tracker to be so profoundly beautiful. I‚Äôve been keeping up with it now for about 6 days and I want to keep coming back to it for the artwork alone. I love the motivation, letters, and fortune cookies. And the ‚ÄúMake Me Fabulous‚Äù section with meditations, yoga, exercises and more is really incredible. I‚Äôm super impressed.

title: Wow! More than I would expect, even in free version
review: My daughter found this app to help give her some structure and peace of mind during Quarantine. It‚Äôs so interactive and the suggestions are great. It really helps you to build healthy habits and gives you the insight of why it will work. These are lessons she will carry through life and I can‚Äôt praise this app enough! We were so impressed I downloaded it as well and recommended it to others from teen to adult!

title: Great work put into this
review:
After a troubled life and numerous therapists and finally finding right psychiatrist that actually listened to me. 
This and the self help books I‚Äôve listened to audible from everyday life, philosophy (Alan Watts god I wish I could of met that man in real life), to learning  financial security. 
If you truly want turn life around; it‚Äôs takes small steps. This apps focuses on one story I heard from Watts
Guru tell his student to pull the little plant, so he does, eventually after pulling a bunch of plants out the ground he points to a tree and says now this one. Student says I can‚Äôt it‚Äôs to big . Guru says ‚Äúlike it‚Äôs roots, this is how habits are formed‚Äù

One bug you probably already got emailed about, the music keeps playing after you back out of the app but does shut off when you close the app

title: Great app
review: I got this app because I‚Äôm a highly stressed person. I was expecting something like every other app. It‚Äôs like, you can do one thing but then you have to pay for everything else. I was wrong. This app has everything: workouts, yoga, meditation, sleep help, and habit building. Majority of it is free! Though some stuff is premium and costs money, the stuff that you came for is here and free. If you want to relax or stop bad habits, the.n this is the app for you

title: Worth it! Healthy habits here I come!!
review: I‚Äôm a mom to twin boys that are almost 2!! And I‚Äôve noticed I‚Äôve not been taking good care of myself and I‚Äôm tired and exhausted and the list goes on! I‚Äôm not very social so I‚Äôve heard about this about for months now and finally decided to give it a go. Ha! I love it! I fell in love with the awesome reminders and the way you can customize them! Also the mood music to get you calmed down and ready for bed is spot on! I love it! Thank you thank you so much for helping this momma be the best she can be for her beautiful boys!!!

title: APPsolutely Fabulous!
review: This app is absolutely fabulous! Seriously, the app is called fabulous! I think that this is a cool app for when you‚Äôre trying to start something new. When you wish to better yourself! This is one of those self-care apps that does a little more than just asking how your day was. I think this app is awesome and I definitely would recommend it to a friend....if they were ready to start on the mental health topic (R.I.P. them üòí)

title: Motivational!
review: This app has motivated me to drink a glass of water first thing in the morning, and to eat a healthy breakfast. I have been using it for about a week and a half now and I know that there is much more in store. It eases one into doing more healthy things as they progress. This is exactly what I needed to push me in the right direction. My partner has been trying to get me to drink more water for years now and is amazed that this app could get me to do it.

title: Invaluable for my ADHD
review:
Routine is incredibly difficult for me to form and hold, and it‚Äôs also one of the most important ways that I can care for the particular needs of my mind. 

The slow and careful building of habits and routine that this app aids with, and the holistic way it helps me engage with the process has helped me do an incredible amount of work for my health in fairly short order.

Highly recommend it for anyone with similar problems!

title: Wonderful but imperfect
review:
I bought the Premium account because I am serious about maintaining new habits. I like the checklist format, graphics and the accountability (notifications, streaks, etc). I like that you can add-on challenges and modify as needed. I appreciate the tips and tricks, and the meditations provided. 

I get really frustrated that the home screen is so busy, and that every time I check off a habit, I have to wait 30 seconds of cutesy music and slow -moving messages until I can get back to the home screen. I get they‚Äôre going for positive reinforcement, but it‚Äôs clunky. 

I‚Äôd like a more minimalistic interface, with all the other challenges/music/letters/social media in different screens.

Also, I don‚Äôt like that it keeps insisting I share things on my social media. I bought premium so that I wouldn‚Äôt get those kinds of marketing extras.

title: Cool App
review: This is the first review I have written for an app, but I have been using it for three days and love the pace of the app along with the psychology behind it. I am the type of person to want to change, be productive, my best self, etc.- but after a few days my motivation is gone. This app really helps to slowly build habits over time and makes you rethink your behaviors to change in the way I have always wanted to!

title: This app is FABULOUS
review: Pun intended! Productivity, self-care, meditation, and so much more all wrapped up into one. I would recommend this app everyone, and since I can only speak for myself, I would especially recommend this app to anyone who is in the same position I had been stuck in for a long time, already thinking about changing some habits and needing the extra push to break your goals up into manageable easy-to-follow steps.

title: Never mind if you work midnights
review: I heard good things about this app so downloaded it to check it out. I was so close to actually keeping it and trying it. But then I saw that it, like so many other thoughtless apps, force timeframes on you that you can‚Äôt customize. It allows you to customize your wake up time but not the ‚Äòend of day‚Äô time. No. My end of day is not 2am. It‚Äôs 10am. I work midnights that‚Äôs why I wake up at 6pm. But this app doesn‚Äôt allow you to adjust for that. Therefore this app is useless to me and immediately being deleted. I was so excited to try to start making decent habits but if you‚Äôre gonna say you‚Äôre customizable then be customizable.

title: Beware - they make it very hard to cancel the free trial
review: I downloaded this app and within a couple of days decided it wasn‚Äôt for me and tried to cancel my subscription. The Apple store had no option to cancel, so I did it through the app. I believed the cancellation had been submitted but noticed the subscription still appeared in my Apple store (still with no option there to cancel). I though this was just a glitch that would be resolved. No‚ÄîI was charged $44 and now am stuck with a years subscription to a dumb app. :( customer service was no help, they just have a useless refund form that directs you to Apple customer service.

review:
You have to want to change. You have to want to be better. If so, this is a great tool. If you don‚Äôt really want to improve as a person, this app will be as helpful as any other dusty, unused, workout equipment. title: Greats Habit Setter
review: This program eases you into new habits that are encouraging for positive change. I, like many people, struggle with depression and anxiety. I would recommend this app to anyone who has trouble w similar mental health struggles. It starts you off small and works you up to different challenges, that way it‚Äôs not overwhelming. Caring for yourself is just as important as caring for your loved ones. And I‚Äôd definitely recommend this app to anyone starting a self love journey

title: Fun, Engaging, and Encouraging
review: I love this app! It really is making a huge difference in my well-being and I‚Äôve only been using for 1 week. It starts very small, but change is happening and I know I‚Äôll continue to build healthy habits. Subtracted one star because the app can be confusing at first, such as giving you the option to build an evening routine while you haven‚Äôt finished your first journey. Also, the FAQs were helpful but it took me a while to figure out where the info I needed was.

title: Not for me
review: This app was not for me. It tells you to spend your time doing something without any reason other than ‚Äúbuilding a habit‚Äù. For example, my first habit was ‚Äúdrink water in the morning‚Äù. Why? The explanation given was to ‚Äústart small‚Äù. My interpretation of that is it‚Äôs a pat on the back to make a user feel like they accomplished something. I have specific habits I‚Äôm interested in growing, and this app is just not customizable enough. I also found the look of the app distracting. I prefer a minimalist, clean look and practical functionality. I think this app is best for people who don‚Äôt know what they need to change and are looking for coaching vs self-directed goal achievement.

title: Fabulous is FABULOUS!!!
review: I tried the app in its beta phase and it was quite decent but I couldn‚Äôt stick with it. Whether that was due to my own laziness or the app I cannot say. However, this time around the app is much more robust and I‚Äôm finding it very easy to follow the prompts and adhere to my daily routine. I love that it starts with such simple habits like drinking water each morning and only adds on as you feel established in each new routine.

title: The best App of it‚Äôs kind, a true lifesaver‚ù§Ô∏è
review: Fabulous is exactly what I needed during a time of change and uncertainty. It helped me through severe anxiety, and taught me to remember the me I really am and am capable of being in this moment, right now, and to be okay with it. It showed me how to embrace my self-worth and embody confidence in some of the most fearful events of recent times. I would recommend the premium version to anyone, it is definitely worth itüôèüèª

title: Do not download , it takes your money
review: So I recently downloaded this app and subscribed to a 7 day free trial. After 3 days, I decided to cancel it, because it wasn‚Äôt helping me as much as I thought it would. I had a significant amount of money in my account, and as soon as I unsubscribed, all of it was gone. I searched online, and did pretty much everything to my ability, and it was all leading back to this app. Take a look at the five star reviews for yourself. Those don‚Äôt  even look like real people commented those, just bots. If you don‚Äôt want all of your apple money taken away, do not download this app, because it will surely empty out your account.

title: Used to be good
review:
I was obsessed with this app when it had started out. I was hooked and had been doing great with my habits. The UI was amazing. The functionality and aesthetic were so well done. Only certain extra things were behind a paywall 

And then... Suddenly nothing actually useful could really be done anymore without paying for it. I was no longer able to keep my current schedule of habits. The functionality felt less accessible and more confusing. Overall it just became so much less appealing and helpful. I‚Äôve now found better productivity apps. 
But nothing will top Fabulous in its early days. :/
