title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD!
review: This app has you start with a very small challenge while you have the free trial. My first challenge was to drink water, and honestly I always make sure to drink water. I was unable to get another challenge so I could start with ‚Äúbaby steps‚Äù but I wanted at least one other thing to start off with. Also, there would be random pop up stories that were impossible to skip and it was just a big waist of time. When I tried to get my money back from the subscription, there were basically a bunch of reasons as to why I couldn‚Äôt have a refund. They charge the whole year upfront just to trick you. BUYERS BEWARE!!!

title: It works
review: I don‚Äôt know why this one is better. I‚Äôve tried two other apps that said they worked but they just weren‚Äôt for me. I need structure short term goals and gentle reminders. This exceeded my expectations. It‚Äôs not hard to use it can seem a little disorganized and it‚Äôs presentation but they are constantly making improvements and welcome feedback. With any other shortcomings it‚Äôs still producing results. I‚Äôm happy

title: Great app
review: Similar to some (video) games, this app allows you to become part of it in a way that‚Äôs magical, scientific, and challenging. The difference is you are the player and the game does not end. The game is your life and how you live it. Mixed with great voices, imagery, quotes, poems, and tasks, it‚Äôs like The Hero‚Äôs Journey one excepts (or not) without feeling overwhelmed. Sometimes journeys are thrusted upon us, other times choices r involved. Baby steps is the key to this app and I love it.

title: Too many bugs for simply counting the days
review:
I really like the app and I mainely use it to count the number of days in row I‚Äôm staying consistent with a routine.

Unfortunately, the app does a real bad job at counting the days. It will skip some days even though I checked them (and I can go back up to 7 days and actually verify that it was indeed properly reported, but the Golden Triangle diagram would show it as a miss).

It‚Äôs frustrating because you cannot edit the past days when the software does that kind of mistakes.

I contacted support a couple of time about it and it took forever for them to give me a half baked answer. I don‚Äôt think they care about that issue.

Edit: after a few more months of using, the bugs are not improving. The counting of the days is all over the place. The app helped me, but I won‚Äôt be renewing because of that major flaw.

title: Great app for building habits
review: I seriously have struggled with creating good habits my entire life. I thought I was lazy, but turns out I just didn‚Äôt have good coaching. I had considered life coaching but was prohibited by the expense. Fabulous has made making small sustainable change doable and affordable. I love that it doesn‚Äôt take up much time in my day but makes a powerful impact in a short time. I‚Äôd recommend it to anyone struggling to create change.

title: Visually/audibly overwhelming
review: So this app is nice in theory, but it's REALLY visually and audibly overwhelming - there's so many bright colors, movements, and sounds and I couldn't handle it. If you get overwhelmed by that kind of stuff pretty easily I would probably look for a different self-care app. Even when I turned my sound off it was really visually overwhelming and cluttered. I'm sure this is a great app for a lot of people but it didn't work for me. Also I'm not really a subscription kind of person and I think there are other self-care apps that have a lot of the same base functions without the payment.

title: Enjoying it!
review: The app is still new to me but I‚Äôm enjoying it. Sometimes you have to cut through some of what‚Äôs offered to get the benefits of the stuff that matters to you, but I‚Äôm finding the more I customize it, the more I like it. Still in the trial period and not sure if I‚Äôll pay for the whole year... if there‚Äôs no option to pay monthly I may let it go, but we‚Äôll see how I feel at the end of the trial.

title: Amazing app!
review:
Fabulous truly has to be the best app I have ever used. There are so many journeys and paths you can choose, therefore customizing this improvement journey and really making it your own. 

The app itself does take a bit of time to become acclimated to. I enjoy this feature- to me, it feels a bit of a choose your own adventure book!! Take some time to explore and you will not be disappointed!

title: Invest in yourself!
review:
I really love this app. When I first heard about it a year or more ago, I hesitated because of the price. 

But last week I was ready to make change to see more improvement in myself, so I found this app again. I‚Äôm so I love with it & I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever delete it. I look forward to getting on the app every day. It‚Äôs worth it!! So much personalization to make it feel like your pocket accountability partner!

title: Making Me Fabulous!!
review: I‚Äôm only 15 and just recently started using fabulous three days ago but I already feel completely better about not only my living environment ( now that I‚Äôm starting to get the hang of keeping it clean more often), but my mental status. There‚Äôs more along the way and I‚Äôm even doing more chores to earn money to pay for premium. I would sincerely like to thank the developers for this app!

title: Love the changes!
review: I‚Äôve used the app for about a year now and I have to admit that I‚Äôm a tough case as I am 47 and just recently became  active in trying to build good habits  ( without much progress) but I have to say I‚Äôve had more success with it than without it. I have just checked back in after a bit and I love the story/map addition I think that could keep my inner child‚Äôs attention! Thank you for such an amazing app!

title: A gentle nudge in the right direction
review:
I like this app because it starts you off doing simple tasks that you think, ‚ÄúReally? This is it?‚Äù But then I found that I enjoyed being accountable to an app to do easy, healthy things. Like, ‚ÄúDrink water, CHECK!‚Äù Now on to bigger, equally great things!
This app will work best for any person who starts any To-Do list with ‚Äúmake a to-do list‚Äù just so they can have something to check off right away.

title: Creat new habit and stick to them
review:
Do you always worry about doing new tasks or sticking to it? Or you make a plan to exercise or drink more water and you forgot it after few days?, Are you always nagging at yourself that why I‚Äôm not able to follow my timetable ?
It‚Äôs time to download this app it‚Äôs great and make you more motivated to do just small tasks and reach your best by putting some small goals in your daily routine. 
Give it a try!

title: Awesome!
review: I love this app! It helps me to be more active and happy! The stories are really relaxing and there are so many different options! There are workouts, self care sheets, positive messages and so much more! This app has been helping me change how I do things, in a good way. The only thing is that I wish more things were free! However, I still really love this app and I understand why not all of it is free. It has helped me so far even without the subscription, so I thank fabulous for that!

title: Good but lots of pop ups
review: There is so much going on on each page that its hard to find your goals and hard to check them off, there‚Äôs so many pop ups to share with a friend that get irritating too, its like every 3 minutes you‚Äôre in the app. It has good goals and ways to reach them, it‚Äôs just hard to find them all of the time with how much they push for ratings, push you to share, and push you to purchase their in app purchases.... I would probably have bought it already if i knew for a fact that it wouldnt be so disruptive of my journey when i do.....

title: Annoyed!
review: I‚Äôm really annoyed because I canceled this app the same day I downloaded it, it just wasn‚Äôt for me. This morning I wake up and they‚Äôve taken out money from my account and at no time did I even get an email stating they would do that. I thought I‚Äôd already cancelled it so I never thought to check my subscriptions or anything.  So I go to unsubscribe and then it says I won‚Äôt be refunded just because I unsubscribe from a paid membership when I didn‚Äôt even want the app to begin with. It was advertised on Pinterest and I clicked on it. With the current situation I cant afford this app and wasn‚Äôt expecting it to take that out my paycheck this morning.

title: It‚Äôs helped me feel better so far
review: I downloaded this app after seeing an ad for it on instagram because it said it could help with motivation. I‚Äôve had apps like this before but they were kinda boring. This app though has already helped me by starting a health habit every morning and it helps me sleep better by some of the many guided meditations it has. I‚Äôd definitely recommend using this app if you struggle with motivation or have bad habits, it‚Äôll help correct those.

title: Outside work
review: I like this app, and especially the ideas behind it, but I think the stories and graphics are a bit much/kinda a turn off (makes it feel silly). Also, lots of them want you to write things down in a journal, which is also a weird thing for an app to tell you. I do wish it was something where you could type it into the app. I know writing stuff down is beneficial but I feel silly doing it for such simple prompts‚Äîso I don‚Äôt even do it.

title: Love it !
review: at first it was another app on my phone i planned to use but didn‚Äôt. the moment i was ready to take my life in my own hands is when i realized how great this app was, i shared it with my best friend and she love it as well. still considering if we should pay or not since some things are available without having to pay. if you‚Äôre reading this wondering if you should download it‚Äôs the sign !

title: Just something about it..
review: I can‚Äôt put my finger on why but there‚Äôs something about this app that makes me feel so much better every morning. I have just started using it but the small steps make me slow down and enjoy my time to myself. I‚Äôm so excited to see my next goals and what I‚Äôm capable of. No other apps have been this good at hooking me before and actually keeping me on track.

title: Gentle Encouragement
review: I splurged on a Fabulous subscription during a really rough time. Work was extra stressful, my mom had just been diagnosed with cancer for the second time, and I was falling into some really unhealthy patterns in my struggle to cope. The gentle encouragement offered by the daily coaching messages and the slow layering of healthy routines were exactly what I needed to shore up my inner resilience so I can be my best for my coworkers and my family when it matters.

title: Fabulous is fabulous.
review: I‚Äôve only just started this and I am very impressed with all the features, graphics, music and natural sounds throughout the app. I am finding it a bit difficult to find the proper ‚Äúpath‚Äù through all the various routes and levels, and over the weekend I ‚Äúfell off the Fabulous wagon‚Äù mostly due to the changes in my sleep times. So I‚Äôm really sort of beginning over again. I‚Äôm going to keep at it and evaluate my progress over time. I‚Äôm optimistic.

title: Second week review
review:
I love the app UI but the UX is a bit tricky and not that clear. My major issue is the forced sharing messages I get when i complete a task while I‚Äôm only trying to focus on myself. I dont need that constant reminder to share and let people know about the app when i have a subscribed version. 
I wish the app had a calendar for when I have completed a habit to track back my progress and when I missed them.

title: Dissatisfied
review: Perhaps I have delusions of grander things, but I expected more than a reminder list and meditations. I like the setup for beginners, but as someone who has been trying to get my life together for a long time, more advanced options would be awesome. Glitches etc were also an issue, trying to check off all of your tasks at once causes the app to freeze or shut. I paid for the year and I hope you come out with some new things soon

title: Pretty nice
review: So far so good. I‚Äôm using the free version, and I‚Äôm only a few days in but I am really starting to like it. It has a good way or reminding you to do what you need first thing after waking up in a gentle way. It has cute storytelling and graphics, and I love all the little challenges it includes as well as little pictures and stuff you can look at on other pages. I really enjoy it so far and I highly recommend.

title: Life changing app
review: This app has already changed my life in just a matter of one week. Try it out and see it for yourself I love the design and layout of it. I didn‚Äôt expect for the live challenges to be as helpful as they were. They have a lot of features that made me question why isn‚Äôt this one of those ‚Äúpremium features‚Äù type of deal you get great access to really change yourself

title: Love this app
review: I downloaded this app months ago! Procrastinated because I wasn't ready to commit and was unsure, especially if I had to pay for an app I wanted to be ready to use it. Well let me tell you, I am VERY happy I did. I have already made 3 morning routine changes that impact my physical and mental health. I am excited about my positive path I am embarking on, thanks to my commitment and this amazing app. I have already shared it with all my close friends!

title: Great app for building habits!
review: This is a really great app for building new habits and routines. However, when I recently tried to open the app it asked me to restore my progress. I wanted to start my progress over and it won‚Äôt load my new plan. So I haven‚Äôt been able to use the app in months. It won‚Äôt load if I clock to restore progress or click to not restore progress. I would love to see this bug get fixed so I can come to use to use the app and track my habits.

title: Really helpful!
review: I recently started using Fabulous and I‚Äôm really enjoying it so far! From what I‚Äôve seen so far is that it is trying to improve my life one step at a time. It doesn‚Äôt force you to completely change your lifestyle but instead uses a step by step process to help you out. I started by just drinking water in the morning and then tracking it on their app! Really helpful and motivational!

title: Motivation.
review: Haven‚Äôt used the app too much considering I‚Äôve barely had it for about half a week, but for the time that I‚Äôve had it I can certainly say that‚Äôs helped me restructure and change my life for the better. It‚Äôs very easy to use and has some of the best art I‚Äôve ever seen. If you‚Äôre looking to build up a routine or just to ad more to an already existing one, then I strongly recommend this app for you.

title: Great investment!
review: I just completed my first journey and this app is amazing at helping to create change. I really appreciate the science behind the way it has you do little things every day. Even on the days I wasn‚Äôt feeling particularly motivated I was able to accomplish my goals since they were broken down so well. I‚Äôm happy with having upgraded to the premium version and think it‚Äôs a great investment for my future.

title: Habits
review: Fabulous isn‚Äôt letting me add any habits to my routines, which is a bit of a drawback considering that I would like to change the different habits I have in each routine. I would switch this back so that you could modify it even without being a member. Also, if I‚Äôm doing a specific challenge, for example, the sleep challenge, it doesn‚Äôt add the habit directly into my wind down ritual but instead creates a sea parade routine with a single habit, so so can‚Äôt check off all the habits at once. This makes it inconvenient for me to use the routines part of this app, which is mostly why I downloaded this app.

title: Sheismayhem
review:
This app really makes you want to come back and check off your routines so you can see your guy go up the map, read the nice quotes, read interesting articles, and just make you feel great and motivated by just doing the most simple of things! I really like that you also have challenges and different options to click on to meditate, or exercise, or focus, etc 
Really great app

title: DO NOT TRUST FREE TRIAL
review: I signed back up to give this app a try 2 days ago. It seems like a lot of changes had been made since the last time I used this app, over a year ago. The ‚ÄúFree Trial‚Äù is a lie. It says the trial is free for 7 days and as long as you cancel in that time you will not be charged. I downloaded the app 2 days ago and today I woke up with a $40 charge to my bank account from this app. I was actually enjoying it so far, but I haven‚Äôt gotten very far with it. I was debating about whether I felt it was worth the cost and now I‚Äôve been charged and apparently I have a year long subscription. I‚Äôm deleting this app and contacting the developer.

title: Great app :)
review: The first time I downloaded the app I couldn‚Äôt find the motivation to actually start the things it was talking about but it wasn‚Äôt the apps fault I was going through a rough time and didn‚Äôt /want/ to get better but now that I‚Äôve committed to bettering myself I love this app so much and the storyline keeps me endlessly motivated. The graphics are adorable and I really enjoy the small pictures after you finish a goal ^-^

title: Love this, but hate that...
review: I really love this app but it‚Äôs kind of annoying to not be able to turn off the afternoon routine. I don‚Äôt need it because I can‚Äôt setup a routine for that part of my day with my position. So, getting notifications to start a routine for that part of the day just causes more phone commotion that isn‚Äôt necessary. Also, the app always shows notifications but there‚Äôs nothing unchecked when I open the app. This happens on multiple devices.

title: Stole my money
review:
I thought the app was a great idea, but found it confusing. I cancelled my trial and then sat down with the CEO to discuss why I had cancelled. I was honestly considering restarting in a few months after they had made some improvements. Not anymore.

Two weeks later I got charged for the full amount and they‚Äôre unwilling to refund me. They keep telling me to check Apple (the subscription does and has never existed, it was through them directly). They said the email and meeting with the CEO are not enough to verify I cancelled. I‚Äôm clearly not the only one who has had this issue based on the other reviews.

title: Very useful, helpful app
review:
I love using this app to reestablish good habits when I‚Äôve had a big change that disrupts my routine. It has helped me exercise and take care of myself. I‚Äôm very grateful to the developers. 

I think the journeys are well thought out. I enjoy making tiny changes and seeing where the journey will take me. I‚Äôve been exercising every morning for two months. That by itself is amazing. Thank you, Fabulous!

title: RedRidingHood406
review: The app is a great way to hold yourself accountable for your personal goals. I love inspirational animated stories too. I think my favorite part of the app is the serene music in the fabulous moments that come with each scheduled habit. My only complaint is that I thought the letting go challenge, which happens to be my first challenge, would have more content and storytelling. It is also a little confusing to know what I‚Äôm supposed to do every day for each challenge.

title: My life is working again
review:
I had this for a while, dropped it for about a year, and just got it again. 
It seems like I could do all this on my own, but The Fabulous app really helps me stay on track. 
I was drifting without it. 
You still have to put in some effort, but it will an guide you into having orderly routines.
It‚Äôs worthwhile, and I recommend it to anyone who wants to be more effective and efficient.

title: Kind of weird
review: The app message it self is great but the app is a little weird. The picture and videos it plays sometimes make you feel like you are in a cult. The way the portray the actions make me feel uncomfortable sometimes and they play you this ‚Äústory‚Äù witch is a video about your journey with the app. Some of the things the describe are a little creepy like more then once it has said ‚Äú the darkness controls and the shadows are coming to hurt you‚Äù. WEIRD. But it does teach good habits.

title: It‚Äôs too much stuff for me
review: I paid for the cute ritual tracker. That‚Äôs all I wanted. But they constantly bombard you with challenges, and questions to answer, and ‚Äújoin this journey‚Äù, and here‚Äôs an info graphic that takes twenty seconds to load and no you can‚Äôt click out of it. I don‚Äôt want all that crap I just want to create a list I can check off every morning and night and I‚Äôm literally willing to pay fifty dollars a year for just that and I can‚Äôt seem to get that to happen. It‚Äôs worse than having ads on your app!

title: AMAZING
review: i love how personalized the app is and how it creates a journey that‚Äôs right for you. it starts with small habits which progress into full routines over time, building long-lasting healthy habits. this app actually makes me want to continue using it because of how motivating it is. EVERYTHING is perfectly designed and helpful. the only thing is that some features are restricted without premium, but that‚Äôs just a minor inconvenience.

title: A Great app for personal growth
review: I been actively using this app for about a little over a week and I can already notice a difference in myself‚Ä¶..it helps me keep up with all three of my routines and makes me feel better about myself‚Ä¶..another thing I love about this app is if I forget to mark down my routines of let say nighttime I can always go back the next day and mark is so I don‚Äôt mess up my streak

title: Charged me even though I cancelled and now ignoring my requests
review:
I canceled this during the ‚Äúfree‚Äù trial, because there was no way I was going to pay for this content. There are WAY BETTER options out there, for FREE. Yet I was still charged for a premium subscription. Fabulous has ignored my numerous requests for a refund. I literally deleted the app after I cancelled my free trial, so I did not use this ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù subscription. 

Avoid signing up for any ‚Äúfree‚Äù trials, and be aware if you decide to use this app. There‚Äôs a lot of scamming going on here.

UPDATE: I‚Äôm updating this review to say that Fabulous, despite replying on here to try to save their public reputation, is STILL ignoring my requests.

title: Creating positive change but an overwhelming experience
review: Overall the app is helping me create positive changes in my life. The onboarding experience was personalized and I think the art and UX is beautiful. However after using the app for about a week I find it contains a little too much helpful information. Daily coaching. Nightly coaching. Reminders. Tips. Motivators. 9x notifications. It‚Äôs a little hard to know what to pay attention to...which is part of the problem with digital life that brought me to this app in the first place.

title: This App is Life Changjng
review: For anyone who is lost and needs help getting back on track, or for those who just need a little boost in their habits, this app is the best. No other program like it. I was in a dark heavy place, a lot off track, this helped me build my momentum in little daily habits and get some structure back in my day so I could feel good and realize I can get back on the horse again and live the life of my dreams!

title: Are you ready?
review: Even if your not, this app if you actually USE it will change your life. I have used timers to help me with my ADHD all my life and this app uses timers and a number of other therapeutic ways of changing your habits. Worth $3 a month, worth $50 a month honestly. But I‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs affordable for everybody. I don‚Äôt care if you are broke, if you NEED or WANT change in your life, this is it and it will give you that.

title: Best app
review: I have to say that this is the best app for mental health I have installed. Most of the free apps aren‚Äôt even close of being as good as Fabulous. This app is just fabulous (haha) because it helps with well being, mental health, motivation, addiction and even procrastination. If you are thinking of downloading it, just do it. Download it and see if you like it. Give it a try and explore the features of the app. It‚Äôs been 3 days and I‚Äôm in love with this app.

title: Day 4
review: I am only on day 4 of my journey and the fabulous app has already been transformative. I have restored a good habit that in a short time and Fabulous doesn‚Äôt have to remind me any longer. I am excited to see where this app takes me. With patience, I will get there. It takes you on a self care journey at such a beautiful pace and allows you to inhale and enjoy moments without constantly worrying about ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next‚Äù

title: This app will change how you think in the first ten seconds
review: I‚Äôm a 15 year old and I‚Äôve been so lazy and eating very unhealthy. I‚Äôm overweight and can‚Äôt feel happy when I look at myself but this app is changing my way I think and the way I feel about myself , it keeps me motivated when I don‚Äôt want to be . It makes me happy when I look at the apps motivation quotes . It‚Äôs a good app overall. Definitely get this app

title: Most Engaging Productivity App I‚Äôve used
review:
I use lots of organizational apps, for nutrition, for fitness, for savings, etc. This is the only generic organizational app I‚Äôve used that acts like an anchor for the others. 

Fabulous doesn‚Äôt promise you‚Äôll change overnight. In fact, it stresses the importance of doing just the opposite. It leads you through small changes -in areas you choose- until they become habit and then guides you through taking on more. 

Very glad to have found Fabulous.

title: Simply Fabulous Mental Health Support
review: I‚Äôve been in therapy for around 6 years, and I can honestly say I‚Äôve gotten the same support from this app in one month. From microsteps to CBT elements to meditations, this app really utilizes s variety of tools to set you up for healthier habits. I really enjoy the storytelling and the gorgeous graphics. Between this and the Sanvello app, I‚Äôm starting to feel like I can truly see the light at the end of the PTSD tunnel for the first time.

title: Surprisingly .... Fabulous!
review: I didn‚Äôt know what to expect from this app, but it is definitely my new favorite. Skip the hard sell for the purchase at the start. Lots of really great ideas on improving your overall health. Really motivating and really simple. The app will set reminders for you and also treats you to some Enya/ zen moments when you‚Äôve accomplished your goal. Basically a life coach in your pocket. Good work, Friends at Fabulous!

title: Too cumbersome
review: I really wanted to like this app but I don‚Äôt like moving through multiple steps just to use an app. I don‚Äôt have the patience for a routine, and that‚Äôs why I sought out help, but this app only tested my patience with forcing a single task on me first along with articles and videos. Also the price is crazy, especially charging it for a whole year at once. People are trying to better their lives so they can afford something like this one day, but it‚Äôs hard to do so when it‚Äôs out of reach. Overall, the look of it was nice but I couldn‚Äôt enjoy the functionality.

title: Premium is better than the basic version
review: I tried out the basic version a year ago and decided not to stick with it. Now my daughter and I are both using the full premium version of the app and it‚Äôs 100% better. The yearly rate is incredibly affordable - more so than my meditation app. There is no excuse for me not to be successful now. Great graphics, lovely story in the mornings, lots of journeys to explore.

title: LOVE THIS APP
review: So far, I have enjoyed this app. I don‚Äôt typically spend money on apps but this one was so WORTH IT. It has helped me start and stick to routines while also giving me constant motivation. It helps you start slow and gradually build up a healthy routine. & best of all, it helps find the absolute best routines specifically for YOU. I have already recommended this app to multiple friends and family. Don‚Äôt hesitate. Get it!!

title: 7-day Trail & Regular Charges Hidden!
review: I think people should be allowed to know upfront so they are not feeling duped. Before I even get to know this product I am already prejudging based on the fact this information wasn‚Äôt disclosed upfront, initially. Now I may not know whether or not this is a decent product due to what feels like a scheming tactic to bait into downloading and initially investing time in questionnaire before knowing the pricing ‚Äúscheme‚Äù. I now wonder if I‚Äôm gonna be automatically charged even though I don‚Äôt believe I agreed to anything. I do not want any drama of removing post-trail charges should that occur...see already a bad taste in my mouth. Counterproductive.

title: Overload.
review: Ok, so it‚Äôs not just me. Looks like this app needs help. IMO it‚Äôs overwhelming, cluttered and unorganized. There are a couple things I don‚Äôt mind. And it‚Äôs beautiful overall but it‚Äôs not user-friendly. I have no idea how to navigate this app - it doesn‚Äôt feel intuitive and I just get lost with no idea how to easily get around or back to where I was. I had high hopes of getting rid of some habits and making better ones but this isn‚Äôt the app for me. I paid for premium too so I have it for a year but I won‚Äôt be purchasing again. Sorry :( there, I said it. I feel better now.

title: Great app so far!
review: I‚Äôve been looking for a similar app like this for a long time and I‚Äôm glad I found it. I have ADHD and gets distracted very easily. I like that they start you slow with one habit at a time and increase from there so you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. I gave this a four because I‚Äôm a UX designer and I feels the journey of customer and some functionality can be improved so that it makes more sense to the user. Overall, I would recommended this to a friend!

title: Problems with sharing links
review:
App is great and helpful. The problem I have is when I want to share something from within the app or save it, it only creates a link that prompts to download the app from the App Store, or it just opens the app without taking you to the intended content.

Also, if I want to access previous sessions of daily coaching, I cannot. App just takes me to the latest one. If I read something helpful and I want to access it again, I can‚Äôt. 

Can you please look into this. Thank you

title: Super helpful with new habits!
review: I am really enjoying this app so far. I have really been trying to stick to a morning and night routine and I love the notifications and reminders this has. I also love the layout, the pictures, the music and the positive vibe it gives. I did the free trial and I lasted two days before I already made up my mind that I wanted to pay for it. Really really great app and so grateful I found it.üßöüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ú®üôèüèΩ

title: Not even remotely worth the price.
review:
Tried the trial, when through and charged me when I tried to cancel. I figured I‚Äôd least try to use it, but it‚Äôs horrible. The ui is horrid, and it‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm old and don‚Äôt know how to use apps or anything like that. I‚Äôm 24. It‚Äôs not acceptable for this app to be so poorly optimized. I can‚Äôt find things I was looking and on a previous day, journeys are confusing, there are fifty different screen and none make any sense. 

I want my money back. 

Don‚Äôt download this. Use a notebook to keep track of a couple of goals and a free meditation app. Better than this garbage that I was charged for against my will.

title: First impressions
review:
I just started the app and it looks very well put together and gives a person motivation daily. I really love the way it motivates you and boost your confidence from the beginning. I am really looking forward to using this app daily. Thank you for having this app to help people better their lives. 
A must try for people need a boost in staying focused and need motivation to a better you.

title: How is this free!?
review: This app has everything! Whether you have premium or not. When you click on certain goals it gives you a question to answer and sometimes even meditation or nature sounds. The discover page is pretty cool as well! It gives you things like yoga poses and I think I saw some 5 day challenges as well. I‚Äôm new to the app so I hope it doesn‚Äôt start to force me to get premium.

title: Fabulous, with a little glitch
review: I‚Äôve been using the app for the last 5 days and I love it. I have ADHD and have always struggled to maintain consistent healthy routines. I‚Äôve noticed one major issue: on my iPhone, the app (ie the habit timer) doesn‚Äôt continue running when the phone goes to sleep. Timers are really important for me in order to stick to a task and I end up having to use other apps to do this instead.

title: Please add an iPad version!
review: I often use my iPad in landscape mode and it would help me check in easier if I could use this device. Otherwise the app is interesting, I‚Äôve used a lot of apps like this and the letters and actionable tasks in journeys have been really thought provoking. There are a few minor annoyances like having a hard time closing a modal, or being able to go back if I missed part of an audio recording, but the content is interesting.

title: Taught me a lot. Definitely recommended.
review: Fabulous is awesome and had really riacho me a lot. It teaches you new ways to be healthy both inside and out, learning more about yourself on deeper level and learning about your body through the process.  It‚Äôs motivating with the achievements and ‚Äúawards‚Äù, and if you fail (like I have so many times), the app is very encouraging to get you back on track. I highly recommend this app.

title: Love it!!
review: This app is amazing! You can create routines to help you in the morning, afternoon, and evening! The app also plays calming music to help you through your routines, and you get to choose what your routines consist of, when they start, and how long your routine lasts! You can also connect with other people, and post what‚Äôs going on in your life, or whatever you want to post! This app is amazing, totally recommend!!

title: A Motivational App I Actually Use!
review: I‚Äôve used this app for six months now and my life is undeniably changed because of it. I‚Äôm healthier, happier, and more productive. I don‚Äôt know how they did it, but I actually look forward to checking in with myself and my goals every day. I thought it would be either be boring or hokey, but I‚Äôm really enjoying it!  The ‚Äúcoaching‚Äù every morning and night is my favorite part.

title: So Grateful
review: I didn‚Äôt think there was anything that could help me out if this hole. So grateful for fabulous. I‚Äôve made it to day 4 of simple, healthy habits and I can feel my depression dissipating, where there was hopelessness I now look forward to unlocking new stories and completing tasks that are so simple but have huge impact on my energy and mood. I‚Äôm also a lover of fantasy, and magic, so this app calls to my heart.

title: Such a great app!
review: I‚Äôve really been struggling with change and this app lets me set some short term (easy) but it really gets me excited especially once i achieve them. It sounds silly but i don‚Äôt have a routine and with kids and this pandemic it‚Äôs been really hard. This app makes me excited and it‚Äôs great practice for me when I‚Äôm really ready to make those long term commitments and really stick to them this time ‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Early Review
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for three days.  It‚Äôs engaging, but I find it confusing.  There are multiple things happening, not sure where to click, if I‚Äôm interested in clicking one place but do something else first, I can‚Äôt find the option to back.  I think some streamlining could really help.  I‚Äôm going to keep on for awhile to see if it improves or if I can glean what I‚Äôm supposed to be doing, but for now I‚Äôm mostly confused although still curious to keep going.  Good luck if you decide to try this app.

title: First Day so Far so Good
review: This is a very well made App. I love the concept and all of the little things they think of. I recently started to try to implements some self care habits for my mental health recommended by my therapist and I think this will be a good and fun way to track it. My habits could be a to do list but this makes it more interesting and I keep coming back to it... I know it‚Äôs only day one but I really like it so far!

title: Helpful and claiming
review: I have found it to be helpful to remind me of things I forget to do for myself (and with two boys and a husband I tend to put everyone else before myself). The graphics are calming and peaceful and help to relax me when I‚Äôm enjoying these features. If you are looking to develop good habits for you life and need some help this app is a good option. I only gave it 4 stars because of the purchasing factor and I would spend the money if I felt I could.

title: Great experience!
review:
Overall, an engaging and motivating experience. This app definitely reinforces the healthy and positive habits that, I believe, a lot of people want to integrate into their daily routines. 

4 stars because I think the actual interface is (although aesthetically pleasing) a little confusing at first. I didn‚Äôt know if I should be starting new journeys/habits on my own or if the app would schedule them over time.  The ‚Äúprocess‚Äù could be a little more clear.

title: Good for reminders about healthily habits
review: I have been using this app for a few weeks now and I like it pretty well. I like the challenges and little infographics that you can share on social media. One down side is that it give you a lot of habits to try and it‚Äôs hard to do them all. It‚Äôs also not easy to dismiss a challenge. For example it wants me to go on a daily walk, which would be fine, but it‚Äôs July and I live in Phoenix so that‚Äôs not going to happen.

title: There‚Äôs potential
review: The app‚Äôs premise is great, but the user interface is very confusing. Additionally, it feels like the reminders, the images, and messages don‚Äôt flow with what you‚Äôre goals are. For example, I signed up for a ‚ÄúLetting Go‚Äù challenge and my first message was tailored to folks that signed up to the ‚ÄúParents Self-Care‚Äù challenge. Also, I clicked the challenge once and I can‚Äôt find where it ‚Äúlives‚Äù on the app to see my progress or what‚Äôs coming up. I wish there was a tutorial , but ultimately there‚Äôs way too much content in the app at once to make sense of it all. I tried.

title: So helpful
review: I‚Äôve been using Fabulous for two weeks now and my routine has completely changed. Especially helpful keeping me sane and productive during quarantine, it is an app I HIGHLY recommend for people who want to do a lot, but often find their motivation wears off or they have trouble staying consistent. Beautiful graphics, daily coaching, and there are still tools I haven‚Äôt yet used. Download it!!

title: A journey never ends...
review: So why not make it fabulous along the way! That‚Äôs exactly what I‚Äôm doing everyday with this app. I keeps me accountable while encouraging, enlightening and empowering me to stay committed to all of my goals! Every time I complete an accomplishment small or large; I feel like I can do anything and that feels great! I‚Äôm already pretty grounded and fabulous just adds another layers to this. I‚Äôm thankful that I started this program!

title: My life is changing!
review: I have been looking for something like this to encourage me to set healthy routines, but I wanted to keep my daily routine from cluttering my to-do list. By the time the free trial was over, there was no question that I would be keeping this app. It has helped me prioritize exercise, make time to stay organized, and floss! I already like my life better, because I am becoming the person I had wished I was.

title: It works!
review: I noticed how a similar gamification app I am using to motivate me and track my exercise routine has really helped me, so I thought I would try one that focused on self care and developing more good habits....and it‚Äôs totally working! The gamification element really adds this whole level of motivation and reward that makes me absolutely check off each thing I have committed too. Definitely recommend!

title: Would be 5 stars but...
review: I absolutely LOVE this app, but after three weeks of using it, I can no longer launch my fabulous moments and go through my goals. I have sent messages but have not heard back. I love this app so much I paid for the annual membership. Soon after that, it began having issues. I am hoping to get it fixed because this app has done so much for me dealing with anxiety, depression and a general feeling of always being overwhelmed.

title: Content and design
review: The graphic and audio design for this app is lovely. I found it took a couple days (two weeks?) to really grasp the layout. I still don‚Äôt understand the notifications. The content and concepts this app helps track are EXACTLY what I needed. Small goals and gentle guidance really help me to ramp up and feel accomplished. Some of the goals were things I already do (eat breakfast?! Sure!) and that helps one feel like progress is being made.

title: Makes Me Feel Better
review: As a first year teacher, and starting my first year during a pandemic, I‚Äôve been feeling overwhelmed, exhausted, and stressed almost constantly since being hired. Fabulous has been one thing that has helped me turn that around. While all of those feelings are still there, I am growing and becoming the person I want to be. I can face those challenges head-on.

title: User friendly
review:
For the most part the app is super user friendly. 
My 2 concerns are features that I wish were available. (I am only on the trial run version of the app, so certain features may now be available, but if that is the case that should be explained via a disclaimer of some sort) 
I wish there was a journal tab that I can click on and it would pull up all my entries from previous days (with the topics/area you were working on) 

The second, I wish there was a save or favoriting sections for articles, reading things of the activities. These only appear at the time you click on the new habit/ exercise and once you click complete they are gone. 

Other than those things I like it. 
I like that it‚Äôs kind like a game and almost Nintendo inspired. Which I LoVE!

title: Cheesy poetry / Hard to navigate
review: Appreciate the process when otherwise not knowing how to begin on my own. I‚Äôm just into my first week of using the app. But it‚Äôs a gentle effective approach where they start first with something readily attainable‚Äîstart each morning by drinking water. Taking vitamins was added next, then listening to daily coaching. I‚Äôm now at adding exercise, which can be as simple as stretching. The app personalizes each users ‚Äújourney ‚Äú. So if you‚Äôre already a marathoner, I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôd be an entirely different process.

title: Horrible in Every Aspect
review: To say that this app is a total waste is an understatement. From the juvenile nature of the app to the poor customer service, this has been an incredible waste. It is not even worth taking a chance on it during the free trial because they charge you even if you cancel. After notifying them of this they told me sorry we don‚Äôt give refunds. If I could give less than one star I would. I will continue to pursue this until the company makes it right. Hopefully I will be able to update this review that the company corrected the situation. Based on previous responses, I‚Äôm not hopeful.

title: Slowly changing my life!
review: I‚Äôve tried other self-improvement apps, but never stuck with any. This one is truly slowly changing my life. I love how it progresses using baby steps, which are perfect for me. I love that I can set alarms for activities, including ones I add to theirs, such as reminding myself to meditate, do my morning inspirational readings etc...  It‚Äôs fun, realistic, and really makes me feel good about my progress. Thank you!

title: Most fun self care app I‚Äôve tried
review: This app is fun to use and helps to set small, gentle goals and meet them. The idea is to start with small habits like drinking water first thing every morning and then add another small habit and a another until you have a habitual morning routine of self care. You can also expand to build afternoon and evening routines. The creator seems to be actively seeking to continuously improve the app.

title: Love that it builds better habits one at a time
review: I love that this app doesn‚Äôt set you up to fail by throwing a long list in front of you of things to check off. It starts with just 1, after a few days you add another and so on.  So as your list of good habits grows you don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed and it truly becomes a routine. I‚Äôm still early in my journey but I can‚Äôt wait to see where this app takes me.

title: So far so good
review: We all know how to do the things this app suggests. We do. But we need the right kind of motivation to actually do it. I usually don‚Äôt pay for apps cause I‚Äôm cheap - no shame here, but I knew I needed some accountability that ‚Äòfree‚Äô didn‚Äôt offer. So, I‚Äôm in. The 7 minute workouts are great along with so many more options. Don‚Äôt get over whelmed. Start small and build up within your comfort zone. So far, so good!

title: Starts my day off just right
review: I love that there is so much to explore. The background ambient music you find during some parts of it are perfect for reflection after checking in for your daily task. The extra little things that pop up to help you remain positive are so much fun and i share with everyone. Love this app and $40 a year is well worth it if you are dedicated to checking in daily.

title: Cute & Helpful
review: This app is user-friendly. I have been using it for a week, but so far it has inspired me to make small changes in my life (drinking more water, reading before bedtime, eating a healthy breakfast, etc.) I highly recommend to those who are seeking and willing to take baby steps towards a more mindful lifestyle. This app will give you detailed instructions and tips that will help you achieve your goals.

title: Satisfying progress is satisfying
review: The first two days on Fabulous, I was frustrated about being forced to take such small steps. Over the last week I have realized that I have always been and all-or-nothing person and that is why I have failed to change in the past. As I allow myself be guided into tiny, incremental changes, I find myself welcoming the new habits I am forming.

title: I‚Äôve noticed a difference already.
review: I‚Äôve just completed my drinking water as soon as I wake up goal. I splurged on a cute water bottle, bright lemon and glass because I don‚Äôt like the taste of metal in my water, and enjoying my water bottle really did help me remember to put it out. I‚Äôm not forcing myself to drink out of a metal bottle I don‚Äôt enjoy. I also look forward to checking my daily coaching and checking off goals.

title: A beautiful format that keeps me motivated and hopeful. I look forward to it everyday.
review: With the daily check ins and the beautiful artistry, Fabulous keeps you wanting more. I look forward to checking off my daily goals to see where on the path I am. It starts small and builds to keep habits obtainable and sustainable. Fabulous has become part of my daily routine and I‚Äôm feeling lighter already only a week in.

title: Surprisingly Effective!
review: I signed up to be a support to my friend who was trying to drink more water. To my surprise after only a few days I started waking up wanting to drink water. Not thinking, oh I need to drink water but actually being very focused on wanting to! I also soon found myself looking forward to morning breathing exercises. I haven‚Äôt been using the app long but so far it really works!

title: Fun motivator, not the easiest to navigate
review:
I‚Äôve enjoyed my week of using the app, maybe wi  the more time I will change my review.

Glows: 
- it‚Äôs game like enough to make me pick it up and check what goals I have, but not so game like that I am constantly checking the app
- encourages you to start small and simple. Not overwhelming
- the daily motivators and meditations (whatever they‚Äôre called) are really well written and aren‚Äôt either too clinical or too new agey.

Grows:
- I don‚Äôt find the app interface particularly intuitive, easy to hit a button and get somewhere I didn‚Äôt expect
- really hate the voice over thing that happens when you complete goals, but can‚Äôt figure out how to turn off
- doesn‚Äôt seem to be super customizable but that may be because I am only a week in

title: If you want to cancel
review: There‚Äôs not an option to cancel the app. They will take your money and argue that you have to cancel it but that option only becomes available AFTER they steal your money with the first auto renewal. The customer service to this app is terrible. They don‚Äôt address any of your concerns. They will make it impossible for you to cancel your subscription and after you contact them they won‚Äôt reply for weeks. I didn‚Äôt find the app helpful at all, they have a good mission but if it doesn‚Äôt work for you you are out of luck trying to cancel their stupid app.

title: Great so far
review: I have been using for a few days and already notice my mind has become more positive.  I have been taking it slow, doing one task at a time and it has been working well.  While it does seem a little cheesy the positive images, mindful moments, and storyline are really uplifting and help me to reframe my mind.  I am going to try out premium and if I like it will update with further thoughts!

title: Not for me
review: This wasn‚Äôt the app for me. I really like and appreciate the sentiment of the app, that by starting simple and drinking water you can achieve so much more little by little. That‚Äôs great, but what I didn‚Äôt like is that the app forces you into a ‚Äùjourney.‚Äù I want to be able to set my own journey and use the app as a tracker/accountability tool. The motivational push notifications didn‚Äôt come across as corny or annoying which was nice. All in all, it‚Äôs a good app, I just wanted more control from it. Oh and the self care menu is a nice touch!

title: I love this app!!
review: This is a fabulous app for working on self care, motivation, and developing new habits. I used both the free version and the premium version. The free version is really nice to get you going and started on creating small goals. The premium version is nice too because there are lessons and insightful helps geared specifically to the individual. I enjoy this app and I have recommended it to my friends and family.

title: Life Changing
review: Years ago I was an ambitious, energetic, productive young woman. Once I started my career my habits I developed earlier disappeared as I struggled to stay on top of my life responsibilities. I had been longing to get back on a routine for years and battled depression and anxiety. I‚Äôve been using this app for a week and am already making small, consistent changes that have helped make my days so much better. I‚Äôm grateful for this app.

title: best app ever
review: free, so amazing. i have 0 words. there‚Äôs so many challenges that u can complete and it reminds you of your morning evening and afternoon routine which YOU design & not to mention group challenges where people send motivating messages. the app itself writes you a letter everyday & gives you the opportunity to write to urself and allows u to open the letter after u complete a journey. really great sounds for mediation too!!!

title: Exactly what I needed!
review: Short, direct and thought-provoking prompts that helps get and stay focused more by the day. I truly find this to be a way for me to move past and through so many small deterrents that I find overwhelming. I love the celebrate option, the diverse avenues to choose from that help hold us accountable. I have found hope again. Further in, I will update my review, if allowed.

title: Wonderful app
review: I‚Äôve noticed since the new year started that I‚Äôve had difficulty staying focused and maintaining habits. I got the premium version to help me build lasting routines for health and energy and to minimize anxiety that has been increasing since COVID-19 started. So far so good. I focus on 1 goal per day and try to maintain 3 times, just 3. And that feels doable. There is no pressure or rules just being kind to oneself. Definitely a win!

title: Fabulous is awesome!
review: I love Fabulous so much! It helps me get myself together more and know what I need to do to help me stay healthy with a better morning routine and sleep routine! Although I love this app, I wish that you didn‚Äôt have a limit when choosing habits to put in your morning/night routine. Again, this app is marvelous and I have only been using it for a few days! Keep it up developers of this app!

title: Pretty good
review: I like the idea of this app, but I‚Äôm not enjoying the lay out very much. There are also a lot of other things I was hoping to get out of the app that I‚Äôm not finding, for example meditation and more mental health type of guidance. I‚Äôm not sure if this app is starting me off slow to help build up to these goals, or if it just doesn‚Äôt have exactly what I was looking for as far as personal growth. I‚Äôll keep trying it out and see what else comes of it. Not exactly what I thought, but also not a bad app.

title: A little too cartoony
review: The idea and thought behind this app are good. There are some areas of style and execution that are either distracting, or inhibit the use of the app across multiple devices. Overall though I see promise here and will continue to use it, take the good, do my best to ignore the somewhat annoying cartoonish immature gamification, and get some great new habits and routines out of this app. Willing to alter the review as changes are made and the app evolves as all things must.

title: Small habits make big changes
review: I was always the person that would say ‚Äúokay today is the day I am going to change 500 different habits I should be doing‚Äù. Of course, it would last maybe two days. Fabulous shows you how to make small habit changes overtime that grow into big lifestyle changes. For me it‚Äôs totally worth the cost for the extra motivation and coaching.

title: Too complicated
review: I really wanted to like this app but it‚Äôs way too complicated and instructions aren‚Äôt clear. You cannot do a journey and a challenge at the same time but you don‚Äôt know that until you start doing it and one of them malfunctions. I have had to reach out for support 4-5 times already and have only been using it for 3 weeks. I feel like I have to restart everything now and I would rather just delete the app then erase my progress. Also, I don‚Äôt like that you cannot see a full calendar of the challenges. Please fix your bugs and errors or you won‚Äôt have returning customers.

title: Too much going on & too expensive
review: The app itself has a lot of great ideas to help you stay healthy & on track, but 1.) there‚Äôs wayyy too much background distraction. Visually there is too much going on & I personally get flustered trying to figure out what I‚Äôm looking at. I end up getting anxiety & closing the app all together. 2.) $40 for the year?! I completely forgot to opt out of my free trial & it ended up charging me for the year (which is fine bc they warn you about that when you sign up). My concern is that this app, in my opinion, is absolutely not worth $40 for the year.

Apple support did their best to help, but apparently I have to wait anywhere from 24 hours to June 2020 to resolve this issue. I‚Äôve never had an issue like this with any other app from the App Store. Think twice before downloading it.

title: Exactly precisely what I needed!!
review: This app is absolutely wonderful. It gives me small, accomplishable goals, lots of encouragement and most importantly *hope* for the future. I do wish it were a bit more intuitive as I know I‚Äôm missing a lot of the wonderfulness contained within as I just have trouble figuring out all of the specifics. Even so, this is probably my all time favorite app. It‚Äôs a life changer!

title: Has had a huge impact on my mental health
review: I love this app and I have seen a big change in my mental health since I‚Äôve begun using it. The daily letters are so well written and the daily challenges are all specific and actionable which I find very helpful. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who wants to become a better version of themselves but doesn‚Äôt know where to start.

title: üëç Fabulous
review: I tend to often forget to focus on myself and this app has really changed my life style. I‚Äôm at a young age as I‚Äôm 10 and in 5th grade. I struggle a lot with taking care of myself and my stress. This is absolutely Fabulous. It‚Äôs healthy for me while also calming. I had missing assignments and it was frustrating it really was and I‚Äôm shocked at how I have no missing assignments now. Absolutely love this app so far. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Great Fabulous App
review: I‚Äôve been facing a problem of procrastination for my goals in life. Fabulous application solves me with great tips and features that are used in an app are really motivating me to continue my journey and start doing. Strong recommended if you are looking for an app to support your dreams in life, Fabulous is the one for you. Go for it and live the love you love. Heartfelt thanks to development teams for such a great app created for the users. üíì

title: Great accountability and approach to changing habits
review: This app really helps to lay a pathway of implementing incremental habits in a way that are sustainable. Sometimes the app can be a bit confusing and I don‚Äôt always know what I‚Äôm supposed to click on next (reason for four stars instead of five). However, the coaching and easy accountability will keep me using it. Plus it‚Äôs fun and whimsical. Breaks up the monotony of the day and sets me off in the right direction when I wake up.

title: Not working
review: I have a yearly premium. The app keeps shutting down. I tried to write a feedback on the app even then I couldn‚Äôt finish writing one sentence before it shut down. Almost non of the meditations are able to download. When I start a meditation after 4 seconds it shuts down completely. It is so annoying and I have been trying to solve through the app by clearing my background and it is also updated version. How am I supposed to use if the app knocks me off every second. Not to mention I paid the yearly membership already!!

title: You think you don‚Äôt need it but it helps
review: I resisted against giving this app a shot because I thought I can just make a list myself but the interactiveness really makes a difference. I completed a morning routine without feeling overwhelmed for the first time because I didn‚Äôt have to think about what was coming next. I trusted that it would pop up and it did!

title: I love this app. I hope to see it grow!
review:
So far this has been the only app that has actually helped me build a routine. I love that it‚Äôs encouraging and gentle vs making me feel guilty.

I am a premium user and it‚Äôs one of the my most valuable subscribitions. That being said it is not the easiest interface to follow but I know that they are aware and working towards an even better user experience.

title: I‚Äôm just starting out
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a little under a week. I don‚Äôt think the app alone is enough to keep me motivated but it is a nice addition to my continued growth to being the best version of me. With that said this app is very lovely and has a lot of inspiration, helpful tips and I like that it reminds me to do my routines. Yes you have to pay for premium, but at under $50 a year, that‚Äôs a steal!

title: Simple Free Version
review: I‚Äôm enjoying it so far! It‚Äôs only my fifth day. What I like about it is that it doesn‚Äôt try to shove all sorts of routines in your face. Change isn‚Äôt overnight and it does a really good job at only giving you small challenges that anyone is capable at doing. It even suggest more moderate challenges but only to do on the side. The main challenges are quite simple and can work for anyone!

title: Helps me feel inspired!
review: I am so happy that I found this app. I‚Äôve been looking for something to help bring more positivity into my life and Fabulous is it! Helping me create a morning routine that will keep me healthy and motivating me to start my day in the best way I can is allowing me to see things in a different way throughout the day. I am excited to continue my Fabulous journey for a more positive and healthy life.

title: Best ever
review: You guys, this is the best app you will ever have on you phone. Although it is not for everyone because not everyone needs couching to get ahead in life like some of us. I have a positive mind and attitude about any situation but sometimes I need a little couching every now and then and this app have helped me so much. I recommend 100 and 50 %. I gave it a 5 stars because that‚Äôs all they show.. I LOVE FABULOUS SO MUCH! üíóüíóüíó

title: Poor UX
review: I really like the concept of this app and think it has a bright future ahead of it with tweaking. A lot of what the app offers is great but the whole layout and UX of it is confusing, chaotic and unorganized. Also, if you‚Äôre the type of person who isn‚Äôt glued to your phone/reliant on it, this app won‚Äôt be good for you. Instead of this app being a supplement to self-care, I feel like I have to dedicate a lot of time to it, which I feel is counterintuitive. I‚Äôm glad to see it helps so many people but I will be cancelling my free trial only a few days in.

title: So Far So Fabulous
review: Just started the app this week and so far so good. I like that I am able to build daily routines for morning, afternoon, and evening and there are reminders for these events. I like the daily coaching the best. I have it set for first thing in the morning and as part of my wind down in the evening. There is also a community feature, I have not posted on there yet, but is is good to see others struggle with the same things I do.

title: So far so good...
review: So far I am enjoying all the habits and tracking I was a little confused at some points. There is an option for fasting tracking that doesn‚Äôt actually tell you how to fast. Which is totally ok but it seems like it‚Äôs a habit it‚Äôs going to teach you. But I am only a week in so maybe I just haven‚Äôt figured out everything or haven‚Äôt gotten far enough to unlock that goal. I am enjoying the coaching/reader part the most!

title: Best app I have ever had
review: I truly did not know that an app was capable of changing my life like fabulous. I am about 2 weeks in committed to the program and i can see significant change in my routine, my life, and my overall happiness. It makes you excited to get out of bed in the morning and do the little things i used to dread and it‚Äôs pushing me to do the things I‚Äôve always wanted to do

title: So far so good
review: It feels like a game! Seems as though I‚Äôm at a casino with the sound on and all the image transition. Very impressive. I like that it makes it that much more engaging. Like I‚Äôm gambling for the next play when really I‚Äôm just simply deciding to draw closer to the things I really want/need to do. So through all the transitions I get lost. I haven‚Äôt turned in my notifications or alarms yet. I think that starts tomorrow. Ha kinda excited I‚Äôm already with my energy up.

title: Super cool!
review: If you like being gently guided into starting new habits and changing your life for the better, this app uses subtle motivational tactics to help you create a personalized wellness routine that will stick. The artwork and design is beautiful, and I find it easy and quick to take a moment with this app each morning and progress through challenges and immerse myself in adventure. It‚Äôs about the journey, isn‚Äôt it?

title: Helpful
review:
I enjoy a lot of the aspects of this app. I only have the premium because I forgot to cancel after the 7 day trial but after paying close to $36 for it I am definitely putting it to use now!
Glitchy- it freezes up and has to be restarted every once in a while. Also, in the free trial there were lots of fun infographics and that drew me in but after I paid for it there have been the same 6 infographics every day.

title: Second chance
review: I first started this app a couple years ago, but my heart wasn‚Äôt genuinely in it. After many abrupt changes in my life I decided to truly dedicate myself to this. I‚Äôve only restarted but Fabulous is giving me a reason to try harder and challenge myself slowly but surely that only I am the driving force behind my life and my decisions. Thank you for such an empowering tool.

title: GET IT!
review: omg you need this app! it just helps you set basic routines for yourself in life. i‚Äôd recommend for teens who are lazy and adults who are too busy to make time for themselves to everyone in between its been so helpful for my household. it starts off by just simply getting you in the habit of drinking more water. then eventually leads to calling or messaging a friend every day. love this. highly recommend.

title: Great app! Recommend to all who want to reform themselves for the better
review: This app helps you reach your goals gradually rather than pushing them on to you at once, which can be stressful. With the first simple task of drinking water when you wake up or shutting off electronics an hour before bed, you can progressively reach your goals in a way that is non-stressful and manageable for all. Thank you, Fabulous!

title: Game Changer
review: For many of us, it is hard to see the progress we are making at the beginning, and only start to see it towards the end. This app shows very motivating videos, of your journey, to help you see what progress you are making. If you are struggling to creat habit, I would absolutely recommend this app for you. It has definitely been a game changer for me.

title: Surprising!
review:
My daughter recommended this app to me so I tried it just to see what it was like. It is unlike anything I‚Äôve ever used.  Behavior adjustments and improved feeling about life by making itty bitty steps in a new direction. Just lovely!! 

If you are looking to change up your life and break bad habits this is a gentle, easy way to make the change with compassion and drive. I like it and I recommend it.

title: Best App Ever!!!!!
review: Fabulous is the best app for improvement! I have only used the app for a week and I feel like a new me! Also, the membership is just special treatment so if you can afford it then it is fine you will still achieve success like I am doing. I also try to get my comrades to use the app and when they do they love it. Fabulous also has beautiful visuals and even my mother is using Fabulous!

title: So good so far
review: This app is wonderful so many choices and options for free of course if u pay the subscription u get more within the app but I don‚Äôt pay a monthly subscription and gain so much from this app! There is nothing I don‚Äôt like about it besides when u mark off a goal as completed u can‚Äôt un mark it but that isn‚Äôt a big deal that‚Äôs mainly on me someone who does things without noticing

title: Beautiful!!!
review: I like this app I am very stubborn and trust me and I am generally lazy however this app was positive reinforcement and gentle reminders which I quite enjoyed. This helped me get into habit of drinking water and getting exercise as well as losing weight and appreciating life. I‚Äôm only on the first couple weeks however I feel such a change myself I am very happy and energetic I never thought my life would be this great

title: Keeps crashing
review:
This is a great app, I can track my habits and it is really well made. However, whenever I go into the app to ‚Äúlaunch my fabulous moment‚Äù, the app just crashes. The screen either goes completely white or it just kicks me off. Please fix this because I really like this app.

If a developer could please respond to this that would be great!

title: Loving it so far
review:
It would be nice if the pictures of checklists were actually interactive (I know that‚Äôs a lot of work, so I don‚Äôt expect that to change), also some tasks are vague like ‚Äúfocus coaching‚Äù, it would be nice to be able to look up what that task means (I think it had something to do with putting my phone on airplane mode?)

Anyway, still loving the app so far. Thanks!

title: Life Changing if you embrace it
review: I‚Äôve downloaded and deleted Fabulous a few times over the years, but this time around I‚Äôve really opened my mind to what Fabulous can do for me. It can be life changing if you allow it to enter your mind and accept that habits will set you free and the developers really went all out in helping people. I consider it seriously life changing

title: So far so good
review: I‚Äôm just beginning And I‚Äôm kind of slow at making my routine stick. However, the app seems flexible enough that it won‚Äôt be a problem. My motivation is definitely higher. I find the exercises to be enjoyable which is further motivation. I‚Äôm really looking forward to seeing benefits... and I know I will. This app may just be what I needed to change my life.

title: Major issue with functionality
review:
The app is nice, but you definitely would need to pay for the premium features for full use. 

The issue is that it lets you go through the process of everything before telling you that the function is locked behind a paywall. Uninstalling because I‚Äôve already tried many different activities only to be told at the very end that my results are locked and can be revealed for $40. Waste of time.

title: So happy i gave it a chance
review:
I didn‚Äôt think much of the outcome of this app
Wanted to think it would help me but was like ‚Äúeh if it helps horaay, but if it doesn‚Äôt oh well‚Äù kind of attitude.
I love the daily motivators and the side pep talks. Very applicable to my daily thoughts and routines. I love how it will encourage me to set routines and i do appreciate not being an enabler or doesn‚Äôt help me ‚Äúcheat my way out of it‚Äù
Im so glad i gave this app a chance

title: Really Uplifting
review: I‚Äôd recommend this app to anyone who needs to get out of a bad place, but especially to people who struggle feeling supported. This app really shows support and genuinely feels like having mentors that are rooting for you- even without the subscription. It‚Äôs really working beautifully as a way to reinforce and cheer you on as you build habits that will change your way of life!

title: It‚Äôs not for people with chronic disease or serious health issues
review: I have fibromyalgia and having a routine again with all sudden pain attacks is like a dream for me. I try hard to manage my pain and have an active life as much as possible. I try this app for making an extra support to achieve my goal. Unfortunately they completely forgot about people with serious health issues and disability. It seems that they make it for people with mild depression and lack of motivation. I wish they develop it and this time consider people who struggles with chronic diseases.

title: Baby Steps
review: I really was drawn to this app because of the positive messaging of slowing down and taking on a new habit step by step. I think a lot of us want to change, but ultimately try to take on too much too soon. This app is realistic goal setting and an opportunity to slow down and really think about the changes you want to make in your daily life and routines.

title: Getting started is the hardest part
review: For 1.5 years I‚Äôve been saying ‚ÄúI want to get in shape!‚Äù But I haven‚Äôt made it a priority. It‚Äôs only been a few days, but already I‚Äôm drinking more water, exercising and stretching a little everyday, and practicing more mindfulness. I like the new direction! Normally I restrict myself to only free apps, but this is one I‚Äôm going to pay for and see where I go over the next year. :-)

title: Loving Fabulous
review: I am loving this app so far. I have been using it for about 3 weeks now and I am so happy I started. It does seem silly to some to start with water on the habits but to someone like me, I thrive with starting small and building. I am so excited to continue my journey and access more of the content and challenges. Thank you for creating this app it‚Äôs helping me to be a healthier and happier me! üòÅüòÅ

title: Needs Updating
review: This app worked great for the first few months I had it. I subscribed to premium membership and loved it, especially the meditations, but now I can‚Äôt access the meditations as part of ‚Äúget fabulous‚Äù and it‚Äôs frustrating. I‚Äôm turning to Insight Timer for my meditations and using another app to log my habits since this one doesn‚Äôt work. Developers - please please PLEASE upgrade to new iOS or whatever you need to do. I don't want to ditch this app, but if you don‚Äôt update then I‚Äôll have to. I hope this wasn‚Äôt a scam to get money for a premium membership, then just leave your members in the dust. That would be tragic.

title: DEF FAB!

title: Annoyed
review:
Why on earth would you require me to go through a three day routine of water drinking before can actually use the app for what I intended??? It was advertised on fb as a tool to help with working from home. I already have a morning routine and I drink water in the morning. title: Drinking water every morning!!!
review: I started By agreeing to drink water first thing for three mornings. The first day I could tell the difference I had first joined because I was exhausted. I must‚Äôve been dehydrated.
