title: Zero stars
review:
Doesn‚Äôt matter what the app, it should let you cancel in a convenient manner and return money for the remaining time. I was on a free trial and didn't get a reminder at the end of trail so it automatically renewed for a year, i thought id give it a go , but this was just not my thing at all,  and while the instructions say i can cancel anytime and get my money back, it doesn‚Äôt do that! That‚Äôs annoying. 
So if someone from fabulous is reviewing this, please do return my money. 
Thank you

title: Really great app
review: I enjoy this app a lot. This app helps me to keep my routine in check and stay consistent. The free version is more than enough to get you started but I definitely will be purchasing the premium version because it seems to be worth it!

title: I was pleasantly surprised
review: I wasn‚Äôt expecting this app to help me as much as it has. The KIND reminders & encouragement when I am struggling to keep on track help tremendously. No guilt when I haven‚Äôt kept up, & always science based techniques every step of the way helping me to stay motivated & hopeful!

title: Helped get my life on track
review: I have always wanted to improve my life, all at once. And Fabulous has a structured path for me that I can easily follow. I have been able to change habits and keep new ones even when I forget to use the app. Life changer.

title: Great app!
review: So far in the first week of this app and I love it. It has begun to inspire my wife and I to get going and build a solid foundation for steps to a healthy and happy life, even more than we have now.  Sometimes navigating gets me turned around but I am still learning the app.

title: Thank you!!
review: I‚Äôve really been enjoying this app so far. It actually feels like the developers and team want us to see results and to support us. It doesn‚Äôt feel like empty words or routines. Everything has a purpose, and that purpose is to help us succeed.

title: Lovin it
review: It‚Äôs a friendly app that is geared more towards women I‚Äôd like to see a male version or option for the character. Even maybe an animal. Other wise it slowly my gets you on your game starting with little things like drinking water and getting breakfast in you.

title: Enjoying
review: I struggle with dieting. I get overwhelmed and I want to make so many changes all at once. I like how this app breaks things down in baby steps that I can easily follow. I really recommend this for anyone who is a type A personality like me that has the all or nothing approach to dieting.

title: Enchanting self-work app
review: This is such an adorably sweet way to practice self-care! The app starts you out in itty bitty steps, slowly progressing as you consistently build good habits. The pacing was a little frustrating at first for my type-A, get-it-come personality, but now I‚Äôm grateful‚Äîafter all, there‚Äôs no way to ‚Äúwin‚Äù self-care!

title: Great app so far!
review: Really liking the app so far. Small well-defined goals and steps are very approachable.  The alerts are not quite  as prominent as I would like and the documentation of the routine tasks can be a little weird if you‚Äôre not doing all the things immediately in a row. Overall, like it a lot and plan to continue using it.

title: I love this app
review: This app fell into my lap during a low point in my life, and ever since I‚Äôve downloaded it my self compassion has sky rocketed. I‚Äôve learned how to pace myself, and I‚Äôve fallen in love with breaking my bad habits. I have a new appreciation for life‚Äôs challenges, because with this app, I can achieve anything.

title: Best app for setting goals for yourself
review: Well first off, you can make a morning, afternoon, and night routine. You can do challenges for certain amounts of days or weeks. Like: journaling, i am doing it and it is a nice way to get things off your mind or just for a nice mindset! Totally 5 star app!

title: I don‚Äôt like the home screen/page
review: The home screen and page always seems to be crowded which makes it harder to find things. I kind of wish it was more streamlined and easier for me to access my goal. As much as I love the letters and reminders and notes I would prefer the home page just for me check of my goals and access them.

title: Feeling great so far
review: I‚Äôm only about a week in but so far I love the app. It was a little confusing to use at first but now that I‚Äôm getting the hang of it I‚Äôm really enjoying it! I like being able the check things off, feel accomplished, and motivated daily !!

title: Better than the rest
review: I've tried a lot lot lot of habit tracking and goal setting apps. This one is the best because the basics are built in and it's easy to integrate all the habits I want to encourage into routines or rituals. I'll probably go for the paid version bc it's working so well for me.

title: Small steps, big changes
review:
I am one week in and I have felt a surprisingly big shift in my mindset and attitude. This positive shift has seeped into every part of my day and I truly feel more energy and happiness.

The app itself is a little bit hard to navigate, but if I just go with the flow of the prompts I seem to get to where I need to go.

title: Great concept but too cluttered
review: This app is great, but it‚Äôs extremely cluttered. I kept it for about 2 weeks before deleting it because I got overwhelmed every time I opened it. It‚Äôs far from a simple interface. There are pages within pages within more pages. If you‚Äôre looking for a simple app that doesn‚Äôt take much to use this is probably not for you.

title: Not functioning anymore
review: My fabulous is no more working! I‚Äôm getting blank letters and many other problems despite I‚Äôm a premium member!!! I‚Äôve tried to solved the problem following the directions given in the faq. These are not working as well. And the customer service is not working at all because it is only automatic messages. I gave 2 stars instead of one since the program is actually good as long as it works.

title: Helps me a lot but still some bugs
review: This app is fun to use and self-rewarding. Life changing if you get in the habit of using it. Love all the content, but unfortunately none of the ‚Äúletters‚Äù ever show - they‚Äôre always blank for me even though I keep my app updated. I cancelled my subscription but would reinstate if this was fixed! Thanks!

title: Perspective changes everything!
review: I love habits and rituals but I do way too much too quickly and always beat myself up when I fail. I am learning so much about how to frame my thoughts and actions for success. This is a great app for growing with yourself and not in spite of yourself.

title: I‚Äôm kinda stucküï¥üèæ
review: I haven‚Äôt gotten far into the app, but what I‚Äôve seen is that when they ask what you identify as the only other option other than (wo)man is non-binary. I personally as a Genderfluid person don‚Äôt know what to put. I wouldn‚Äôt say I don‚Äôt like the app just because of this, but I‚Äôd like to point it out.

title: Give into it!
review:
Enjoying my fabulous journey thus far.
Due to glitches in the app I had to start my journey again, but I‚Äôm still enjoying. The app gives me a moment of peace and solitude throughout my day that I would otherwise ignore. An a improvement would be to launch certain fab moments whenever I want.

title: Why this app is a really great app. (Lol)
review: First, I have only been using this app for 2 days and I am feeling much better and I suggest to download this app. Second, this app helps you be more positive and have a more happy life. It also helps you with your feelings or troubles with yourself.

title: So far so good
review: I‚Äôve kept my new routines up for 6 days in a row now, hoping to keep it going. One thing I need to figure out is if I can move daily goals around to different times in the day. For instance, exercising; if I can‚Äôt get to it in the morning, but achieve the goal in the afternoon, can/should I still mark it as done?

title: Off to a great start!
review: I have had this app for a few days and it has motivated to be a better version of me. I aspire to be and create a path filled with health and wellness for myself and onto others. Super excited to use this app, I bought the premium for the year! ‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Retiring Soon

I am learning to put myself first and take care of myself, instead of others.  Making,‚Äùme time‚Äù and it feels good.

title: Fabulous is great!üôÇ
review: Fabulous has improved my work ethic drastically. It has helped me workout confidently and efficiently. It has helped me get bigger by reminding me of my good and bad times. It has reminded me when and not to workout. It‚Äôs gave me crucial tips and advice on what and not to do. Such a all around stellar app!üòÅüòÖ

title: Loving this app! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review: I have tried a few other apps that are similar, but rarely open them after downloading and the initial set up. Fabulous is different. It feels like a game, and the encouragement to complete challenges is just what I needed!

title: Best App to Establish Healthy Habits!
review: This app is a game changer for me! For a while, my daily routine was quite sporadic, and wasn‚Äôt as structured as I wanted it to be due to multiple factors. Lack of motivation was a key factor, but with this app, it allows me to set new goals to create a healthy lifestyle. It‚Äôs the perfect way to discipline yourself and I love it!

title: If you can Ig
review: I would def rate this a five out of five, but I just don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs for me. I also canceled the free trial thing a day before it was done, but I still have it til next year and it‚Äôs billing me? The app itself is honestly really good tho. I just can‚Äôt see myself opening it and checking things in every morning and night.

title: Not intuitive, crashes constantly
review:
The app itself doesn‚Äôt offer a streamlined experience. I love the content, it‚Äôs great- when you can figure out where to click to get it and when it doesn‚Äôt crash.
First few days my story played right after completing the tasks for the day- then it didn‚Äôt continue? I was not done with the ‚Äúpath‚Äù but there was nothing I could do to see the day.
Conceptually great, execution poor.

title: Like Getting A Sip of Water Out of a Fire Hose
review:
At first I liked the idea of building positive routines. But it quickly became a nuisance. No way to turn off quiet moments, meditation music, add super powers (none of which appealed), additional tasks, etc.  it spirals out of control. Rather than moving toward a feeling of wellness, I am now in a state of remorse that I blew almost $40.
If there was a way to structure it to keep it simple, I‚Äôd like it. 
Now I‚Äôll just set up and add to my routines in my free Reminders app.

This app really helped me stay on track; I downloaded this app to help me battle my procrastination and just to help better myself mentally and it has been working wonders. It's the simple reminders and the lists that helps me get through the day; plus those little notes you can add to reflect on your activities.

title: Feeling Great!
review: It‚Äôs only been about 2 weeks with the App and I absolutely love it. The cutesy design makes the app fun to interact with. Also, the challenges and the advice along with them make me want to complete them and better myself. I can‚Äôt wait for the rest of my Fabulous journeyüëç

title: Great app
review: I could go on and on about how great this app is there is only one things. When you start, you are not aloud to have more than three habits at a time which is kinda sad but it is not something that can ruin the app. Overall, I definitely recommend it for someone who wants to start a daily routine.

title: This works for me
review:
The incremental change approach seems like an approach that will stick for me.  If developing positive, lasting habits is your goal, you'll enjoy this app.  If patience is not one of your virtues, the app may not be for you.  

Unless you want to make patience one of your virtues (highly recommended!!!).

title: Fabulous has helped me establish a great morning routine
review: Fabulous is so easy to use, and relaxing. It‚Äôs like having a calm mentor guide you to success. I now have better habits in my morning routine (waking earlier, drinking water, and planning my day out calmly and with mindfulness) it was one of my best investments in self-care.

title: Great daily motivation
review: A good daily motivation app to remind you to do the things that scientifically improve happiness. Generally takes less than 10 minutes a day, and helps you check in with yourself each day.

title: So far, so good!
review: My mental health, I feel, is fairly good at the moment. However, I feel incredibly lazy all the time and so I decided to try this app. So far, it has been amazing! I‚Äôm excited to see my progress by the end of this month! (Maybe I‚Äôll even update this üëç)

title: Good but over complicated
review: The user interface is really complicated with lots of things to explore on the dashboard. I really wish it was less complicated and had these on the side. It‚Äôs also really way too pricey at $30 a month. It‚Äôs beautifully done though with lots of good goal progressions, meditative moments, and slow baby steps for making new habits

title: User Interface and Experience
review:
The me of the future is then one talking to me through fabulous! What a brilliant idea to inspire me and start the day with a goal in mind. 
Great application, easy to navigate, everything is well thought and there for a reason. Colorful, fun, and creative.

title: Skeptical but now I love it
review: I was skeptical when I first downloaded it but I admit it‚Äôs pretty cool. It starts you off with small manageable habit change and I can tell it‚Äôs leading up to big ones. This is a pretty, well thought out app that I will actually pay real money for.

title: Amazing!!!
review: I‚Äôm normally not the type of person to be into this kind of stuff. But even just in a short amount of time I find myself having better days with more energy. They have great programs and amazing advice or story‚Äôs to go off of

title: Recommend it
review:
If you‚Äôre feeling stuck and need motivation to accomplish things, build a better routine, what have you. This app is for you.
I wouldn‚Äôt go as far as to say this app will fix all of your problems.
This is a foundation, the soil to grow your seed.
It‚Äôs up to you to add onto your routines and goals, but this app will jump start you to success.
The format is a bit confusing at first, that‚Äôs really the only thing I don‚Äôt like about the app.
But the letters, nightly motivations, reminders, and the circles are absolutely amazing!
I hope this helps y‚Äôall out

title: Love!
review: As someone who gets easily discouraged and constantly falls to bad habits, this is a great app. It starts you out with small tasks, and adds more over time. I love the structure, community, workouts, and little moments of wisdom they give me in the morning. This is a fantastic app. Definitely worth it.

title: Helpful
review: This is helping me develop one good habit at a time, slowly. I‚Äôm not being pushed with constant bells and reminders every day to do something. It also has way more to offer than other apps I‚Äôve tried - the coaching can be helpful as well.

title: Journey to better habits
review: I want to say that this app is life-changing I would say it‚Äôs habit changing‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve only had it for two weeks but I am already starting to see changing my self so much so that I am thinking of purchasing the premium membership

title: For those who need a little help...
review: I struggle with compulsive habits that distract me from productivity. I know what I need to do, but it‚Äôs hard in the moment to break a habit! This app has helped me be more aware and mindful, and has already helped me get a better and more consistent morning routine.

title: So far...
review: So good! I really love the aesthetic of this app and while I‚Äôm still getting used to where things are and what to click on and when, I‚Äôm enjoying it and think it will be useful for me in the long run. Maybe just *slightly* confusing to navigate, but I‚Äôve only been using it a few days.

title: So far, so good
review:
Its not yet been a week, but I‚Äôm truly enjoying this app. The gentle reminders are hopefully going to help me help myself. üòä

(@ 2:41 PM)
I‚Äôm glad that I have purchased this app. It isn‚Äôt confusing at all. It is patient with me, as I need right now. 
I feel relaxed and ready to continue my day. üåàüå∏

title: Almost perfect
review:
I would recommend this app for anyone who is looking to boost their productivity, regulate their sleep hygiene or for just general self-care 
. I am clinically bipolar and within the past few weeks of me starting this over again, I feel that Fabulous has helped me build up on my resilience and coping skills.

title: Great app
review: Love the graphics, the messages, the narration voices, the music. This app has many elements that inspire you to keep on changing your habits and transforming those into healthy life style changes. I am working on my focus, moving, pausing, eating better and I feel this app is helping.

title: Change is possible
review: I have always vowed to myself to treat myself with more kindness, get in shape, (insert every New Years resolution ever). I have never been able to actually stick with something as long as I have this time. And it‚Äôs all thanks to fabulous!

title: Meh - Make sure you do everything if you Cx
review: Joined the month free of premium to see if Fabulous was for me. I thought it had a lot of extra fluff I wouldn‚Äôt use, no clear place to see my achievements, and it flows poorly. I tried to cancel twice (and thought I was just they were letting me finish my free trial), but they charged me. Apparently cancelling is a four step process so you will be roped into a paying for the year, so I missed the cutoff. Had high hopes, but I‚Äôm just really disappointed.

title: The needed extra push
review: I‚Äôve been wanting to start these habits for years. Having Fabulous to keep track of my progress and encourage me along the way has been the needed extra push to help me be more consistent with my habits.

title: Love it

title: Feel-good app.

title: Awesome so far
review: I‚Äôm really enjoying this app, it helps me build good healthy habits. It can be so easy to forget to practice self-care sometimes, but this app sure does do a great job at making sure I keep up with that. If I could I‚Äôd rate 6/5 stars but sadly, it only goes up to 5.

title: Great app
review: It‚Äôs helped keep me motivated during the COVID pandemic and focus on goals. I was stressed out and felt like I was too busy to get anything done but work. This has helped me get organized and take things one step at a time. I like how it starts small and grows into more challenging tasks.

title: Amazing App
review: This app is really enjoyable, it helps you take a better path to reach goals one day at a time. If you are really looking for change but has difficulty adding new habits to your life it‚Äôs worth the try. Very nicely done and the interface is awesome.

title: Newness
review: When you are looking to connect spiritually your mindfulness and awareness kicks into high gear. You can pick up your phone to get a reminder to just breathe. title: Amazing app overall!!
review: I love this app soooo much,you can basically do what ever you want in it and it also gives you challenges and goals that are amazing and easy! If you are trying to go on a diet or loose a couple of pounds,I recommend you to try this!

title: Fabulous Not So Fabulous
review:
I only got through the second day with this app. I read everything, drank my water, read the motivational posters. Clearly One does not really get to test the app until after the trial period and the subscription is paid.  What I did note is that EVERY post, motivational text, following every subliminal message, or whatever is GEARED TOWARD YOU PASSING IT ON TO YOUR FRIENDS  who they might snag into signing up for the app.  
Basically what I saw was motivational clich√©s that can be found anywhere on the Internet.

title: I love this app.
review: I love everything about this app. Fabulous actually has the ability to effectively help people start new healthy habits and end unhealthy old ones. With this app I have quit smoking, eaten better and made sure I got my daily dose of water and exercise. I feel so good!

title: Weirdly Working?

title: Life Changing

title: Positively Life Changing

title: So far so good!
review:

title: Relaxation

title: Unique and useful

title: Wonderful
review: I love this app. When I first downloaded it a while back it was still just as great. I just wish it wasn‚Äôt so expensive to continue. As soon as I get past the free stuff, I always almost buy it but honestly, it‚Äôs a lot for an app.

title: Deceiving
review: I signed up to do a free 7 day trial of the app (the price for a subscription is hard to find) and when I went to cancel my subscription on the 7th day, I was charged anyway. Come to find out it is over $30 for the year. I emailed the company to complain but never heard back. Now I am stuck for a year with an app I will not use. It may be a nice app, but not for the price. Disappointed with the customer service.

title: Okay, but not amazing.
review: I‚Äôm a big fan of building small habits in order to sustain a healthy lifestyle, so I thought this app would help me with some new habits. The issue is that this has a lot of features that aren‚Äôt organized well, so it just seems like a lot of clutter and distraction. As a side note I got a notification about a ‚ÄúNo Sugar Weekend‚Äù challenge. Since that‚Äôs like the opposite of building healthy, SUSTAINABLE, long-term habits, this app is getting deleted.

title: GET THIS APP!!
review:

This app keeps me on track every dayüíï‚ú®

review: This app has really, really helped me get into the swing of the school year again. Building a routine based on how YOU want to nourish yourself (both physically and as a person) really helps to keep you motivated toward your goal - especially with the reminders!

title: Disappointing & scammy
review:
I tried a free week and cancelled on day 2 from the app. I cancelled my subscription because I found the app too fluffy and not easily customizable. I am all for habit change, but I already drink a gallon of water a day and it the app laughably suggested I begin by ‚Äúdrinking a glass of water to start the day‚Äù for 3 days while discouraging me from adding any other habits. 

***************************************************
On top of that, I still was charged the annual subscription fee. What a disappointment

title: Scam
review: This app has found a way to manipulate the App Store into believing that you signed up for a yearly subscription when you did not. title: Enjoy this app

review: I just downloaded this app for the second time. I tried it once and I fell off. But I remember how motivational and inspiring this app was. It was very easy to use and comforting to follow along with. I downloaded it again because I‚Äôm ready to try this journey again. I definitely recommend this app.

title: Nothing short of amazing!!

review: Fabulous is a great way to build habits slowly for people like me who tend to jump in to doing everything at once and then get overwhelmed. I‚Äôve also found it to be an awesome tool for keeping me present and grounded throughout my day.

review: Perfect for starting to create a structured day while being kind to yourself Easy to do with only a minute or two available at a time. I really like that the coaching sessions are both audio and written.

title: Simply beautiful
review: From the graphics to the soothing voices to the gentle encouragement, Fabulous is simply beautiful. It‚Äôs not just an app, it‚Äôs an immersive world where you are the focus of your own attention for however brief or lengthy a time as you can provide yourself.

review: I‚Äôve always struggled with keeping my self motivated enough to push my self harder but with fabulous, I‚Äôm motivated, I got my personal to-do list. For a person like me to be excited is rare but with this app, zoo-see-mama, everything changes.

title: Financial hardship No Refund
review:
I was given a free trial by my daughter who purchased a premium membership. 
With a recent death of a loved one and financial hardship, I forgot to cancel the subscription and was charged $50. I cannot afford this and requested a refund, to no avail. I despise being forced to pay for a subscription I do not want. 
Even when I can afford this app. I wouldn‚Äôt pay for it because of how they don‚Äôt consider people get busy with life and forget to cancel a subscription.

title: Obsessed!

title: Love this app!
review: I have such a hard time actually committing to goals I give myself. This app has made it so easy and gives you encouragement along the way! I would 100% recommend to anyone who needs help in their life journey!

title: Fabulous is fabulous!!

title: Truly engaging experience

title: A fantastic tool for building sustainable change
review: This is not for those looking for a quick fix, but for people wanting to truly build better, sustainable, life habits that will slowly add up to big change.

title: Helpful and enjoyable

title: So far so good!

review: This is such a great app when it works but I keep resolving to not use it because it is so unstable. In a short few minutes of using it you can expect several freezes or full crashes where the app just closes completely. I pay for the premium version and it‚Äôs a shame they don‚Äôt improve this. title: Seriously? This is ‚Äúself-help?‚Äù
review: Yes, repetition is a way to swap out one habit for the next - but that is not growth. Growth is learning and changing our thinking. New experiences and knowledge lead to lasting change. Habits are what we teach robots in controlled environments where they don‚Äôt have to adjust to variables like humans do in everyday life. Finally, for those who celebrate brushing their teeth everyday as a big win - it‚Äôs time to up your game. Surviving is not thriving. Make your habit thinking - no repeating.

Beware, you are committing to paying first then sample preliminary content, which is to drink water every morning.

And then you get their obtuse political agenda.
App uses 3 leaders as examples:  Nelson Mandela-world revolutionary, Benjamin Franklin-founding father of United States of America and then randomly Michelle Obama-who grew a vegetable garden with help and gained almost $40 million as pampered wife of Former President.  She gets on this list because she got up at 4:30 am?

This on a self-care app that suggests limiting social media?

Cancelled and deleted immediately and then realized next day that I need to go through Apple Pay to cancel as well.

I thought this would be an app to keep track of my goals. It‚Äôs not.

If you‚Äôre already a motivated person, looking to hone your performance, this app is not for you. 

Delete. Next.

title: My honestly opinion!
review: I never write reviews on anything mostly because I believe it‚Äôs a waste of time! But I wanted to write a review on this app hoping people would read it and hopefully this helps. I‚Äôm a 22 year old female, I am ADHD, bipolar, over weight, have both depression and anxiety. I am also one who keeps everything bottled up to make sure everyone is happy. In honesty, this is my second day using the app and in my opinion it‚Äôs already starting to ease my mind and I feel relaxed for once. IConstantly think about death (not suicide but just the feeling after) or everything else around me. I never think about myself I honestly never journaled before and I‚Äôve been to therapist but they never help. When I downloaded this app I honestly think it was just gonna be like every other app but I can honestly say it‚Äôs not this morning when I started logging my habits or habits I want to begin it says reminders for each thing and it will not let me add unless it warned me that too many habits to start with can make me overwhelmed and I never seen an app that had it to where I can see the support that the creators actually give until now.I never thought I can get my life in order but this app is helping me see that I can possibly do otherwise that if I feel like I have a problem with myself which I do feel that way just because of my mental disorders I can see that I can change my life around and hopefully not have to suffer from anxiety and depression the others will always be there but I‚Äôm hoping that I can change the small parts about myself that will eventually become bigger. And I honestly want to thank the creators for creating this app and I highly recommend!

title: Unexpectedly surprised
review: I‚Äôm really enjoying the app. Honestly I had very low expectations terms of its ability to improve my life and how I feel. And I definitely didn‚Äôt think it would actually impact my day to day habits. I‚Äôve been suffering from extreme  burnout, and have tried a variety of approaches to mitigate the effect on my professional and personal life, including taking vacation without much change. Somehow since using this app, I‚Äôm now going on my third week, I have actually been feeling a little more positive, energized and motivated to work every day. This app has helped me design a routine and stick to it. Who knew that was possible. I magically seem to remember to do the habits because of their methodology. Furthermore the structure prioritizes my personal needs at the time of starting the program which was my own health and some other parts of life that are important to me but are often neglected and end up on the bottom of my to do list. It‚Äôs a bit surreal to think that since I began using this app, my work responsibilities and life balance has become more manageable and consistent but it absolutely has. It definitely didn‚Äôt happen over night and was impatient to see results immediately the first week, but after week two there has been considerable decrease in burnout symptoms and I look forward to completing the morning and afternoon routines so that I can mark them complete in the app. I was very skeptical and part of me would have thought the improvements were just placebo, but it‚Äôs really not. And at this point there haven‚Äôt been any other changes in my life much less anything that would create a positive sustainable difference in my day to day life other than the Fabulous app. Because the improvements began to occur when I began using the app and has continued to progress slowly (but with patience) since then. Thank you to the Fabulous team. I look forward to continuing the journey!

title: The best habit tracker
review: I‚Äôve never been so impressed with what an app could accomplish in my life. It‚Äôs too underrated and should get more love... this is the best thing that‚Äôs happened to me in quarantine! First of all, unlike other apps which only let you pick 3 or 5 habits, this lets you pick a total of 9, spread out into morning, afternoon, and evening routines. They limit you to three for each ritual at first to keep you motivated but later they‚Äôll slowly add more for you as you continue on your journey. I even sent feedback only for a misunderstanding in the app, but the answer I received was thoroughly written. I could tell that they actually cared about my experience, so thanks for that! Fabulous is also (fabulous) at making my habits stick. When I used Productive, it gave me no motivators whatsoever so I was forced to push myself. But I‚Äôm lazy...so I couldn‚Äôt really do that, and I ended up just not completing any of my habits and discouraging myself. Fabulous has what they call a Fabulous Moment, where it pushes you to do everything at once. Having a timer for each habit is also very helpful. They even send you letters from your ‚Äúfuture self‚Äù and so on to motivate you even further. The Coaching tab was so much more detailed than I thought it would be! And best of all, you don‚Äôt have to pay for any of the features I mentioned! They offer pretty nice stuff in Premium, however. One thing I would suggest is to make it an option to view the days of the week on the home screen so you can tap them and check off which ones you completed if you forgot to on that day. Productive had this option, but this is just a suggestion to make this app even more efficient! Thank you so much for helping me live a healthy and more productive life!

title: Pretty good
review:
I feel there are many things this app can help with. Especially in the new year resolution area. Mine was to be more aware of what I wasn‚Äôt taking advantage of and setting routines for a better, more productive life. I always say I will take care of something, or I need to work out, or I wish I could have more time for me. This app, so far, is starting slowly to get me into that mindset of setting a routine daily. Now, there are some quirks to the app as how fast it may be taking you, and it really depends on your life, when you get up, and what your schedule looks like daily. This is more driven for people working the 9-5 jobs, whereas I work 6-3. I really hope this works to help me in my continued growth, and I‚Äôm learning slowly to change my life for the best one yet. 

I understand what they are aiming to do with the app, just wish it would stretch the challenges a little farther, instead of 3 days and a new routine, maybe every 5-7 days so I can get used to the idea of say, drinking water every morning. I like taking it slow, getting used to the idea, manipulating it and being excited about it, but within 7 days I‚Äôve got 4 things they want me to be doing before going into work! Plus, maybe I‚Äôm not seeing all of the options, but I wish I could opt out of a challenge or snooze it for just a few days, let me get my head wrapped around the idea of my new routine, then I can progress with my journey. I have purchased the premium membership, I plan on using this to help me with my routines and mindsets, and I am committed to using the app. So just little things I‚Äôve seen after the 7 initial days.

Overall, I believe in the end this will help me, but I do see where some won‚Äôt benefit and see it as more a burden daily. It‚Äôs a daily app that wants you to be committed, so if you‚Äôre not fully ready for a change, don‚Äôt purchase the premium, but definitely try the app out! They give you 7 day free trial, and with that it seems like the best app I‚Äôve seen to help with self improvement. To a better 2021!

title: Customer service - NOT
review: I've used Fabulous for years and absolutely love it... when it works, but customer support seems non-existent when it doesn't. On the one hand, it has worked for me most of the time, but it recently broke when I migrated to a new phone. Short version of the break - As long as I stay on my current journey I'm fine, but when I try to switch to a new challenge it requires me to sign in to my account (which I'm already signed into) and then it freezes. This is in spite of having followed the instructions for switching to a new device. I get that things happen, but the only option for customer support is an email in the app and responses are extremely slow, if you even get a response. I know because this is the third time I've contacted support. The first time they took weeks before getting back to me and the second request was a simple question that I sent them four days ago and haven't heard back. So, I'm not surprised I haven't heard from them in 24 hours about the break, but I am more frustrated this time because this issue prevents me from fully using the app. I will add that when I asked on the app's FB page the simple question about what time of day daily coaching was posted, my post was disapproved, within just a few hours, the moderator told me it was inappropriate for the FB group's purpose, and I was directed to use the help function in the app, which of course has received no response. Bottom line - It's great for setting up routines and developing new habits but for its price customer service is woefully lacking.

title: I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôm feeling too Fabulous
review: I agree with one of the other users who suggested allowing you to say ‚ÄúI already do this habit‚Äù would be helpful. If that‚Äôs the case I‚Äôm okay with keeping the habit, but amp it up with another option. The story telling is nice, but I‚Äôm not feeling super motivated by it. I like the quotes much better where I can journal my thoughts alongside it. I also really like the guides and other suggestions that pop up that I can even quickly post on Instagram or save in my phone. However, I am currently having a hard time even locating them at the moment. I could have sworn yesterday there was a way for me to go back to them. I would prefer prompts that keep me more interested and then have a place to go back to and access them again or a place where I can better see my daily progress outside of just the journey prompt with the habits. I‚Äôm not sure that I‚Äôll keep the subscription after the 7 day trial. It‚Äôs a nice app and I do like being forced to slow down and ease into the goals since I‚Äôm often overloading myself with goals, but I don‚Äôt feel that challenged. You can‚Äôt build on a challenge and keep the habit, but maybe that‚Äôs the point that I‚Äôm not fully grasping. I‚Äôm not fully bought in because it hasn‚Äôt fully peaked my interest. It would be nice if the app maybe asked a series of questions and tried to learn a little more about you before it forced you into a specific set of habits to follow that may not apply to you. I have tried other apps that I like much better. This one is falling short for me. I‚Äôm on day 5 of 7 and will stay optimistic.

title: A Fabulous, Happy Mistake
review:
I downloaded this app for the free trial, liked it and used it for a day or two. Then on the third day completely forgot about it. Well, as most of us do, I forgot to cancel my trial and ended up purchasing a year‚Äôs subscription. There‚Äôs a lot I want to improve in my life and it did seem to work for me... so I made the decision to just use it for a year. A couple of weeks after that, while trying to attempt exercising semi-regularly, I remembered this app. Then I said to myself, ‚ÄúI paid for it and I‚Äôm for damned sure gonna use it.‚Äù 

That‚Äôs how I started my new life. I set my goals in Fabulous for three times of my day. Then, even when I didn‚Äôt want to do any of the routines I had set for myself, I would use the app everyday anyway. By reminding myself that I paid for it and was going to get my money‚Äôs worth. 

Though honestly, Fabulous makes you want to login three times a day anyway. It can make different tasks so much more pleasant with the ‚ÄúLaunch Fabulous Moment‚Äù feature that will time out for you when you‚Äôve programmed it to, plays instrumental music, shows appealing images, shows how many days you‚Äôve done this task, and has a pleasant sound that becomes rewarding when the timer let‚Äôs you know you‚Äôre done. Then it‚Äôs motivational challenges, motivational stories, and motivational ‚Äúletters‚Äù are actually helpful, actually motivational, aren‚Äôt cheesy, and are relatable (and pretty). 

This is the Fabulous Happy Mistake I‚Äôve fallen into, and I am beyond grateful for it. Best ‚Äúmistake‚Äù ever. This is a system that works for me and makes me look forward to using it. Plus it also includes some directionals too. 

Download this app, seriously, if it worked for me of all people, it‚Äôll work for you. Change your life and make a Fabulous, Happy Mistake too. You won‚Äôt regret it.

title: A little push out of deep depression - some changes needed
review:
I have had a terrible depression for 6 months. I recently started to see a therapist who recommended I start a small routine in the morning and set a positive intention. I stumbled on this app looking for a technical source to aid me in making small changes. This app has been wonderful on answering what I needed which is what should I do first when setting my small routine and what steps should I take.  I‚Äôm a week in and have a morning, afternoon, night routine - with only 2-3 steps for each. I have accomplished each one which is saying a lot from someone who couldn‚Äôt do anything for myself for months. The guided goals on lowering my tech addiction, and focusing on my physical health are really helpful. I have previously tried to do routines but made them too detailed and got discouraged when I could not complete them.

The few things I would like to change about the app:
I received a on screen alert from ‚Äúme‚Äù ten years from now that said they were still the same and I need to keep making changes I am making now for that not to happen. This was extremely discouraging and this fear and helplessness of being the same is a primary driver of my depression. I don‚Äôt think fear-based alerts is a good idea and would plead with you to remove that alert!

The music box sound that plays as an alarm for your routines is high pitched and grating - I would like the option to change the alarm.

The constant ‚Äúshare‚Äù alerts that have me sending the fab app to my friends is weird and intrusive. Maybe have that less in the app - I understand why it‚Äôs there - it just shows up too often.

title: Seems effective so far, very cute
review:
I‚Äôm the kind of person who fully jumps into a new routine and then gets overwhelmed and quite a few days later. Apps don‚Äôt help because they overwhelm me almost immediately. I‚Äôm liking Fabulous so far, though, because it‚Äôs making me go kind of slow. I don‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. On the contrary, I have been achieving the few small tasks every day since getting the app, and have been slowly adding on more instead of trying to do everything at once. This feels achievable. 

I am also engaged by the storytelling aspect of this app, and the graphics. It‚Äôs just really cute and well designed. I‚Äôm an illustrator and graphic designer, myself, so the visuals and ease of use of any app really stand out to me. A few things were a little difficult to understand at first, but I got the hang of them after a couple of days. The app leads me, but also gives me enough wiggle room to make my own decisions about the paths I take on it.

My one negative would be that it keeps encouraging me to connect with others on the app. I know that seems like a silly critique, and it is true for many people that connecting with others helps them achieve their goals! But for me I usually find it to be the opposite. I get overwhelmed with the social aspects and feel like I‚Äôm failing, rather than feeling encouraged. Also, as soon as someone is negative or whiny in a forum, I don‚Äôt want to be there any more, so the social media, forum, online connection aspect of any app really sets me back rather than encouraging me. I just wish that I could turn those ‚Äúreminders‚Äù off. 

But it is a very good app and I am hopeful that it will help me achieve goals I‚Äôve heretofore been unable to stick with. I‚Äôll update this review if that changes, but here‚Äôs hoping I won‚Äôt have to!

title: Truly Amazing!!
review:
This game is absolutely amazing. I would recommend for all ages. Although paid version offers good stuff, can use perfectly well without paying anything.

Features:

1. Daily goals:

Fabulous offers daily goals in the best way possible. Not only are the beautiful artistic drawings customized to each routine, but there is tranquil and calming music playing through each. Once a routine is done, you hit a check mark and it moves to the next until you finish.

2. Fabulous moment:

This app offers a really cool feature called a fabulous moment. It runs you through the daily goals and then plays a tidbit of a story (totally optional) and let‚Äôs you see a bit more each day. This is great motivation to come back and really fun.

3. Letters:

Fabulous sends you letters of encouragement and even letters from your future self (if you enable them) which I personally love.

4. Fabulous community:

Though I personally opted out of joining the fabulous community (parents if you don‚Äôt want your kids to have social media you can use the app completely social media free) just to distance myself from social media, but it really is a great community. If you want to talk about issues or find a wholesome community of people with similar experiences, this app is for you.

5. Fabulous premium.

Fabulous premium is amazing. But the thing I LOVE ABOUT THIS APP is that you can use it and use it well without paying ANYTHING. Please consider trying this app, it has really changed me for the better.

title: If you are like me, try this app.
review:
Hi, I am a 16 year old girl. I am considered obese and I suffer from PCOS, hypothyroidism, extreme anxiety, extreme depression, ADD and a few other cherries on top. I want to treat myself better physically and mentally.

I started browsing through the App Store and found apps that claimed to ‚Äúhelp become a better you‚Äù. I gave each app a little more then a week. But it was all the same. Nothing was truly organized, everything was hugged into one category with out thinking about the one using the app. Every app I tried just didn‚Äôt help or keep me motivated. I can‚Äôt forget that on certain apps it makes you pay for the content you want most.

 I was feeling worse cause nothing was working! Then I found this app. I didn‚Äôt think it would work or help me but I tried it. Oh boy did I think wrong. This is the by far the best app I have ever tried. It takes things slow and guides you through each day. 

It started out with questions about myself and I answered to my best ability. Then I was greeted with an animation which is so well put together and beautiful. My first task was to start with drinking water in the morning for 3 days straight. I failed the second day and tried again. This app gives tips on how to do tasks without forgetting. Like setting a glass of water beside the bed before sleeping. I‚Äôve only had this app for about a week or so. I know this app has good intentions and will help me be a better me. I‚Äôm done being tired and feeling so little about myself. I think if you are anything like me, you need to try this app. 

I just want to thank those who created this app. I have never felt so good about myself before. I might of just started but I am so excited to have found you guys. I thought I had lost the battle for a healthy me. I even tried at home stuff but it just didn‚Äôt work. This app is well thought, put together and I just know that those who created and work on it put so much care into it. I wish I would of found this app sooner. Seriously, thank you so much. It feels almost way to true to have this app. I never ever leave reviews but... people need to know that this is truest one of the best apps to get. Thank you thank you thank you!

   ~Megan ü•∫‚ù§Ô∏èüëç

title: Super satisfied
review: Love this app

title: Beautiful App
review:
To the creators of this app, thank you. You‚Äôve already helped me so much when I didn‚Äôt think I could be helped at this point. 

I‚Äôve been really struggling lately with my mental health and focus due to several factors including a breakup, debt with no job, and being kicked out of school (attendance issues, also due to deteriorating mental health). It‚Äôs gotten so bad that my suicidal thoughts have come back for the first time since I was 16 (I am currently a 20y old woman), and my mom has urged me to seek out therapy and medication for the first time in my life because I‚Äôm worrying my family so much. I‚Äôve been isolating to an extreme degree, losing an unhealthy amount of weight due to not eating, and crying at uncontrollable intervals.
Then I found this app, and about 6 days in, I have HOPE. I feel like I am actually capable of taking control and making a change. It starts slow enough that if you‚Äôre already struggling with the small tasks, you won‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. The visuals are absolutely gorgeous, and there‚Äôs a ‚Äúzen mode‚Äù for completing your daily tasks that I like to use  as a meditative state which leaves me feeling a little lighter after (not much, a realistic amount, meditation isn‚Äôt a miracle worker). The app could be organised a little better, I was able to find my way around the app easily but for those that aren‚Äôt as savvy with technology it would probably be a little confusing. 
And no, I was not paid to review this, I actually came into the app store by my own will to write this. I wish this was a paid review. I could really do with some cash haha. 
I wish I could give this app more praise. More than 5 stars. I‚Äôm considering purchasing the lifetime subscription which is like $200 something, when I get the money for it. That‚Äôs how much I think this app is worth it.

title: Watch out! They will try to catch you off guard
review: So this app, depending on where or how you download it will come with either a 7 day, 30 day or even a 90 day free trial and then will charge you $40 for the year even if you will never use it if you find out it‚Äôs not for you. They do NOT send any kind of reminder of upcoming charge email likely looking to catch people not into the app off guard. (I‚Äôve checked and checked and there‚Äôs not even a confirmation of payment email even a week later. Had to find out via my monthly budgeting) Their messages eventually give a cold ‚Äúit was on your original agreement‚Äù so sorry about your bad luck. They do not answer any emails asking for refunds manually. You never speak to a real person. You get sent to a type-form survey that will only give you a refund it seems if you have just been charged within 48 hours (maybe) even if you missed it or if they could easily check to see if you ever even used the app. It would seem that good people created this app until you see how little they care about those who tried it but it didn‚Äôt work for them. Seems weird to make getting a refund so difficult and alerting your subscribers they‚Äôre about to be charged so nonexistent. If you do try this app pay close attention to which trial you signed up for.  I thought mine was 90 days since that was the trial they allowed me to share with friends but I was wrong. It was 30 days and now I‚Äôm stuck with an app that I will not use again because they send no reminder and no confirmation of payment email. Not even a partial refund for time spent. Just a full year charge and the icky taste of underhanded business practices in my mouth. Ugh.

title: I love it
review: It‚Äôs so amazing

title: Gamification of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy principles
review: Smart, effective and fun.

title: So much more than a habit app!
review:
First of all, the fabulous app is based on research, which I love. 
It has structured ‚Äújourneys‚Äù that guide you to establish habits progressively at a pace that won‚Äôt overwhelm you and cause you to give up. The habits build on each other such that establishing the one habit increases your likelihood of following through with the next habit.
Habits are grouped into ‚Äúroutines‚Äù. The morning routine helps me get out of bed and have a good productive day. The evening routine helps me wind down and sleep well. You can add more routines like afternoon, work, etc. And you can add custom habits to any routine. You can also add reminders. 
Like other habit apps, the fabulous app tracks your progress. You can look at your streak to motivate you to keep going. 
The fabulous app also gives you the tools you need for many habits. There are guided workouts, guided meditation, timers similar to the pomodoro method to study/work, bedtime stories and music to drift into sleep, and many other tools so that you can complete the habits without switching to another app. 
Also, there are optional challenges and groups you can join to get motivated by other people with the same goals. 
Overall, an amazing app that helps me everyday. I have tried many other apps to track my habits but this is the only app that guides me to do it at a pace and order that will help me succeed. My mental and physical health have significantly improved thanks to this app. 
After the free trial, you can continue to use the app for free with limited capabilities. I do think the paid version is worth the cost. It is $40 per year and you definitely get a lot out of it. But even the free version is so much better than any other app I‚Äôve tried, free and paid.

title: This app is life changing.
review: Love love.

title: 5 star
review: Great app! The Guidance is amazing

title: Stunning, beautiful, It‚Äôs perfect!
review:
First time I‚Äôve written a review on my own accord and will. 5 stars. Would rate 6 stars if I could. Guys, if you are looking for an app to keep you on track with even the most basic of daily activities (making the bed, brush teeth, drink water) 

To more complex and in depth activities (‚Äúobserve the world and be present in the moment‚Äù, golden triangle, practice self love‚Äù)

There is a ‚Äòmake me fabulous‚Äô section in the home page, where you are presented with 12 activities (none requiring purchase) such as exercise, meditate, yoga, bedtime stories, breathing, sitting and thinking deeply, stretching. 
It is done really well. Like, really well designed and highly generous in content! 

The first set of journeys, 16 of them, take weeks to accomplish each one. This is tailored to what you select in the beginning survey on your behavior and things you would like to work on. Well done and very nicely paced! 

This app is 100% ad free. Visually stunning and non-cluttered. There is no pressure to purchase a subscription, and the option is only visible from settings. So it‚Äôs not in your face, like other apps. The subscription allows you to have a little bit more customization, and more journeys. You do not need the subscription to use the app to its full potential! Which makes it very generous and caring in design.

Final thoughts, great job. You have created something that brought happy tears to my eyes when I started using it, I felt actually cared for, through its AI- learning system based on your individual behaviors and goals. 

If I could suggest one thing, it would be to add a short journal section to each day. This could be toggle-able, so you don‚Äôt have to see it if you don‚Äôt want to. The journal could provide some prompts to help you get started, like gratitude and  personal success. Then the entries could be viewed day by day via the calendar. 

Love you all, have a wonderful, fantastic day!!!

title: The Good and the Bad
review:
I first installed this app because it was promoted by the App Store. I‚Äôm a skeptical person so I did not accept the trial. I used the app without it. After a while I accepted the trial and cancelled during the period. I had backed up my progress and did everything available to the subscribed user. I knew there was no way I‚Äôd pay $50 for a yearly app subscription - until I did. 

I‚Äôm someone who gives lots of support to others craves support in return. I rarely ever get it. As pathetic as it sounds, this is what this app does for me. It reminds me and encourages me. I realize that the processes used aren‚Äôt new and it‚Äôs things I‚Äôve read in books, articles and such but that‚Äôs the whole point - getting tried and true methods at my fingertips. 

When I re-downloaded the app I really had to work to figure out how to restore my data. It‚Äôs not that it‚Äôs difficult, I just could not figure out where to look! Now that I‚Äôve found it, it almost feels like a no brainer. Restoring my progress failed many times but I‚Äôm tenacious and kept at it. 

There have been many blank letters which I kept closing the app to try restoring, however that never worked. I ended up selecting that checkbox so I can move forward. 

Every bit of progress I make with this app makes me feel like I‚Äôm winning. I‚Äôm a perfectionist so it is rather difficult for me to feel this way.

Fabulous to me is that unwavering friend and personal assistant who is pushing me to be better. Of course I have many days that I ignore her, but she‚Äôs the reason I‚Äôve started drinking water and working out three times a week.

title: Okay so far
review:
The Daily Coaching is excellent. The Habits/Routines building is also pretty good. The UI takes some getting used to. For example, the first thing in the Morning Routine is ‚Äúdrink water‚Äù but the things at the top of your Home Screen are a journal prompt and Daily Coaching. So it seems out of order. 

The Circles feature is a good idea poorly executed. Each Circle is a topic area with F*ceb**k style posts, but you get no notifications if anyone replies to your post and good luck finding your post again because only recent posts are displayed. And once you‚Äôve scrolled down to the bottom and not found your post, there‚Äôs no way to pop back to the top of the feed; you‚Äôre gonna scroll scroll scroll aaaaaall the way back up. I‚Äôm not sure how Circles is supposed to foster conversation when it‚Äôs so hard to use. You don‚Äôt even get notified if people like your post, so how are you supposed to draw encouragement if you don‚Äôt know who ‚Äúlikes‚Äù you?

There‚Äôs so much going on in this app it‚Äôs easy to get confused. For example, there‚Äôs a Challenges section, but you can‚Äôt do a Journey and a Challenge at the same time, and you‚Äôre placed in a Journey when you start using the app‚Äîso why doesn‚Äôt the app hide Challenges until you‚Äôve finished your first Journey? The app will say in one place }go slow and add one Habit and one Routine at a time,‚Äù but then in another place it presents a smorgasbord of options. Feed me one thing at a time or everything at once, but be consistent.

I‚Äôm still hoping this app will help me get my shtuff together, but so far it‚Äôs going about as well as every other life improvement app I‚Äôve ever tried, which is to say, good but not great. I do like that I can build custom routines, for example start and end workday.

title: Buggy, incohesive app with Pushy Ads for Premium
review:
This app is great when it works for its Journeys. It it slow to get from one screen to the next when you check off that you've done something as it goes through 1-4 scenes of graphics to congratulate you depending on what all you've finished.

There are a few times throughout the day that what I click on doesn't respond on the main Routine page. I need to re-open the app to get it to work again. Going to a different page and back to Routine does not work.

There are a mysterious 6 "notifications" that appear once in a while through my two weeks of use. I contacted support about it and they said it's "due to a feature they're testing." ....that seems kinda yikes to "test" something on production for that long and not take it down to bug fix.

Anyways. Being a free user is a joke for Journeys. ALL of the Second Mountain Journeys are locked behind Premium. One out of the two Third Mountain is also. This renders the main goal of the building blocks of this app a Premium Only feature.

The app also offers a 30-day pass to Premium Subscription but only through browser. Not the app. It is difficult to navigate cancelling it because of how it's set up. Very predatory ON TOP of the constant in-app ad push for Premium.

Fabulous Moments (semi-guided activities for when you want to do....well anything) are great. There is a short <10min one I liked to use called Blast Off for getting a jumpstart onto tasks. Even something as small content as that is locked to premium. Can't use it anymore after my trial was over.

Aside from these, content outside of Journeys is pretty busy.  Journeys carefully limit you from over extending yourself with Too Many Tasks, however these other sections feel like FOMO breeding grounds for all the things you COULD do that you can get added to your Routine list with your Journeys. Very counterintuitive for these to exist in the same space as a "building blocks are the key to success" type of approach.  I can see how these can (and honestly? Should.) be limited to Premium users. It's too much for a new user who doesn't really know exactly what they can learn from the app just yet. 

Anyways. I feel gross finding out I can't even do a Second Mountain, like not even one of them, on Free. It feels like they were just chaining users like me along just to either get Premium or dump the app. Like I'm not mad at the price. It seems reasonable for a well designed app (fix the UI bugs and then it'll actually be worth). The way in which they've fished me along to try to extract it from me by wasting my energy is disgusting, really. 

Insert Coin to Continue.

title: Eh
review:
This app has good intentions, and i don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs unfairly priced for what it offers. But i have some problems with it. 

1) It‚Äôs not anxiety friendly. The whole point is to reduce anxiety and stress, and set a goal right? But the app itself is loud and colorful, which some may like, but for instance: the increasing pitch of the dings between answering questions at the beginning? stressful and anxiety inducing. Little things like that nearly turned me away before starting the free trial. 

2) The set up, aesthetically, was nice (as well as the art, i loved the style). But functionally, while I didn‚Äôt encounter any bugs, the app was difficult and a little confusing to maneuver. I had some trouble understanding which day I was on? Or which day it was for each task, as I didn‚Äôt see a tally or checking system for each task. The homescreen just felt a bit cluttered to me. 

3) A bit biased, you guys were rude to my boyfriend who suffers anxiety and is also diagnosed with autism. I recommended this app because I thought it could help him, he got the trial, it didn‚Äôt work out, but he had forgotten about the free trial and was charged $40 for the membership. When he contacted you guys, saying he hadn‚Äôt meant to subscribe, you wouldn‚Äôt give him a refund, saying it was his fault. That‚Äôs not okay at all. All you did was stress him out even more, when the whole point of your app is to be a stress reliever, and to help out your customer. Well he didn‚Äôt like the app, it wasn‚Äôt right for him, he didn‚Äôt mean to do the membership, and you basically told him ‚Äútough luck‚Äù. Not cool at all. Give him his refund. 

Conclusion: Even though the art is aesthetically pleasing, and the app itself seems very inviting; I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app for anyone with high anxiety or stress. It could be good if you‚Äôre generally neurotypical, and/or can handle sudden or loud noises and bright distracting color palettes. But if you‚Äôre on the spectrum at all, I‚Äôd say to proceed with caution and use at your own comfort.

title: Annoying features
review:
Update: 
I paid for the subscription for a year. I‚Äôm really disappointed. The pop up after completing a task is so intrusive. Then they prompt you to share. It‚Äôs like they are trying to force a paid subscriber to advertise for them. There is no way to turn off the setting. I finally deleted the app and found one that didn‚Äôt force me to sit through a pointless pop up. I was going to the point to where I didn‚Äôt want to use the app. At times it would show a badge but have nothing to show me. Just all around intrusive. Customer service was of not help. They acted like they had no idea what I was talking about with the animation pop up screen after completing a task. 
It‚Äôs a great interface but not worth the hassle. Let users complete and move on or at least have the option to remove that feature. 

~~~~~~~~
I love this app it‚Äôs really terrific except a few things. When you complete something the app pops up with this thing for you to share and there‚Äôs no way to stop this from happening. Then it will remind you about completing your circles. Sometimes I get a badge on the app for no reason. Can‚Äôt figure out what the reason is and sometimes it stays for days. Customer service is only half helpful. I‚Äôve contacted them twice now and neither tome did I get really good help. No solution to my issues except things I told them I already tried. 

Aside from that the app has been helpful and I enjoy using it daily. Especially on days when my self care is not good. Reminds me to do important things for myself.
developerResponse: {'id': 13568573, 'body': "Hi\xa0there, we're sorry to hear about your experience with the pop ups after completing a task. Your feedback will be taken into consideration. If you have additional feedback, then please share it with us at hello@thefabulous.co", 'modified': '2020-02-18T22:13:47Z'}

title: THIS APP SCARRED ME
review:
So I downloaded this app after seeing an ad on Tik-Tok. It seemed like a great concept, I figured it could help me keep up with healthy habits and routines. Once I downloaded the first thing I decided to try was the morning routine, where my challenge was to drink water first thing when I woke up. It would‚Äôve been more motivating if it had said a certain amount of water. I appreciate starting small but I could literally take one sip of water and check off the box for completing that task for the day. It wasn‚Äôt very gratifying and didn‚Äôt feel like an accomplishment. The second part of the routine was doing a one minute breathing exercise. I expected it the exercise to just pop up after that prompt but it didn‚Äôt. I had to search through the app for a breathing routine and the shortest one was 5 minutes. All of that is allot for me when I‚Äôm half awake. So I do the routine and while the narrator‚Äôs voice was nice she was talking so fast it actually gave me anxiety instead of relaxing me. I could barely even keep up with her instructions. 

Day two: ‚Äúlet me try something else‚Äù, I thought. So I chose the anxiety reduction challenge. The first day I was supposed to write down ways I avoid anxiety. Done. Then it made me choose an activity amongst a few things. One was a mirror pep talk and the other was based on holding myself accountable if I don‚Äôt complete the challenge. Kind of weird and aggressive. 

The final and most HORRIBLE part of the app were the stories to choose from! I picked a story that said under the title ‚Äúit pays to be kind‚Äù. Thought it would be cute. The story starts out relaxing. The voice is great. Then it goes on to talk about the protagonist who kills dogs, makes amputees with magic to spite his competitor, has slaves, and in the end of the story kills someone who stole his ring AFTER MARRYING A 16 YEAR OLD GIRL. I can‚Äôt make this stuff up y‚Äôall. I couldn‚Äôt sleep for an hour after listening to the story. I have 5 days left in the free trial so I might continue to use some of the sounds to sleep but I definitely won‚Äôt risk listening to another disturbing story. 

My last comment is just that the app pressures you to share with your friends or challenge your friends many times throughout the duration of one use. It gets really annoying. The idea for the app is great but the layout is too complex and the actual processes to build habits are to simple. It needs more development. AND TAKE OFF THE DISTURBING STORIES!

title: Not Fabulous Billing
review:
I purchased this app over a year ago. No problem with the app but found that I wasn‚Äôt using it. So I canceled it a few months into my membership. I just got billed for the annual membership a year later 29.99 + .30 ATM fee ?. Hard to find customer service number.Don‚Äôt really respond to my emails.
Responded to my bank when they contested charge but still not resolved.

title: Great app
review: I really do love the app. I have my whole family using it. But most importantly to me. I just put down simple habits. And I usually over plan make my to do list way too big and in turn it discourages me. This Application has helped me find simple foundational things that will help me On my good, OK, and rough days.The one thing I wish there was is a better start up tutorial. Just really understanding how much you can do on this app and what‚Äôs a good way to go about it. And if you‚Äôre in the middle of the app how do you go back to the beginning of it to make sure you didn‚Äôt miss important functions are keys that make the app even better.

title: Find Another Self Help App
review: If you‚Äôre switching from android to IOS or vice versa, expect to lose all your money because since I switched, I have not been able to restore my premium (one year) purchase which I purchased A MONTH AGO. I was given the week long free trial once I logged onto the app on my iPhone which expired yesterday and through excruciating trial and error and going back and forth through FAQs, I have yet to find a solution. I‚Äôm honestly really upset about it because I really enjoyed this app and saw genuine growth with myself. But it really seems like a scam at this point. Don‚Äôt buy. Don‚Äôt even try. find another self help app.

title: Jessa11905
review: I love this app it helps a lot and starts off small

title: Nice intention, but it‚Äôs all over the place
review: I saw this recommended on a popular YouTube channel I like so I thought I‚Äôd try it out. But very quickly this app is bewildering and difficult to navigate. I just wanted to track drinking more water and getting more sleep, but was constantly inundated with a barrage of ‚Äúcircles‚Äù and strangers supposedly sending me well-wishes on my progress and ten different windows and animations and video game-like maps that just make it a big fabulous mess. I just want a simple progress tracker with some helpful tips, not a cult-like quagmire of animations and noise and ‚Äúmoments‚Äù all smashed together in no consistent order. For all this trouble I would pay a subscription fee to boot? No thanks. A cleaner layout with less obtrusive graphics and giving ME the choice to just track my progress or get the whole feel-good mess of material would be preferred.

title: Charged and then Info Deleted
review:
Do not download this app unless you‚Äôre committed to using it for a year. 

The first week of June I saw an ad for Fabulous on Instagram, went to their website and was interested in doing a free trial. Before the end of the 7 day free trial, my account was charged. I noticed that same day and immediately requested reimbursement because I did not enjoy the app and was planning on canceling the subscription before I was supposed to be charged for the full annual rate of $39.99. 

I never heard back but I kept the app to keep proof of the charge on my account. Now a week later, I tried to reach out to the contact team again and got an automated response and my information has been deleted from the app even though I have technically paid for an (unwanted) annual subscription. 

I have been getting notifications that I can‚Äôt turn off for some reason and daily emails offering me different deals on other/better ‚Äúfree‚Äù trials. 

I really wanted to love this app but the lack of customer service and messaging trying to ‚Äúget me back‚Äù in marketing emails has completely turned me off.

title: IMPOSSIBLE TO CANCEL!
review:
This looks like a wonderful app. However, during my free trial period,I decided that the habit-building exercises are pretty similar to another program I am doing with my husband. So I have tried to send an email requesting cancellation, but their email is from a ‚Äúno reply ‚Äúaddress. I‚Äôve gone to the help and feedback section on the app, but all their instructions for cancellation have me going around in endless circles. Since I am in the trial period, my iPhone is not showing any active subscriptions to cancel. I do not wish for the premium charge to hit my account and then try to go through whatever steps would be needed to get a refund, if I can even do that. So if the developers are reading this message, please make it easier to cancel the free trial subscription, pretty please.

UPDATE 6/23/21: I sent a message to a Customer Support email address I discovered over two weeks ago and have yet to receive any response to my email. Therefore, I have reduced my rating to one star. The people behind this app are totally non-responsive and now that they have my credit card number, the renewal of this app will probably continue in perpetuity.

title: I like
review: Is my fifth day using it. Loving the fabulous time. Loving the organization and all the colors. All the tips. The informational short readings. Teaching me why things not just commanding me to do things. You don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on at first but you get the hang on it fast. I like that I can add my pin things and also follow the guides. I love the story. I love how relaxing it is. Cleaning is stress and rushed and usually a fight. But now is relaxing and productive.

title: Overwhelmed and frustrated
review: I have been emailing them since June 13th since you cannot speak to an actual human. Today is June 21st and I still cannot reach anyone that can hear me out. I initially signed up online. After answering questions about myself it prompted me to download the app. Once I downloaded the app it took me through the same process which I thought was odd. After a few days I was very overwhelmed by the app. I struggle with clutter and I felt like the app was just very cluttered. I immediately went to my settings and canceled the subscription so that I would not be charged for the year. On Sunday June 13 I get an email from PayPal stating fabulous has charged me 39.99 I panicked and was so confused because I knew I canceled it. I went to my app and I could not cancel it because I had already canceled. I started to try to find the fabulous customer service number only to be led down a rabbit hole of automated responses. After speaking with my app customer service I realized I was signed up under two different emails which I obviously did not realize I had done or else I would have canceled both in time. This has been a very frustrating situation. I just want a human to hear my Situation and not an automated response.

title: Be aware
review: I tested this app and cancelled within the week of my free trial period.  I just wanted to try it and found it did not meet my needs. However I was still charged the 39.99 for a year‚Äôs subscription.  However, my Apple subscriptions shows it as cancelled. I went on line to check out the company and found that they are more interested in making money than they are interested in helping you organize your life.

title: Love my new life - still much work to do.
review: I had suspicions. How could an app truly help me? Guide me? Center me? And yet when I didn‚Äôt know what I needed to hear, Fabulous had the words I needed. Every.single.time. As a newly divorced, pandemic-challenged, relocated and very alone 59 year old, I wanted to burn everything I knew - particularly my bad habits- and rebuild anew from the ashes. Fabulous appeared when I needed it. And I am grateful.

title: Ok app
review:
I would like to give this app more stars but I keep encountering the same problems and the help area doesn‚Äôt reach my concerns. First off, this app is great for instilling good habits. I did a free trial with premium and I loved the inspirational quotes and the map that show your progress. I really felt I was taking better care of myself.

Whenever I try to log into the app I enter my password and nothing happens. It‚Äôs just the loading circle. I end up having to close the app and reopen just to interact with my challenges or journey.
 Also, I got charged $39.99 recently. No idea why this charge occurred. I wasn‚Äôt at the end of a free trial. I also am not getting premium access. Not sure why that happened.
This app has potential to be great but those issues for me makes me not want to have the app anymore.

title: Inspirational
review: Since using this app I‚Äôve managed to wake up @6am daily and practice a much better, more productive morning routine. I love that I can set reminders for my goals and the app holds you accountable. You cannot move forward until you‚Äôve completed certain task. Definitely keeps me focus. To anyone reading this and thinking about downloading, DO IT & TRUST THE PROCESS

title: Fun Way to Your Beat Self
review: I am in the midst of cancer treatment and trying to find a way to stay healthy and positive‚Ä¶ I believe I found it! By step guidance and support to move myself toward a healthier,  happier, more alive, productive & present me.Give it a try; you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD - STOLE MY MONEY
review: I downloaded this app and did the free trial but cancelled my subscription before the start date because I was no longer interested. A month later I see a charge for $39.99 on my card from this app. I googled it and this is a common scam done by this app. I emailed them and still no reply. I double checked that I cancelled my subscription (I know I‚Äôm not perfect and it could‚Äôve been my mistake) but it was fully cancelled. I even deleted the app from my phone so I have no idea why or how I got charged for the annual premium. Be very careful if you download this app! I still have not received a reply or my money back.

title: DO NOT DOWNLOAD
review:
Like many other users, I downloaded this app to test the 7-day free trial. I unsubscribed on the Apple subscription page 3-4 days before it would renew for the annual subscription but was still charged $39.99 TWICE. They also make it impossible to access the premium subscription you paid for. Biggest UX issue is there is no login page! They make you go through a whole process to get an email to access your account. I followed the instructions on their FAQ/Notion page to access the premium membership and come to find I don‚Äôt have premium and need to sign up AGAIN. This app will take you straight to their ‚Äúquiz‚Äù to loop you in to pay for the app... 

Don‚Äôt trust the ‚Äúfree trial.‚Äù I‚Äôm out $80 with no access to this ‚Äúlife changing‚Äù app.

title: Building healthy habits!
review: So far I have developed a habit of drinking water first thing in the morning but it is really difficult to perform exercise every single morning after waking up.Still working on it .

title: Glitch lead to me feeling like it‚Äôs a scam.
review: Just got an Apple Watch as a gift and downloaded the app, signed up for the week trail with the intention of paying for the year because it seemed motivational. The app absolutely will not work on the Apple Watch, even after taking the time to make sure all my software is up to dat and restarting many times. The app on my phone tells me to email their costumer support so I did. I get an automated email response telling me to log the complaint through the app because the email is unmonitored, so I do. I do not hear back. I tried to log another help request and now the website they use for that is giving me a 404 error code making it impossible to reach their costumer support. In the mean time I spent some time reading reviews and a lot of people are having issues with glitches and unsubscribing with the same ‚Äúto bad so sad‚Äù corporate response in response. So all in all I did my best to unsubscribe and delete the app and am praying it doesn‚Äôt try to charge me anyways. Very sad because I was excited to use it and thought it had a good concept and fun interface, despite the art style being non-cohesive.
