title: Scam free trial - just a way to get your $39.99
review: BEWARE - there‚Äôs no way to contact customer service, there‚Äôs no way to get your funds returned - kiss your $$ goodbye if you don‚Äôt like their app. I signed up for the free trial & cancelled through the app 3 days before the 7 day trial was over. On day 7, I received a notice from payment company that I was charged $39.99. I was unable to find any way to contact the company (except for tech problems). My emails to the techs have gone unanswered.

title: BE AWARE OF CHARGES AFTER CANCELLATION
review: I downloaded the app at the beginning of April and decided it wasn‚Äôt for me. I cancelled my free trial the day after I downloaded it. My subscription in Apple shows that it was cancelled and expired on April 7th. However, lo and behold, on April 30th I got a $39.99 charge for the subscription. There is no way to contact the company about wrongful charges (the website just tells you they can‚Äôt refund you), and no way to confirm that your subscription is cancelled so you won‚Äôt be charged again. I have the proof right in my phone, but there‚Äôs nothing I can do about it. Total scam - downloader beware!!

title: Suggestion: Less is More
review:
I‚Äôve had this app for a few months and as a young professional working from home with ADHD, I would love to stick with this to help with all my bad habits but it‚Äôs just sensory overload x10000000. Less is more. I could do without all the extra animations, sounds, homepage clutter, and long philosophical app notifications. For something that is supposed to bring me clarity and focus I just end up feeling overwhelmed which leads me to not even open the app. 

The UI is great for a video game or maybe something targeting grade school children but it‚Äôs a bit much for me and probably others as well with the same brain function.

I signed up because I was enjoying the app, but after a few days the premium features ended and the app was showing me that I had the basic account again. When the end of the 30-days came, I had set a reminder for myself to cancel, but there was no way for me to cancel because my app told me I had a basic account. My only option was to upgrade. So I figured that my subscription was canceled. 
Turns out that I got charged $39.99. When I tried to contact someone to help me, no one responded for TWENTY days! And now they are telling me that I can‚Äôt get a refund, even though it was due to a technical issue that I couldn‚Äôt cancel.
DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD INFO or they will scam you like they did to me.

title: App didn‚Äôt function for months, developer unwilling to resolve the issue
review:
Dear Fab-  I updated you. I redownloaded you.  I reset you from setting just like they told me to. So.many. Times. I read you poetry and sang you songs. I gave you the last piece of Thanksgiving pie. But until two days ago, you refused to even show me my setting, coaching, or journey screen. Nada but white. Customer service guy says our difficulties was all me,  but he also said he had no answers and would chat with the developer, so I know the problem wasn‚Äôt just me. Fabulous, it could have been lovely!  I will miss you but I need a more reliable partner!  

When I first started using the premium app it was fine. Then it stopped recording my streaks. I emailed fabulous but did not hear back. After 37 days, this deflated my feeling fabulous bubble. I drifted away from the app after that because it kept loosing my streaks.  It‚Äôs a silly thing, but it felt Ike a letdown when your hard work is lost. 

Flash forward by the fall. I thought that I would give it another try, so I started being Fabulous again. The app had some nice improvements like daily coaching. And then the app stopped working completely on my iPhone 7+. I only got blank white screens. I reached out to Fabulous and, well, customer service has been unfabulous. 

 We had the regular update and reinstall conversations. I continued to dutifully send my screenshots showing the issue. Customer service says he will chat with the developer. We go back and forth. Two months pass with several email. Finally, after the last update, and almost three months, I can see all my Fabulous screen! I reach out and request that Fabulous extend my subscription to make up for the fact that the app didn‚Äôt work for almost 3 months of the year. First, customer service tells me that they cannot do that there is no way. When I call iTunes they reassured me that this was not the fact. Every developer can issue a courtesy code. I circle back to CS and let him know it is possibility for them to issue a code so that I can continue to use Fabulous, a subscription that I have paid for. I am told Fab won‚Äôt extend my subscription because he told me to update the app. I‚Äôm confused because that was the first thing he told me to do and the first thing I did. I even sent him an email about it.

If that is the type of journey you want to be on, Fabulous may be the app for you: unreliable app and uneven customer support. Take your chances. If it goes badly, it could be Fabulous.

Update: the customer service fellow and I are in touch. He says he will see if they can extend my subscription but it may take a few weeks to find out. Will fabulous be fabulous or it is just trying to keep me in the hook?

Update: after over eight emails, and waiting four weeks to hear ‚Äúwhat they decided‚Äù I was offered a code for three months to cover the time my app was not working. The simple (SIMPLE) right thing‚Äîyet the amount of work to encourage Fabulous to follow through leaves me with less than a glowing review of their customer service. Now that I get to try the app I am not sure I want to love it; not excited to support a company with their level of customer service. We will see if they change my mind or I switch to Shine.

title: Difficulty restoring paid account, slow customer service, good content
review:
Update 1/24/21

Customer service got back to me and resolved the issue promptly.

Overall, I love the app‚Äôs simplicity, both in design and the starting program of habit building. The community element is also welcome. I love the app‚Äôs ‚Äúgamification‚Äù of habit building too.

I‚Äôd give five stars if they made the transferring of your account to new devices more convenient and seamless.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Overall, the app content is good, but I‚Äôm rating the app one star because of unresponsive customer service for premium subscribers and difficulty restoring paid subscriptions when switching devices.

After upgrading from an older iPhone to a new one, I lost access to my premium subscription, so I lost all my saved info and do not have access to all the features. This issue seems common enough since there is a section in their FAQ on how to address this, but none of the steps listed worked for me. I also logged in and out of the app, and deleted and reinstalled the app with no success in restoring my premium account. It seems like others have encountered similar issues.

I subscribed to the app from a website, and it seems that restoring your account from a website is not as seamless as restoring access if you subscribed via the app store. There is no convenient existing user login page on the app or on their main website. I had to search for the existing user login page on a web browser to log in. While this is mildly inconvenient, because I do not have access to my account, I have to log in as a first time user and retake the onboarding survey each time, which only takes a minute or two but still frustrating when you have a paid account with them. 

The FAQ also states that they cannot port over subscriptions from Android to iOS, so this might also be an issue for premium subscribers that end up switching to a different OS. In my case, I upgraded from an old iPhone 6s to a new iPhone 12 Pro Max, but I have not been successful in restoring my subscription and saved data. 

Customer service has not yet responded to my issue; I emailed them about 10 days ago from this writing. I received a generic message from them stating that they are receiving a high volume of requests at the moment. I don‚Äôt know what the average wait time for a response would be, but, again, this feels like a lot for people that paid for the subscription. 

The gist of this is: I paid money for a subscription, and I‚Äôm bummed out because I don‚Äôt have access to what I‚Äôm paying for. It seems other subscribers have had problems too, so for anyone that is planning on paying for the premium service and upgrading their device or switching between iOS and Android, you may have similar issues.

I was pleased with the content of the app, and I felt that the price was fair. I‚Äôd happily rate them higher if I can get my issues resolved.

But the trouble of getting access to my paid account and slow customer service response time may cause me to cancel and get a partial refund if I don‚Äôt get this resolved soon.

title: DO NOT PURCHASE - YOU CAN‚ÄôT CANCEL
review:
There‚Äôs something really fishy with this app. First of all, I got the trial. I cancelled it back in July (I have the proof in my App Store subscriptions). But they just charged me $49.99 a few days ago!

When I contacted customer support for a refund, they basically said, ‚ÄúSorry, can‚Äôt help you. You‚Äôve got to go through the App Store.‚Äù But... the App Store didn‚Äôt show that I had an active subscription, neither did it show my purchase of $49.99. WHERE IS THIS TRANSACTION COMING FROM??

THEN, I went to their website, and, hey! I‚Äôve got an active subscription. WTH? If you get a subscription through the App Store, it should show up there. How can I dispute it through the App Store if the only record of my subscription is on your website? Pretty sure that‚Äôs fraudulent. And then they want to tell me they can‚Äôt issue a refund because the purchase is through the App Store. Well, which is it? I don‚Äôt have an active subscription in the App Store, but somehow it‚Äôs still active on your website. 

I eventually had to dispute the transaction through my bank because Fabulous clearly doesn‚Äôt care about their customers. Really frustrating.

title: If staring at blank screens is calming to you...
review:
I love the idea behind this app, but it isn‚Äôt what I‚Äôve received so far. I‚Äôm subscribed to the premium version at this point, have had this app for just under a year, and this is my second time giving this app a go because I /really/ want it to work. But, this app loads a blank screen over over 90% of the time when I open it. I open and close the app‚Äîopen and close‚Äîwait, open, wait, close, wait‚Äînothing. I don‚Äôt have this issue with any other app, and I can run netflix and spotify etc no problem. Ive even deleted and redownloaded the app, which brought on new problems, but no fix.When I first wrote to customer service, explaining the glitch and that I really wanted to fix this(among other issues), but that if that wasn‚Äôt possible or if the app was incompatible with my phone(iphone), I‚Äôd just unsubscribe. They emailed back and only addressed my last sentence about unsubscribing and how I could go about it. I replied asking for some help/guidance with the glitch and never got a response. There was some evidence this app wasn‚Äôt built from a foundation of responding to people‚Äôs issues: the founder tells a story of sharing an early version of the app with an influential friend, who said he liked it but found a glitch/shortsighted issue with one of their main features. The founder is initially crestfallen, but then decides that it, err, makes total sense that that aspect...shouldn‚Äôt be user friendly...because the app is not a simple ‚Äötool,‚Äò no‚Äîbut an ‚Äûinstrument.‚Äú Jesus Christ. Specifically, it‚Äôs the world‚Äôs tiniest violin, which doesn‚Äôt give much of hoot whether you‚Äôre able/unable to use the program/app. Give it a bit before you invest any money into it, just to make sure your quality stays good before you purchase. I loved the app, until I got deeper and the app never loaded properly again.

I‚Äôll update this if anything changes. Best of luck!

update: went back to double check and the customer service team still has not gotten back to me in three months. Just don‚Äôt get this app.

title: Disappointing
review:
This app has so much potential, but it‚Äôs just not in a great place yet. The language is inconsistent, the challenges and routines lack organization, and the educational piece frequently doesn‚Äôt download. For something that is supposed to improve efficiency, I spend more time trying to figure it out and subsequently becoming frustrated to reap any benefits. I did the free trial- and was confused but thought that by purchasing Premium it would get better. It got worse! I reached out because I wanted a refund (literally this app has caused more negativity than its worth) and was directed to a website with 12 options for requesting a refund. As it turns out, NONE OF THE 12 OPTIONS ALLOW FOR A REFUND. 

This app has potential but it‚Äôs just not there- and unfortunately for anyone who is looking for education, structure, and true improvement, this app is going to actually make things worse. 

I guess I am out $35.99 and have this ridiculous app for a year.

The first day you have the app you‚Äôre encouraged to add habits daily and you need to remember you can say no to the app you‚Äôre allowed to procrastinate adding new habits and you don‚Äôt have to fill all the slots. title: WARNING PLEASE READ
review:
Honestly the concept of this app is brilliant .

It has helped me enormously

I have had this app in the past, and I just recently got it back because I‚Äôm not crazy busy with my life right now. But please be warned, it doesn‚Äôt seem or look sketchy at all, until you actually read into it. I was charged $49.99 for a premium subscription I didn‚Äôt even ask for. And it was horrible trying get a hold of these people who didn‚Äôt even give me a refund.

The strange thing is, these guys not only don‚Äôt have a phone number or an email address, their own support page doesn‚Äôt work! If you have questions that aren‚Äôt answered by their very udimentary FAQ, they invite you to submit your question‚Äî-except the entire submit page is grayed out!

This app would get five stars for me if there was a way to contact actual human beings and get actual answers. Some of the stuff in the app is very tricky, not self evident and or clear and extremely frustrating . Guys you‚Äôd really benefit from putting a couple of scheckles into customer service.

If you‚Äôre fine getting absolutely no support, want the risk of being finned for a subscription, not being able to contact the people who run this app and to get answers to questions you most certainly will have‚Äîthen by all means get it .  

I for one think we will never make a change in the way these companies do business if we don‚Äôt insist on customer service and refuse to give high marks and ratings to companies who clearly don‚Äôt think the customer matters.

And Fabulous‚Äî if you‚Äôre listening, which I doubt‚Äîthat is EXACTLY the message you‚Äôre sending and we all get it loud and clear

It‚Äôs not an accident that you have no five star reviews. Try responding to customers and see what that does to your ratings ‚Äî
I‚Äôm guessing you‚Äôll be pleasantly surprised

We're constantly working to improve how to best assist Fabulous users. title: Ever heard of a pyramid scam? This is it in a friendly application form
review: To start, YOU CAN ONLY DO ONE THING AT A TIME. by default, it‚Äôs drink water three times a day. I‚Äôm not sure about anyone else but that‚Äôs kind of a no brainer for me. If I‚Äôm thirsty drink water, or grab an espresso, or whatever. Also I‚Äôm sure you drink water more than three times a day. Now your probably wondering why am I going on about water this water that. Well it‚Äôs pretty much by default an abstract app to remind you to drink water three times a day. So the app is about one task at a time(water), three times a day which makes up 10% of the app. The other 90% is pyramid scamming. It harasses you to invite everyone in your contacts, Facebook, other social networks to drink water with you. That‚Äôs it. Pay their $15.00 fee each month. It‚Äôs an stupid over glorified alarm clock which your by default clock does a better job. Now I‚Äôm sure I know exactly what your looking for. Either a habit tracker, or a efficient reminder app or possibly a productivity application. I‚Äôve spent nearly 70 hours testing over 200 apps. Crawling through Reddit posts and google searches. Also I want to say that in no way am I being paid to write this or spending so much time looking for the perfect, reasonably priced application for being productive and managing your time. However, I‚Äôve narrowed it down to ‚ÄúHABITIFY‚Äù you can search it in the App Store. This is the one app you need. This one isn‚Äôt what your looking for. The one that you are looking for is ‚ÄúHABITIFY‚Äù again I‚Äôm not being paid to endorse this product but am writing this to save you so much time and to pass on my work instead of keeping it to myself. So anyways, I hope you great productivity in the short future!

title: Great App So Far!
review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for almost 2 weeks now and I can honestly say it actually works! I‚Äôm sure part of it is because you already need to have a mindset that you want to add and/or change certain habits which makes it easier to stick with it, but this app really does help!

I‚Äôve found that every day I make it a goal to try and complete all the habits and challenges I have on the app. The ‚ÄúFabulous Moments‚Äù, ‚ÄúMotivators‚Äù, and little readings here and there make the app more interesting, interactive, and fun to use. There are days when I don‚Äôt feel like completing certain tasks and usually I just force myself to complete it and feel much better after. However, even on those days when I‚Äôm not able to complete everything, the app sort of teaches you that it‚Äôs okay if you can‚Äôt do everything that day so long as you tried your best is all that matters and that helps so much with your mental state because you become more motivated to complete all the tasks the next day.

This app (if used daily and as intended) can help you go from being a lazy person who feels as though they have unproductive days to a person that feels accomplished because they completed all their tasks that day. I really like this app and think I will definitely use it long term to complete my personal goals.

My only issue is that because I was one of the first to use it, I was gifted 50% off my 12-month subscription. However, when I go to purchase it, instead of $24.99 the price states it‚Äôs $49.99. If there was a way for the developers to fix that, then I would definitely go ahead and purchase the 12-month subscription!

title: Fabulous is Fabulous!
review: Starting the trial I was convinced that I wouldn‚Äôt sign up for the subscription. $40.00 for the year seemed too pricey for me. But once i started,I knew I had to go forward. It is worth the money averaging out around $3 bucks per month! I made the decision that I don‚Äôt want to live another year saying i want to do these things and don‚Äôt. Within one week, I already feel physically better. This app helps establish healthy habits & makes it fun, fulfilling, & rewarding along way! The app is designed so well. i just got asked, because my opinion matters to them - what new habits would i like to see created on the app. I would suggest starting slow on your habits/ challenges you want to start doing. Plus the app won‚Äôt let you select some which is doing you a favor so you don‚Äôt put too much on your self. Its about creating habits that stick. I love Fabulous!

title: a life-changer!
review: I've been using Fabulous for a few years, and the investment in a Sphere subscription is definitely worth every cent. Want to lose weight? There's a journey for that. Want to break your sugar habit? There's a journey for that, too. Want to learn how to meditate? How to exercise without killing your body and motivation? How to stay on task at work? How to see things in a more positive light? There are journeys for all that and more, plus articles, challenges, recipes, exercises, infographics, and much, MUCH more. I do miss the Habit Heads feature from the Android version, but that's Apple's limitation, not the app's. Definitely recommended for anyone who's looking for a warm, supportive environment to grow, learn, and improve.
